story:
The Spirit of Mawson

THE AUSTRALASIAN ANTARCTIC EXPEDITION 2013-2014

Let’s get more students down to Antarctica

2013-2014 marks the centenary of the Australasian Antarctic Expedition led by the great scientist and explorer Sir Douglas Mawson. In a celebration of this remarkable endeavour, the new Australasian Antarctic Expedition (or AAE for short) will follow the route of its namesake, melding science and adventure, to discover and communicate the changes that have taken place in this remote environment over the last hundred years. Led by Professor Chris Turney and Dr Chris Fogwill, from the University of New South Wales, Sydney, the 2013-2014 expedition will work its way across the Southern Ocean and attempt to reach the original AAE Base at Cape Denison, Antarctica, at the enigmatically named ‘Home of the Blizzard’.

The Antarctic expeditions of old would routinely advertise for applicants to join them in the south. Exciting – and often wonderfully sensational – proclamations would be placed in the broadsheets, appealing to national sense of duty to scientifically explore the newly discovered continent in the Southern Ocean. Posting calls in the press helped team leaders fill key positions in their party while also maintaining a high public profile, crucial for raising much needed funds. Mawson was no exception in this regard. Adverts for the original Australasian Antarctic Expedition included open meetings in state capitals and an appeal by Shackleton in the British newspapers. The public responded enthusiastically to the scale of the expedition: four bases spread out along a near-unknown Antarctic coastline. Here was a venture everyone could get involved in, either directly as a team member or by sponsoring essential supplies and equipment.

Inspired by the efforts of Mawson and his men to communicate their scientific findings to a public hungry to learn more, we recently advertised for 4 PhD positions to join the expedition. Applicants had to send in a two-minute YouTube movie clip to tell us why they wanted to join the expedition and how they would help convey our discoveries to the rest of the world. The response has been overwhelming. The deadline has now passed and 67 applications have been received. We have been blown away by the quality of the films while the range of expertise and nationality is simply fantastic; we have applications from around the world including Australasia, the USA, Chile and Europe, promising a fabulous international mix on board our vessel, the MS Shokalskiy. We are incredibly excited about helping support a new generation keen to communicate our results with the rest of the world. We would love to take more students south but just don’t have the funds. Given the scale of interest we are keen to offer more PhD students the opportunity of joining us on the expedition, but to do this we need financial support. The aim of this Indiegogo campaign is to raise enough money to support four more PhD students the chance to come to the Antarctic with us!

What We Need & What You Get

To extend the number of students we can take south with us, we need to cover the costs of two berths on the second leg of the expedition at $16,900 AUD each, totaling some $27,800 AUD. We really hope that you can help us reach our target, but if we undershoot at least we will be able to give some more students the chance of a lifetime to come south with us on this unique expedition!

The concept of crowd funding with Indiegogo harks back to Mawson‘s original Antarctic expedition one hundred years ago, where many expedition items — including huskies, tents and sleeping bags — were funded by schools and public donations from across the world! To attract potential supporters we are able to offer a number of unique gifts and perks, ranging from limited edition t-shirts, exclusive photographic prints and signed books.

The Impact

The Australasian Antarctic Expedition 2013-2014 is all about adventure, exploration, scientific discovery, and importantly communication. The AAE aims to engage with a broad audience live from Antarctica and the Southern Ocean throughout the expedition. Through a variety of media, including Google+ Hangouts on Air, Twitter, Instagram and YouTube, we will broadcast live using the latest satellite technology to support live streaming from Antarctica.  

The Antarctic remains one of the last great unexplored regions on our planet. In spite of over a century of discovery – including aerial and satellite surveys – remarkably little of this great continent has been explored on the ground. Crucially this pristine southern polar region is uniquely placed to monitor the health of our planet. The Australasian Antarctic Expedition (AAE) will focus its efforts on the Antarctic Commonwealth Bay and subantarctic islands to provide the first complete snapshot of this region for a century.

The AAE has identified a team of scientists who are world experts in the natural and physical sciences while also being passionate about science communication. The research programmes to be undertaken include:

1. Oceanography: The Southern Ocean plays a crucial role in global climate and the carbon cycle. 90% of the world’s excess heat trapped by the atmosphere is going into the ocean and changing circulation patterns, threatening to turn the region into a source of carbon, exaggerating future warming. The AAE will make detailed measurements on the passage south (e.g. temperature, salinity, carbon) to determine just how sensitive the Southern Ocean is to change.

2. Climate: The ‘screaming sixties’, the ‘furious fifties’ and the ‘roaring forties’ filled sailors of old with dread. And yet these fearsome westerly winds are migrating inexorably southwards taking warmer water with them, threatening the stability of Antarctic ice. The AAE will collect peat, ice and rock samples to place satellite data in the context of the past millennia.

3. Biology: Recent expeditions to the Southern Ocean and Antarctica continue to report the discovery of thousands of new species, while living and ‘fossil’ animal and plant remains provide a sensitive measure of the changing environment. The AAE will observe, document and monitor the wildlife above and below the Antarctic ice, giving new insights into this unexplored region.

By supporting our campaign you will be helping us achieve our goal of conveying science in real time from one of the most extreme and challenging environments on our planet. The students will help support science on the ice, providing a unique perspective for understanding and communicating change in the Southern Ocean and Antarctica.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whilst not everyone can contribute directly to this campaign, we would love you to join us on the AAE. For more information of how to join the expedition either virtually or in person please go to www.spiritofmawson.com. Please spread the word with your friends, either through our web page, or with the Indiegogo share tools!!!

environments on our planet. The students will help support science on the ice, providing
a unique perspective for understanding and communicating change in the Southern
Ocean and Antarctica.
Other Ways You Can Help
Whilst
not everyone can contribute directly to this campaign, we would love you to
join us on the AAE. For more information of how to join the expedition either
virtually or in person please go to www.spiritofmawson.com. Please spread the word
with your friends, either through our web page, or with the Indiegogo share
tools!!!

story:
I am Zhanygul Kaparova from Kyrgyzstan, a student of American University in Central Asia.

The conferences I am eager to participate in are organized by International Cultural Diplomacy organization and Model United Nations that aim to develop international cooperation and diplomacy by building dialogues for better understanding and breaking the stereotypes. 

I study international law, and want to become a diplomat in future. I already started my journey on building international peace-building and mutual understanding in order to make our world united and sustainably developed for future generations with my activities in international organizations as AIESEC and Rotary, university clubs and by attending other international Model UNs, and these conferences will be a great experience for me to learn about diplomacy and bridge-building on a completely different level and implement my knowledge for future profession. 

I would be honoured to represent Kyrgyzstan in these conferences and introduce more people our Central Asian world. I will give a presentation about my country and share my knowledge and experience, and moreover would like to share with the knowledge gained upon returning home, to open the potential inKyrgyz youth to become those who might change the world one day!

I have already collected some funding,but I need at least 200$more, and  would highly appreciate any help!

story:
Seeking to raise funds for 12 week, 40+hr/week bootcamp style education in web development

Beginning June 2nd, I will be attending MakerSquare, a local web development bootcamp.  The program will last 12 weeks, which will include 40 hours per week of instruction, as well as additional evening & weekend activities.  All told, I plan to spend at least 60 hours per week learning web development.  The program begins June 2nd and runs through August.

The program costs $13,880.  Living expenses will cost about $4,500 over 3 months.  The total is $18,380.  I already have $7,000, however I will need $11,000 more in order to cover the tuition payment, living expenses, and the fee IndieGogo charges.

Why learn at a web development bootcamp like MakerSquare?

The guidance provided at a web development bootcamp will accelerate my ability to make it through the steepest part of the learning curve.  It will also make my future self-directed study more effective, because I will have learned the best way to find solutions to problems/challenges I encounter when coding. 

 I will learn the thought process and problem structuring that is fundamental to being a developer.  Working with professionals will also expose me to professional conventions in software development and important tangential concepts, such as better understanding databases, servers, and operating systems.

 Learning web development on my own has been a slow and tedious process, without any guidance through the vast maze of information, much of it outdated.  It has been a slow, ineffective journey, which is why I am turning to professionals. 

Learning a curated, up-to-date curriculum of web development knowledge from industry experts will allow me to accelerate my learning and gain the skills necessary to build my own web applications, whether business software, an interactive educational site, or some other creative idea.

The education is project based, so I will be building web applications throughout the program.  I already have several ideas for web applications, in property management, education, event marketing, and many others.

With a background in online marketing & web design, I am a great candidate for the program

I am in a great position to expand my skill-set.  I have been working at SolarWinds, Inc., one of Austin's fastest growing startup companies, for the past 6 months in Email Marketing, a tremendously important branch of the company's sales & marketing arm.

Prior to this, I worked for 3 months at Houghton Mifflin Harcourt to help design an online web portal.  Before that, I worked on a group of websites including & owned by PlasticMart.com.  This foundation of knowledge in web design and the online business ecosystem will support my ability to learn web development and create meaningful web applications.

Why do I want to build web applications?

I have many ideas for online-business and non-profit concepts.  Some of them seem almost impossible... and they will be impossible for me to achieve without web development skills.

As you may know, I used to be a bit of an environmental activist.  I still have a passion for environmental & social entrepreneurship and activism, and this is another field which I would like to contribute to with improved skills in web development.

I believe there is and will continue to be increasing demand for web development professionals well into the future.  As I hone my skill, it is something I can offer to teach others as well.  So, by donating to my fund, you can be sure I will be happy to spend some time with you teaching you what I know (and what I am learning) about web development.  Also, as I become more financially stable and successful, I will be able to contribute to the funding needs of others, and l definitely intend to pass on the magnanimity to others.

Thank you for your time and consideration,

Patrick Meaney

More information

My person website:

http://pmdm.co/index.php

More information about MakerSquare:

http://www.makersquare.com/

http://blog.makersquare.com/2014/05/05/makersquare-tuition-comparison/#more-467


Additional articles about web development bootcamps:

Testimonials of former students from a similar program: http://codingdojo.com/testimonials

"The self-made developer: bootstrap or bootcamp?"

http://programming.oreilly.com/2014/01/the-self-made-developer-bootstrap-or-bootcamp.html

"Are programming bootcamps worth it?" https://medium.com/hacker-culture/88ea70b9117f

"DevOps hiring: A holistic approach to hiring for in-demand positions"

http://programming.oreilly.com/2014/04/devops-hiring.html

story:
Short Summary

I'm Kate, and if you're reading this, you probably know me. But, in case this has gone a little further than my circle, I'm Kate. I'm an aspiring entrepreneur, a community organizer, a mother of a three year old spit fire, and I'm struggling with daily life. 

Part of it is overwhelm. I've recently moved into a new home, I recently miscarried. I may or may not have a job after June 30, all contingent on funding. There is so much going on.

Another part of that struggle is a mental health issue. I've struggled with depression and anxiety longer than I can pinpoint. I've recently realized that I've been spending a lot of time waiting for my life to get better -- waiting for a proverbial "prince charming" to be my maid, my cook, my secretary, my accountant, etc. But I realized that I have to do this for myself. (With support from my loving husband, of course.) I have to be my own prince charming.

To become my own prince charming, I've a found a community coaching experience -- which will help me come tuned into my own wisdom, so that I can create fertility to launch my business, boost my message, and -- dear to my heart -- conceive, carry, and birth a second child.

What We Need & What You Get

I want to raise the money to become part of this course: http://wombtoworldwellness.com/circle/

  • If the funding goal isn't met, the money will still go towards my tuition for this course, but I'll have to do other work to get what I need!
  • The funding is going to go for my tuition for this course and materials for completing the course.
  • There are wonderful perks that I'm going to personally create and bless with reiki energy for you -- to thank you for energy exchange.

The Impact

When I have completed this course, I will be in touch with my intuition, and I will be clear on who I am and how to manage my life and nourish my body and soul. As a result of this:
  • I will have a greater chance of conceiving and carrying a child to term.
  • I will be better equipped to manage parenthood and entrepreneurship, which will allow me to...
  • Get my message about work life wholeness and continue holding space for women to teach THEM to be better in touch with their needs, thus paying it forward.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help:

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word! 
  • Send me prayers, reiki, healing energy and encouraging words. <3

story:
Short Summary

The Redheads are the Cornell Lab of Ornithology student birding teams that compete in the World Series of Birding, a 24-hour birding race throughout New Jersey to hear or see as many species as possible. It's not just about birding, the students have a great incentive: they're raising money to fund undergraduate research for projects that advance the conservation of birds. 

ALL GIFTS WILL BE MATCHED! Thanks to a generous donor, all gifts to the Redhead student fund will be matched. Our student fundraising goal is to raise $7,500 toward the overall $25,000 goal. 

Three undergraduate teams will compete in the World Series of Birding on May 10 to raise money for the Redhead Fund. At the Cornell Lab of Ornithology, scientists, conservationists, engineers, educators, and students all work together for a common purpose: to understand birds and other wildlife, to involve the public in scientific discovery, and to use our knowledge to protect our planet.


Great Perks for Your Contribution

To thank you for your $30 gift, we'll send you a Cornell Lab of Ornithology water bottle featuring artwork by Caitlin Turner.


To thank you for your $50 gift, we'll send you a 5x7 print of a Redhead duck taken by Redhead team member Luke Seitz. 


To thank you for your $75 gift, we'll send you a 4x8 print featuring this year's World Series of Birding logo created by Redhead team member Luke Seitz. 


The Impact

Each year, the Cornell Lab of Ornithology mentors more than 100 undergraduate students, giving them hands-on experience to study and conserve birds and other wildlife. Your support makes it possible for us to offer new opportunities for some of the nation's brightest and most talented students - our future leaders in science and conservation. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Please help us spread the word and remind your friends and family that all gifts count twice!

story:
Help give our scholars a Graduation Trip they will never forget…!

Real LIFE Foundation is a non-profit that is passionate about providing a better future for underprivileged Filipino youth by giving them access to a good education. We give our scholars more than just tuition & fees -- we mentor them in LIFE: Leadership, Integrity, Faith & Excellence; we equip them with practical life skills; and we provide them with a daily meal allowance. Real LIFE has been empowering the dreams of scholars across the Philippines since 2003.

On April 8-9, we will hold our biggest Scholar Graduation ever! Forty-six Real LIFE scholars from 18 cities across the Philippines will come to Manila for our Scholar Graduation "Mystery Tour." Almost all of our graduates are the first in their family to obtain a university degree, and many have never stayed in a hotel before, so we want to make this an extra special Grad celebration memory that they will cherish for years to come. Our scholars have worked so hard (some have been scholars for 8 years) and overcome so much to be able to graduate. 

For our Scholar Graduation "Mystery Tour," we will fly our 25 provincial graduates to Manila. Once in Manila, they will join our 21 Manila graduates for an "Amazing Race" (Grad Edition!) to our super secret grad venue outside the city. Our scholars will be told to bring an overnight bag but will have no idea where they are going or what they will be doing until they arrive. Last year, some of our scholars told us they couldn't sleep the night before graduation because they were so excited for our Mystery Tour...!

On the night of April 8, we will be joined by 50 of our biggest supporters, corporate partners & volunteers for our Graduation Banquet, where we will celebrate with our graduates. On April 9, we have a whole day of surprises planned for our scholars, including a special graduation gift for each of them.

Thank you in advance for supporting our cause…and please watch the video from last year's Scholar Graduation to understand what we are about and how our programs are transforming lives through hope and education! :)

HOW YOU CAN HELP!

Our goal is to raise US$ 7,500 in 45 days. 

The budget for our Scholar Graduation includes:

  • airfare to fly our 25 provincial graduates to Manila for graduation;
  • hotel accommodation & meals for our 46 graduates, 5 staff & 5 volunteers;
  • a super special grad banquet for 100 scholars & guests;
  • transportation costs to rent 4 vans to bring our scholars & guests to the grad venue outside Manila;
  • a graduation gift for each of our scholars;
  • cost for our extra special surprise on April 9 for our graduates (we can't spill the beans here but, don't worry, we'll tell you all about the surprises in our grad highlight video after the event!)

In the event that we don't reach our ultimate funding goal of US$ 7500, we will still give our scholars the best grad trip we can with the funds we do raise. If we raise more than US$ 7500, we will make our Scholar Graduation even more special for our graduates!

For everyone who donates a gift of US$50, we will send you our super cool (black) "Helping Others Never Goes Out of Style" t-shirt (see photo below). 

For everyone who donates a gift of at least US$100, we will send you the even more fabulous (steel grey) "Helping Others Never Goes Out of Style" t-shirt which was created by our friends at Worship Generation (please see photo below).

For everyone who donates a gift of at least US$500, we will send you the Helping Others t-shirt of your choice PLUS a copy of "The Gift of Hope," a beautiful photo book featuring the children of our Real LIFE feeding program & our favourite quotes about "hope."


EMPOWERING DREAMS

Thank you so much for reading this far…! The goal of Real LIFE Foundation is not just to pay tuition & fees or help our scholars obtain a university degree…our goal is to EMPOWER THEIR DREAMS. 

The reason we invest in scholarships is because education is the most effective means to lift individuals and families out of poverty. Including this year's graduates, Real LIFE has produced 200 university graduates who are not just gainfully employed, but are enjoying quality of life and helping lift their families out of poverty. 


For more information on Real LIFE Foundation, please visit our website at: www.igivetolife.com

To see more of our inspiring videos, please visit: www.youtube.com/reallifefoundation

To become a fan, please like us on Facebook at: www.facebook.com/reallifefoundation

THANK YOU FOR GIVING TO LIFE!!! :)

Who We Are & What We Do

The Sentinel Project is a Toronto-based non-profit organization dedicated to actively assisting people worldwide wherever and whenever they are threatened by mass atrocities.

We monitor several regions around the world and currently have a team in Kenya's Tana Delta using telecommunications to short circuit propaganda which has been used to incite ethnic violence including massacres. We are also pioneering the use of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) for humanitarian causes.

The Sentinel Project team has been tracking the events in Myanmar (formerly Burma) for more than a year and have conclusive evidence of a campaign of violence being waged against minority groups in the country. We aim to send a rapid reaction team to the region in order to set up an assistance operation.


Your Help Is Needed

This operation is urgently needed. The target funds of $5,000 CAD will significantly offset the costs of beginning our operations in Myanmar.  All funds, regardless of whether the goal is reached or not will go towards operations in Myanmar.

Your donation will enable us to build key relationships in the region, have a more significant impact, and apply innovation solutions to the ongoing challenges facing Myanmar's persecuted minorities.

More importantly, your donation and the impact it has on our programming will allow us to find more funding partners and develop the programming even further. Your single donation has the potential to multiply its value!


The Impact

The Sentinel Project is dedicated to finding new solutions to age-old problems. Technology provides an important way to improve lives, from something as simple as staying in touch to important issues such as ensuring the security of people living under threat of violence.

Our efforts have begun to bear fruit in other regions. In Kenya's Tana Delta an outbreak of violence among communities left scores dead. The Sentinel Project responded with Una Hakika, a unique initiative which uses existing telecommunications infrastructure to interfere with propaganda and misinformation which have stoked tensions and led to violence. The origins of the conflict were well understood but our efforts revealed that the flow of information suffered serious deficits even between villages which allowed for the propagation of misinformation.

The field of international aid and development has been slow to adopt new technology which could benefit their efforts and the Sentinel Project is leading the charge to bring locally-run, technology-driven solutions to communities at risk of mass atrocities around the world.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with others, share our passion for helping people around the world live safer and happier lives, and donate generously.

story:
A wonderful opportunity has arisen and I’d like to take advantage of it, but need your help. This is not just a request for help, but also an opportunity for you to become part of the struggle for a peaceful and more just world.

Our videos, “A Trillion” and “Dreams of a Trillion” have been selected for the 4th annual IHTD youth film festival!

As an "Official Selection" our videos will be screened at the World Premiere event and we are invited to take part in a Leadership Training in Washington D.C. on April 12-14. This is an exciting weekend for young filmmakers to come together and continue the dialogue about community needs that are addressed in our videos. The weekend will include:

  •  2-day Leadership Training at Sidwell Friends School
  • A ticket to the World Premiere of the 4th Annual “IHTD” festival at DC’s iconic Busboys & Poets(includes dinner, an award ceremony and performances fromIHTD participants)
  • A visit to Capitol Hill for a street action to mark the Global Day of Action Against Military Spending
  • 2-night stay at Hostelling International in downtown D.C.
  • 3-day Metro card for getting around town.
  • Most meals on all 3 days.

What We Need & What You Get

AFSC is pleased to be able to cover the expenses in DC (housing, transportation and meals) for 5 people, however our group will need to cover the expense of traveling to Washington.

We are trying to to raise $1,200 for traveling expenses for up to 10 Students and their instructors.

For your contribution, we are offering:

  • Thank you cards from the Academy youth.
  • A Mixtape of original music produced and recorded by youth in the Academy's Music production class.
  • A Limited Edition "Create with Purpose" Academy cinch bag back pack

The Impact

This experience is meant to highlight real world applications of the arts. Access to this type of opportunity is rare and we expect our students to take advantage of this professional level opportunity.

Background

The video contest was launched nationwide in May 2010 to call attention to the $1 trillion the U.S. has already spent on the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan. Youth age 13-23 were asked to address the military budget and use their videos to explore how they would spend the $1 trillion on themselves, their schools, their communities and their country. 

The American Friends Service Committee (AFSC) is a Quaker organization devoted to service, development and peace programs throughout the world. The work of AFSC is based on the belief in the worth of every person, and faith in the power of love to overcome violence and injustice.The National Priorities Project (NPP) makes complex federal budget information transparent and accessible so people can prioritize and inﬂuence how their tax dollars are spent. NPP holds the vision of an informed and engaged democracy where all people affected by federal spending priorities have the ability and opportunity to participate in shaping our nation's budget.


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us Spread the word!

Make sure to share this campaign on Facebook, Google +, Twitter, Instagram, etc.

Be sure to tag us @academyUAP @UAPNYC #artsed #findthekey

This is an exciting weekend for young filmmakers to come together and continue the dialogue about community needs that are addressed in our videos. The weekend will include:

 2-day Leadership Training at Sidwell Friends School


A ticket to the World Premiere of the 4th Annual “IHTD” festival at DC’s iconic Busboys & Poets(includes dinner, an award ceremony and performances fromIHTD participants)


A visit to Capitol Hill for a street action to mark the Global Day of Action Against Military Spending


2-night stay at Hostelling International in downtown D.C.


3-day Metro card for getting around town.

Most meals on all 3 days.
What We Need & What You GetAFSC is pleased to be able to cover the expenses in DC (housing, transportation and meals) for 5 people, however our group will need to cover the expense of traveling to Washington.We are trying to to raise $1,200 for traveling expenses for up to 10 Students and their instructors.For your contribution, we are offering:
Thank you cards from the Academy youth.
A Mixtape of original music produced and recorded by youth in the Academy's Music production class.
A Limited Edition "Create with Purpose" Academy cinch bag back pack
The ImpactThis experience is meant to highlight real world applications of the arts. Access to this type of opportunity is rare and we expect our students to take advantage of this professional level opportunity.BackgroundThe video contest was launched nationwide in May 2010 to call attention to the $1 trillion the U.S. has already spent on the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan. Youth age 13-23 were asked to address the military budget and use their videos to explore how they would spend the $1 trillion on themselves, their schools, their communities and their country. 
The American Friends Service Committee (AFSC) is a Quaker organization devoted to service, development and peace programs throughout the world. The work of AFSC is based on the belief in the worth of every person, and faith in the power of love to overcome violence and injustice.The National Priorities Project (NPP) makes complex federal budget information transparent and accessible so people can prioritize and inﬂuence how their tax dollars are spent. NPP holds the vision of an informed and engaged democracy where all people affected by federal spending priorities have the ability and opportunity to participate in shaping our nation's budget.
Other Ways You Can HelpHelp us Spread the word!Make sure to share this campaign on Facebook, Google +, Twitter, Instagram, etc.Be sure to tag us @academyUAP @UAPNYC #artsed #findthekey

story:
Short Summary

My name is Amanda Irizarry and I am currently a freshman at the University of Pennsylvania. This semester, I declared a major in Health and Societies with a concentration in Global Health. I also hope to double minor in Biological Basis of Behavior/ Health Care Management and Urban Studies. I am passionate about public health issues, community outreach, and the exploration and celebration of cultural diversity.

I have been accepted to Duke University's Global Health Issues in South Africa summer study abroad program. As a participant of the program, I will have the absolutely amazing opportunity to study public health through hands-on coursework and fieldwork. The program focuses on three major themes: primary health care in South Africa, the impact of HIV/AIDS, and the role of traditional healers. The subject material of the program is directly related to my studies at the University of Pennsylvania, and will really supplement everything I learn in the classroom.

This study abroad program presents the opportunity of a lifetime. Not only will I be learning about global health issues firsthand, but I will also have opportunities to immerse myself in South African culture and challenge myself by being put in situations way outside of my comfort zone. I expect the program to be completely humbling and life-changing, and hope to develop a unique kind of self-awareness and undergo significant personal growth. 

One of my major life goals is to see as much as the world as possible. This is not for my own selfish intentions, but rather because I believe learning about different cultures and people is the first step one can make before making any kind of significant, positive impact on either local or global communities. Through whatever career I eventually pursue, I know I want to improve the lives of people all over the world. Participating in this program will advance my studies and put me one step closer to accomplishing one of my life goals.

Costs

The tuition and program fees for the program are about $6,200. This does not include costs for textbooks, or airfare. Textbooks may cost up to an additional $500 and roundtrip airfare to South Africa is about $2,000. This makes the total costs of attendance around $9,000.

It is unfortunate that such amazing study abroad programs are often extremely expensive. For many students, studying abroad is a dream which is seldom achieved because of these massive costs. I would hate to be denied the opportunity to study abroad because I cannot afford it. 

My fundraising goal is $2,000. This money would go directly towards my airfare costs to and from South Africa. Any funding I happen to receive over $2,000 will go towards helping cover the additional tuition and program fees. I hope to fundraise as much as possible in order to minimize my out-of-pocket expenses, and minimize the amount of loans I will most likely have to take out to cover the remaining costs.

There are unique "perks" offered with different donation amounts:

  • $25: Acknowledgement of your support! Thank you!
  • $50: A postcard sent to you from South Africa!
  • $100: An unique printed photo taken during my time in South Africa!
  • $200: A souvenir from South Africa
  • $500: Postcard, photograph and souvenir from South Africa

Can't Contribute Yourself? Please spread the word!

Please share the link to my campaign with anyone you think would be interested in helping me fund my trip to South Africa! Do not hesitate to contact me directly with any questions about my campaign. I love talking about my future and about how this program would play a significant role in my studies and personal growth, and allow me to steps towards making differences in communities! 

Email: iamanda@sas.upenn.edu

story:
Guided Parent is the next step in a proven method that supports parents in helping their children avoid pitfalls that can impede their educational growth. This method was created and successfully used by the President and CEO of GuidEd Fusion, Joe Genasci, an educator with 17 years of experience and a lifetime surrounded by innovative educators.

About Joe

As a nationally certified counselor, I have participated in parent/guardian conferences and observed negative responses such as taking things away, nagging, or trying to force plans upon their student/s. I have experience defining, designing, and supporting students and athletes. I have coached college and high school football, taught at a school for students diagnosed with autism, and was dean at a private college. Entering my eleventh year as a nationally certified school counselor, I have lived and breathed the delivery of service to students and intimately understand how to motivate young people.

How it Works

Parents/Guardians

GuidEd Parent is an affordable mobile application that will help parents/guardians track their student’s progress and manage a home support plan automatically by creating and monitoring expectations with rewards and consequences. When applied, a parent/guardian will have tools to provide positive and consistent support, thereby keeping the student’s success and character development at center stage.

Students

GuidEd Parent allows a student to stay organized, manage projects, and most of all gain encouragement from the ones who will mean the most, parents/guardians and close family members or friends that parents/guardians approve as support team members. GuidEd Parent is a tool that speaks the language of young people in a space they are most comfortable with. Your teen will appreciate the GuidEd Parent approach and will do their best to reach agreed upon goals and daily expectations.

Needs

We expect it to cost $56,535 to build the infrastructure, which includes marketing nationwide, purchasing hardware and software, and implementing resources. 

Impact

Your donation will improve the educational experience of young people, as well as helping parents motivate their children in academics and help them instill the character traits of their dreams. Most of all, GuidEd Parent’s framework ensures that family support stays connected during times of separation. Service member families who are often deployed and/or moving will be able to keep their support consistent and involved no matter where they are in the world.

Perks

We have five levels of sponsorship with rewards:  

Other Ways You can Help

Like us on Facebook at GuidEd Fusion Inc

Follow us on Twitter @GuidEdFusionInc

Use Indiegogo's tools to share GuidEd Parent's campaign. Help us turn the tide of education in Nevada and nationwide by supporting the most important people in a student’s life.

story:
The Hip Hop Education Project

What is it?

The Hip Hop Education Project is a youth-development program that empowers youth to design and implement community development programs.

Why is it called the Hip Hop Education Project?

Hip Hop was born from youth struggling to define their realities. We want to give our youth the tools to analyze their struggles, get specific about problems and create solutions to these very problems.

You say you use Hip Hop Pedagogy – what is that?

Hip Hop Pedagogy comes from Hip Hop Social Theory – which is about 3 keys principles – which also happen to be titles of important hip hop songs:

  1. One Love – love for self and community;
  2. One Mic – Courage, determination and toughness to take center stage to address the things that need to be addressed;
  3. The World is Yours – we teach our youth not simply to take the world as it is but to examine it and to make positive changes in their community.

What makes you different?

Our approach takes all of the awesome things happening in education and puts them all together:

  • Engaging, design centered instruction, we teach critical thinking like whoa!
  • Hip Hop Pedagogy (not just content, but our whole pedagogical approach)
  • Community development by and for students (we address poverty, health and student achievement and youth leadership development and believe that we need to do all of these things for students to succeed)
  • Interrupting the school to prison pipeline – we don’t believe in suspensions – we want students in school learning and growing as the next generation's leaders

Why we need your help

We are asking for $7,500 so we can:

  • Plan and implement our first community development projects (covering costs for meeting spaces, feeding our youth organizers, transportation costs to project sites, supplies for community-based projects) - $6,500
  • Apply for 501(3)(c) status - $300
  • Spread the word about The Hip Hop Education Project through low-cost logo and design projects - $700

The Impact

  • Each $50 we get makes a youth led project possible.
  • $70 helps Daniela teach other high school seniors how to get into college.
  • $100 allows our high school student to teach health classes to elementary school students
  • $150 funds black male achievement research complied and advocated for by black male youth.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends about The Hip Hop Education Project (use the Indiegogo share tools!)
  • Follow us on twitter at hiphopchange
  • Join our twitter chats Tuesdays from 9 - 10 using #hiphopchange
  • Donate services in kind
  • Speak to our youth for our Stories Project.

Peace, love, and justice.

story:
Soar is an arts and performance education program offered to the youth of the First nations in Canada. Soar brings in industry working professionals to direct youth in the areas of theater, film, music, and dance. Every student integrates  a series of skill building excersises, which are aimed at pushing them from a point of introversion to a confident,  self- respecting individual so that they can learn to express themselves creatively and interact with each other collaboratively. Each student receives private lessons and instruction based on their field of interest, while constructing a final performance event, which combines all fields of expertise within the program.

The final event will combine musical, dance, and thematic elements from both traditional aboriginal society and contemporary art. Mzany of the students have struggled through such incredible hardships that they are heavily burdened by depression and the belief that their purpose is not understood by anyone. The Soar program aims to nurture and inspire these students by working directly with them on a personal level. In this way we engage students to open themselves up to creativity and realize their leadership potential so they may grow to pursue a passion and inspire others.

Currently the program works primarily with the youth of the Enoch Cree nation in Alberta, Canada. The program has grown exponentially over 5 years, each year raising the bar in production value and quality. The youth involved in this program have gone above and beyond the initiative necessary to bring a professional product to life. Your contribution will aid in directly making the vision of this performance a possibility. The costs of the final performance is strenuous. Much is involved in the process; from the costumes, to the set design, to the labour in the venue, we truly believe that it is worth every dollar to give these students a life changing experience. Any contributions beyond what what is necessary for the performance will go directly towards our vision of making a lasting impact on aboriginal art. Forever.

We strongly believe that this kind of inspiration is something that has to be shared with all people. Therefore it is especially influential to those who have never experienced what it means to feel significant and important. This is our mission. Thank you for your consideration toward helping us bring an amazing performance within a permanent sustainable program available to all the First Nation's youth.

Thank you

story:
Ear Candy Charity has 30 days to raise $25,000 to launch Online Instrument Drives, a program that will ensure thousands of youth receive the instruments they need to participate in music education!

Since 2008, Ear Candy has conducted Instrument Drives at fire stations throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area, collecting and placing thousands of instruments and impacting tens of thousands of youth to date. 

In order to expand the impact of Instrument Drives beyond the Phoenix area, Ear Candy has spent the past year and a half building Online Instrument Drives. The program is has been developed to the point where it can take an instrument donated from anywhere in the country and place it in any music program in Arizona. 

YOUR compassionate support for this campaign will ensure Ear Candy has the funds it needs to launch and operate Online Instrument Drives on September 17th, 2012.

View Awesome Videos in Updates Section (Top of Page) 

We have posted some really cool video in the update section of the campaign, like this one here of Carlos Receiving his first trumpet! You can clik the image below to watch this video, or checkout the update section to see them all. (Warning - Some of them are ridiculous and may lead to laughter and smiling)

Music Education Matters

Participation in music education provides many benefits for students, including heightened academic performance in science, technology, engineering and math (STEM), increased self-esteem, the development of team building and social skills, and has been shown to produce a strong correlation with higher socioeconomic status in adulthood.

Yet, across the country, thousands of youth each year miss out on music classes because they cannot afford to purchase or rent an instrument. The advantages of music education are far too numerous to deny any student the opportunity, especially when financial circumstances outside of their control hinder their access.

That’s where Online Instrument Drives comes in, and why we need your support.

If you believe music education is important for students, then please help give old instruments new life by supporting this campaign!

And...
Since Ear Candy's a nonprofit, you get a charitable tax receipt for all contributions made through this campaign. YOU MUST CHOOSE PAYPAL AT CHECKOUT TO RECEIVE A TAX RECEIPT!!

 

Launching - September 17th

Online Instrument Drives (OID) - an easy to use donation platform hosted on Ear Candy’s website that allows individuals in the community to donate instruments to music programs that need them most.

How it Works

  1. Music teachers create an instrument request, post a photo of their students, and describe their need for the instruments.
  2. Instrument donors choose the music program where they want to donate their instrument, print a free shipping label, and send their instrument on its way.
  3. Instruments arrive at Ear Candy's facility for cleaning, tuning, and repair.
  4. Financial donors chip in to cover shipping and repair (like a micro Indiegogo campaign for each instrument).
  5. When the funds are raised, instruments arrive at the music program and are immediately placed in the hands of a child!

It’s really that simple, and it works the same whether an instrument is donated from across town or across the country.

So on September 17th, no matter where you are in the U.S., you can give an old instrument New Life through Online Instrument Drives. 

 

Other Ways YOU Can Help

Spread the Word!

The easiest way to help is to spread the word! Share this campaign with your friends, family and extended network. Use Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Google+, telephone, telegraph, smoke signals, or whatever means of communication you use to get the word out. Just get it out there!

  • Change your Facebook cover photo in support of Ear Candy’s Indiegogo campaign (Download HERE)
  • Use our custom made Ear Candy Campaign Twitter Background (Download HERE)
  • Share Ear Candy's You Tube videos
  • Use the #EarCandyOID hashtag in your tweets
  • Re-pin our Ear Candy Indiegogo posts on Pinterest

Get Connected With Ear Candy!

Keep up to date with everything Ear Candy by liking us on Facebook, following us on Twitter, pinning us on Pinterest, or signing up for Ear Candy's e-newsletter. This way, you will be the first to know when Ear Candy is supporting music education in your community. 

Donate an Instrument Now

Online Instrument Drives is launching in Maricopa County, AZ on September 17th, and expanding throughout the state of AZ in January 2013. 

If you live in the continental U.S., you can donate an instrument to a music program anywhere in AZ. And with AZ ranked 48th out of 50 states in per-person educational funding, music programs here need all the support they can get!

National Expansion

Ear Candy built OID to be scalable – nationally and fast. In fact, the system is already capable of placing an instrument in any music program in the country. With enough interest and support from outside of Arizona, we will be placing instruments from coast to coast in no time at all!

Use of Funds

We have spent the past year and a half building Online Instrument Drives from scratch on a shoestring budget. In order for the program to work, it is critical that Ear Candy raises $25,000 to launch and operate Online Instrument Drives. These funds are essential to the implementation and success of the program. 

Case in point, Ear Candy needs $421,800 for the year to keep the lights on and instruments flowing. 

All funds raised in excess of the campaign goal will go directly toward ongoing web development and program operations.

Contribute to this campaign, and together we will ensure all youth have access to music education!! 

 

Perk Details

As a nonprofit, Ear Candy will send you a charitable tax receipt for all contributions made through this campaign. YOU MUST CHOOSE PAYPAL AT CHECKOUT TO RECEIVE A TAX RECEIPT!!

Join the Fan Club - $5

You Rock! We'll thank you on our social media, and send you a special email to let you know how much your support means. 

Personalized Ear Candy Gram - $20

When the campaign wraps, you'll receive a hand written, Ear Candy Gram thank you letter from the Ear Candy team. Inside the letter, you'll find a sticker sheet with four awesome Ear Candy stickers!

+ Special Email Thank You

(Graphic representation below. Sticker sheet will look 75% more radical when finalized by our pro bono marketing firm)

Ear Candy Schwag Bag - $30

You’ll get a stylish drawstring backpack containing a hand written Ear Candy Gram from the team, a sticker sheet with four awesome Ear Candy stickers, and an Ear Candy pen.

+ Special Email Thank You

Graphic T-Shirt & Schwag Bag - $60

Don’t bother looking for the Ear Candy graphic T-shirt anywhere else. We’re only printing a limited number of the shirts for this campaign, so this is your only chance to get one. That’s right, a limited number for a limited time. Get on it.

Available in standard Kid's / Women's / Men's sizes

+ Special Email Thank You + Schwag Bag 

 

OID Coupons - Support a Request

Your support of music education doesn’t have to end when this campaign does. With the OID Coupon Perk, we give you half of your campaign contribution back as a coupon credit to use on our site towards the placement of the instrument(s) of your choice.

It costs a certain amount of money to place (ship & repair) each instrument. Raising the funds to cover the shipping and repair of each instrument is entirely dependent on contributions from individuals like you. 

Coupon Perks are your opportunity to support this campaign, and directly support what this campaign is really all about, placing instruments in the hands of kids who need them! 

How it Works

  1. On September 17th, you'll receive an email with your Coupon Code(s) 
  2. Go to EarCandyCharity.org and browse music teacher requests
  3. You choose the instrument request you want to support
  4. Enter your Coupon Code at checkout and make a child's day

$25 Coupon - Cost = $50

$50 Coupon - Cost = $100

Four $25 Coupons - Cost = $200

 

Share the Joy with Four $25 OID Coupons

Life is richer when shared with those you love. On September 17th, we'll email you four separate $25 coupons so you can invite others to join you in the fun of providing youth access to music education!!

Bigger Perks

Tickets to Ear Candy's Night at the Grammys Gala - $500

Score two invitations to Ear Candy's first ever Night at the Grammys Gala. Event will be held on February 10th, in downtown Phoenix.  

Includes: admission for 2, dinner, drink tickets, a killer goody bag and more. The event will feature a live screening of the 2013 Grammys, live musical performances and lots of fun!

+ Special Thank You Email + 2 Scwhag Bags + 2 Graphic T-Shirts 

Dinner with the Ear Candy Team - $1,000

Save the Date! You and a guest are invited to join the Ear Candy team on Wednesday, October 17, 2012 at 6:30 pm for fine dining at a local valley restaurant (location TBD). While you sit back and relax, the Ear Candy team will serve up drinks and a delicious meal! 

+ Special Thank You Email + 2 Scwhag Bags + Graphic T-Shirts + 2 Tickets to Night at the Grammys 

Honorary EC Team Member - $2,500

Join the Ear Candy team as an honorary member!

We have worked tirelessly for over a year to build the OID system, but the truth is, without the significant support of individuals in the community like you, this thing doesn't go anywhere. That's why if you are willing to support us at this level, we'll put you on the site with the rest of the team where you belong!

Includes:

  • Pic and bio in Team Member section of the Ear Candy website (if so desired)

+ Special Thank You Email + 4 Scwhag Bags + 4 Graphic T-Shirts + 2 Tickets to Night at the Grammys 

Advisory Board Member - $10,000

We want you to be one of the founding members of Ear Candy's Advisory Board. We will meet in person and / or virtually at least once every quarter to discuss operations and expansion strategy (No need to be in or travel to AZ). We are especially interested in those with experience launching and developing startups, leading internet based companies, and overseeing logistics and fulfillment. For those interested in playing a significant role in the development of an innovative organization serving the social good, this perk is for you.

Includes:

  • Advisory Board membership
  • Pic and bio in the new Ear Candy Advisory Board section of the website (if so desired)

+ Special Thank You Email + 10 Scwhag Bags + 10 Graphic T-Shirts + 2 Tickets to Night at the Grammys

OID in My City Next - $100,000

Purchase this perk and Ear Candy will put the major metropolitan area of your choice at the top of our list for expansion in fall 2013. Online Instrument Drives is an intentionally scalable program already capable of placing instruments in any school in the country. The only thing currently preventing us from offering the program nationwide is organizational bandwidth. If someone out there wants to see Online Instrument Drives in their community next year, with the right resources and support, Ear Candy can make that happen. 

Includes:

  • Advisory Board Membership

+ Special Thank You Email + 25 Scwhag Bags + 25 Graphic T-Shirts + 2 Tickets to Night at the Grammys

  

About Ear Candy Charity

History

In early 2007, Nate Anderson  came across a startling statistic: Arizona was nearly dead last in per person educational funding in the country. As a music enthusiast, Nate began to research the effects of such dismal funding levels on music education in Arizona’s public schools. What he found would change his life forever. In October of 2007, Nate founded Ear Candy Charity as a 501(c)(3) Non-Profit dedicated to providing youth access to music education.

Nate initially hosted benefit concerts and events to raise money to support music education, and soon refined the organization's approach by conducting Valley wide instrument drives with 80+ fire station donation sites, which led to delivering truckloads of instruments to schools in need.

In early 2011, Ear Candy embarked on the exciting challenge of revamping physical Instrument Drives to increase efficiency and effectiveness and expand the program's impact. Online Instruments Drives soon emerged as the organic evolution physical Instrument Drives by leveraging technology and emerging trends in online fundraising.  

Putting all the logistical pieces of Online Instrument Drives in place along with web design and a solid customer relations management (CRM) backbone took a good deal of time treasure, leading us to today, with a fundraising campaign preceding the launch of the program.  

OUR MISSION

To Provide Youth Access to Music Education.

OUR GOAL

To Equip, Empower, and Enlighten youth through Music.

OUR MISSION DELIVERY VEHICLES

1.) Online Instrument Drives® connects Music Teachers with Instrument & Financial Donors to place high quality, refurbished instruments in the hands of their students. Old instruments become the solution to music education by getting a New life!

2.) Play It Forward is a service learning program that equips any group with the tools, training, and mentoring they need to create and host their own physical Instrument Drive. From businesses, schools, civic groups, places of worship, associations and clubs...Wherever there is a collection of passionate individuals who want to help give youth gain access to music education, there is a Play It Forward Instrument Drive ready to be launched!

3.) Backstage Class® music-based field trips expose youth to “the other side of music education,” through once in a lifetime opportunities to experience music in unique and impactful ways. The goal of Backstage Class field trips is to inspire youth to think differently about career opportunities available to them through the appreciation of music and culture.
story_txt:
Ear Candy Charity has 30 days to raise $25,000 to launch Online Instrument Drives, a program that will ensure thousands of youth receive the instruments they need to participate in music education!
Since 2008, Ear Candy has conducted Instrument Drives at fire stations throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area, collecting and placing thousands of instruments and impacting tens of thousands of youth to date. 
In order to expand the impact of Instrument Drives beyond the Phoenix area, Ear Candy has spent the past year and a half building Online Instrument Drives. The program is has been developed to the point where it can take an instrument donated from anywhere in the country and place it in any music program in Arizona. 
YOUR compassionate support for this campaign will ensure Ear Candy has the funds it needs to launch and operate Online Instrument Drives on September 17th, 2012.
View Awesome Videos in Updates Section (Top of Page) 
We have posted some really cool video in the update section of the campaign, like this one here of Carlos Receiving his first trumpet! You can clik the image below to watch this video, or checkout the update section to see them all. (Warning - Some of them are ridiculous and may lead to laughter and smiling)

Music Education Matters
Participation in music education provides many benefits for students, including heightened academic performance in science, technology, engineering and math (STEM), increased self-esteem, the development of team building and social skills, and has been shown to produce a strong correlation with higher socioeconomic status in adulthood.Yet, across the country, thousands of youth each year miss out on music classes because they cannot afford to purchase or rent an instrument. The advantages of music education are far too numerous to deny any student the opportunity, especially when financial circumstances outside of their control hinder their access.That’s where Online Instrument Drives comes in, and why we need your support.If you believe music education is important for students, then please help give old instruments new life by supporting this campaign!And...Since Ear Candy's a nonprofit, you get a charitable tax receipt for all contributions made through this campaign. YOU MUST CHOOSE PAYPAL AT CHECKOUT TO RECEIVE A TAX RECEIPT!!
 

Launching - September 17th
Online Instrument Drives (OID) - an easy to use donation platform hosted on Ear Candy’s website that allows individuals in the community to donate instruments to music programs that need them most.

How it Works

Music teachers create an instrument request, post a photo of their students, and describe their need for the instruments.
Instrument donors choose the music program where they want to donate their instrument, print a free shipping label, and send their instrument on its way.
Instruments arrive at Ear Candy's facility for cleaning, tuning, and repair.
Financial donors chip in to cover shipping and repair (like a micro Indiegogo campaign for each instrument).
When the funds are raised, instruments arrive at the music program and are immediately placed in the hands of a child!
It’s really that simple, and it works the same whether an instrument is donated from across town or across the country.
So on September 17th, no matter where you are in the U.S., you can give an old instrument New Life through Online Instrument Drives. 

 
Other Ways YOU Can Help
Spread the Word!
The easiest way to help is to spread the word! Share this campaign with your friends, family and extended network. Use Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Google+, telephone, telegraph, smoke signals, or whatever means of communication you use to get the word out. Just get it out there!

Change your Facebook cover photo in support of Ear Candy’s Indiegogo campaign (Download HERE)
Use our custom made Ear Candy Campaign Twitter Background (Download HERE)
Share Ear Candy's You Tube videos

Use the #EarCandyOID hashtag in your tweets
Re-pin our Ear Candy Indiegogo posts on Pinterest
Get Connected With Ear Candy!
Keep up to date with everything Ear Candy by liking us on Facebook, following us on Twitter, pinning us on Pinterest, or signing up for Ear Candy's e-newsletter. This way, you will be the first to know when Ear Candy is supporting music education in your community. 
Donate an Instrument Now
Online Instrument Drives is launching in Maricopa County, AZ on September 17th, and expanding throughout the state of AZ in January 2013. 
If you live in the continental U.S., you can donate an instrument to a music program anywhere in AZ. And with AZ ranked 48th out of 50 states in per-person educational funding, music programs here need all the support they can get!
National Expansion
Ear Candy built OID to be scalable – nationally and fast. In fact, the system is already capable of placing an instrument in any music program in the country. With enough interest and support from outside of Arizona, we will be placing instruments from coast to coast in no time at all!
Use of Funds
We have spent the past year and a half building Online Instrument Drives from scratch on a shoestring budget. In order for the program to work, it is critical that Ear Candy raises $25,000 to launch and operate Online Instrument Drives. These funds are essential to the implementation and success of the program. 
Case in point, Ear Candy needs $421,800 for the year to keep the lights on and instruments flowing. 
All funds raised in excess of the campaign goal will go directly toward ongoing web development and program operations.
Contribute to this campaign, and together we will ensure all youth have access to music education!! 
 
Perk Details
As a nonprofit, Ear Candy will send you a charitable tax receipt for all contributions made through this campaign. YOU MUST CHOOSE PAYPAL AT CHECKOUT TO RECEIVE A TAX RECEIPT!!
Join the Fan Club - $5
You Rock! We'll thank you on our social media, and send you a special email to let you know how much your support means. 

Personalized Ear Candy Gram - $20
When the campaign wraps, you'll receive a hand written, Ear Candy Gram thank you letter from the Ear Candy team. Inside the letter, you'll find a sticker sheet with four awesome Ear Candy stickers!
+ Special Email Thank You
(Graphic representation below. Sticker sheet will look 75% more radical when finalized by our pro bono marketing firm)

Ear Candy Schwag Bag - $30
You’ll get a stylish drawstring backpack containing a hand written Ear Candy Gram from the team, a sticker sheet with four awesome Ear Candy stickers, and an Ear Candy pen.
+ Special Email Thank You
Graphic T-Shirt & Schwag Bag - $60
Don’t bother looking for the Ear Candy graphic T-shirt anywhere else. We’re only printing a limited number of the shirts for this campaign, so this is your only chance to get one. That’s right, a limited number for a limited time. Get on it.
Available in standard Kid's / Women's / Men's sizes
+ Special Email Thank You + Schwag Bag 
 
OID Coupons - Support a Request
Your support of music education doesn’t have to end when this campaign does. With the OID Coupon Perk, we give you half of your campaign contribution back as a coupon credit to use on our site towards the placement of the instrument(s) of your choice.
It costs a certain amount of money to place (ship & repair) each instrument. Raising the funds to cover the shipping and repair of each instrument is entirely dependent on contributions from individuals like you. 
Coupon Perks are your opportunity to support this campaign, and directly support what this campaign is really all about, placing instruments in the hands of kids who need them! 
How it Works

On September 17th, you'll receive an email with your Coupon Code(s) 
Go to EarCandyCharity.org and browse music teacher requests
You choose the instrument request you want to support
Enter your Coupon Code at checkout and make a child's day
$25 Coupon - Cost = $50
$50 Coupon - Cost = $100
Four $25 Coupons - Cost = $200

 


Share the Joy with Four $25 OID Coupons

Life is richer when shared with those you love. On September 17th, we'll email you four separate $25 coupons so you can invite others to join you in the fun of providing youth access to music education!!
Bigger Perks

Tickets to Ear Candy's Night at the Grammys Gala - $500

Score two invitations to Ear Candy's first ever Night at the Grammys Gala. Event will be held on February 10th, in downtown Phoenix.  
Includes: admission for 2, dinner, drink tickets, a killer goody bag and more. The event will feature a live screening of the 2013 Grammys, live musical performances and lots of fun!
+ Special Thank You Email + 2 Scwhag Bags + 2 Graphic T-Shirts 
Dinner with the Ear Candy Team - $1,000

Save the Date! You and a guest are invited to join the Ear Candy team on Wednesday, October 17, 2012 at 6:30 pm for fine dining at a local valley restaurant (location TBD). While you sit back and relax, the Ear Candy team will serve up drinks and a delicious meal! 
+ Special Thank You Email + 2 Scwhag Bags + Graphic T-Shirts + 2 Tickets to Night at the Grammys 
Honorary EC Team Member - $2,500
Join the Ear Candy team as an honorary member!
We have worked tirelessly for over a year to build the OID system, but the truth is, without the significant support of individuals in the community like you, this thing doesn't go anywhere. That's why if you are willing to support us at this level, we'll put you on the site with the rest of the team where you belong!
Includes:

Pic and bio in Team Member section of the Ear Candy website (if so desired)
+ Special Thank You Email + 4 Scwhag Bags + 4 Graphic T-Shirts + 2 Tickets to Night at the Grammys

Each year, St. Jude Children's Research Hospital raises millions of dollars to put toward finding cures for pediatric cancer and saving children's lives. Now, it's your turn to make a difference. 

This holiday season, Trump International Hotel & Tower Toronto® is focusing all efforts on fundraising for The Eric Trump Foundation for St. Jude Children's Research.

Here's How It Works:

Every contribution is appreciated! All proceeds go towards the life-saving work done by St. Jude Children's Research Hospital.

With the click of a button, you can make a difference this holiday season. Please pass this along to your friends and family and get the word out today!

Check back with us weekly for additional bonus prizes and perks!

Here is to a happy & healthy holiday season for all!

With warm regards,


The Trump International Hotel & Tower Toronto® Team

story:
Meet Mr. Josh & Mr. Justin (teacher, therapist).  In September 2013, they were offered the opportunity to rebuild the Intensive Behavioral Support Program at Fremont High School in East Oakland, California.  This special needs program is one of the last options for the 10 boys and 12 girls whose behavioral and mental health issues keeps them from functioning in a normal classroom.  Many of these students have been passed off to multiple high schools before reaching this program.  The program’s goal is to provide therapy in conjunction with learning support to help them transition back into the mainstream classroom.  In reality, many of these kids will never return to the normal classroom- or any classroom.  Every school year, this program is rebuilt with a different set of teachers and therapists.  Due to the demanding nature of the challenges they face, many don’t last the entire school year, let alone return for another.  This is not the case for Mr. Josh & Mr. Justin, whose commitment has shown through the achievements made this school year.  They have exceeded expectations for the program simply by connecting with & supporting their students to create a place in their lives without violence & one that they will actually come to each day on their own accord.

Mr. Josh & Mr. Justin want to offer these kids more than just a safe classroom that they show up to.  They want to share the world with them & introduce them to things outside their East Oakland lives in the hopes that they would be inspired to be free to think for themselves & see their lives as one of many different possibilities. 



East Oakland is not a friendly or nurturing place to grow up.  Many of these students’ behavioral and mental health issues stem from the violence and trauma that come with growing up here.  It is a place that enables a 10 year old to sell hard drugs, to witness murder, & face multiple criminal charges before reaching the age of 18, as is the story for many of their students.  It is a place where safety & proper nutrition, let alone learning & creativity are a luxury.  The school library has been shut down all year and no appropriate materials are provided.  In an attempt to give them more than what anyone is asking for them, Mr. Josh & Mr. Justin have come up with a plan for 3 areas in which they’d like to give to them.


ACADEMIC:

The Reading Incentive is a plan to award their students with a $5 dollar gift card for every pre-approved book read for the rest of the school year. $50 bonus for 5 books. $75 bonus for 10.  Most of their students have not entire book this year and struggle through a 6th grade reading level. 

*FUNDS NEEDED FOR: 

Gift cards to Target, Footlocker & Gamestop etc.

Books!!


CREATIVE:

The Brand Project is a series of workshops that will lead the students through the entire process of creating their own street wear brand with each other.  From teaching them creative research, how to silk screen by hand, basic design, styling/modeling & photographing a lookbook, they will be led to tackle hands-on the creative process of how personal expression can build a movement.

*FUNDS NEEDED FOR:

Yudu home silkscreen machine with tools & ink

Wholesale T-shirts, sweatshirts, & tote bags

Art Supplies for design: sketchbooks, pens

Printing services: lookbooks


NUTRITION:

Feeding Kids is a personal way of sharing/connecting with a person.  To “break bread” with them is to share on the most basic human level.  Sadly, many kids come to school in order to be fed & Mr. Josh & Mr. Justin want to guarantee that none of their students go hungry. 

*FUNDS NEEDED FOR:

$100/wk in bulk groceries

story:
UPDATE (11/25/2013):

Due to the overwhelming support we have received, we have decided to extend our initial, $1,500 goal.  Our new stretch goal will be 5-by-5: $5,000 by 1/5/2014.

Tanzania is one of the poorest countries in the world.  According to the CIA World Factbook, over one third of Tanzanians are living in poverty.  In addition to that, only 60% of Tanzanian women over the age of 15 can read and write.

With your help, we can reach our new goal and raise more than we dreamed possible at this campaign’s inception.  Help make this dream a reality and support the future of Tanzania.  

Donate today to help end the vicious cycle of poverty!  

Let’s get 5-by-5.



     

MAVUNO Project is an initiative designed to empower women in need in the Karagwe District of the Kagera Region in Tanzania, Africa.  African women, especially those in rural areas, rarely have the opportunity to receive a proper, secondary school education; instead, their roles fall in the household.  

MAVUNO hopes to end the vicious cycle of poverty in these regions through education.  By educating women, their strong role within the family becomes entry point number one to a better life at the household, community, and national level.

MAVUNO's vision is to create a female secondary school that will provide an outstanding educational experience to beneficiary students that will enable them to:

  • Attain high outcomes that help them to become confident individuals and responsible citizens
  • Become strong and ethical leaders
  • Acquire a full mix of practical hands-on skills (including art, music, cultural activities, sports, etc.)

MAVUNO Project began in 2009 with the first students expected no later than 2015.  Progress is ongoing, but pace is constrained by external support.  

100% of funds received go directly to support the initiative.  Please see below for more information or direct more specific inquiries to enactus@susqu.edu.  


The school is currently being constructed on a 62 acre plot of land in Chonyonyo Village, a constituent of Ihanda Ward in the Karagwe District of the Kagera Region of Tanzania.  As of the start of this campaign, brickwork and roofing for dormitory and teacher's buildings have been completed.  In addition, a well and water storage system has been constructed to ensure clean and safe drinking water for workers and future students.  Finally, construction of the canteen and kitchen is in progress; the foundation and walls have been completed and it is currently on the roofing stage.  

All donations will support completion of the canteen and kitchen as well as the construction of classrooms, a biogas plant (biogas will be used for cooking), bathrooms, and toilets.



We truly appreciate any donation you can offer. Your donation, no matter how small it is, will help the future education of Tanzanian women.  It will be one small step toward ending the vicious cycle of poverty in this region.  

Donations received by MAVUNO will be used to purchase mainly industrial items, including but not limited to: cement, iron sheets/bars, nails, ceiling boards, and lime. 


Enactus is "a community of student, academic and business leaders committed to using the power of entrepreneurial action to transform lives and shape a better more sustainable world."  Susquehanna University Enactus is one of over 500 teams in the United States that combines passion for business and entrepreneurship with desire to serve and improve our communities locally, nationally, and internationally.  

Supporting the MAVUNO Project is one of approximately 20 initiatives undertaken by our team this year.  Each year, our goal is to efficiently utilize our resources to positively impact as many people as possible.  Our results are then compared to our peers at an annual competition.  In the words of Enactus, when teams compete to serve those in need, "We all win."


Of course you'll be duly rewarded for your donations! Listed on the right side are the perks you will receive from donating.  

  • $5 - Thanks for your support!
  • $15 - Facebook Shout Out
  • $25 - Proof from the Enactus President
  • $50 - The Shirt Off Our Backs
  • $150 - A Personal Touch From Us

Some of these perks are limited, so hurry to get your donations in!


Spread the word!  Even if you are unable to make a donation, we would love your support in raising awareness of our campaign and for MAVUNO Project.  Please share our campaign on your favorite social networking website! 


      


Susquehanna University Enactus is raising funds on behalf of the MAVUNO Project as we consider ourselves strategic partners and investors in the initiative.  Our group does not directly represent the MAVUNO Project; however, 100% of funds received will go directly to supporting the initiative.
