story:
EDIT: Holy crap, people!  What a response!  I honestly did not AT ALL expect such a rapid and thorough outpouring of support!  This is incredible for many reasons, one of which being that I forgot that I have to pay to send my GRE scores to each school I apply to, so you all inadvertently overcame that hurdle for me!  As it stands now (November 3rd at about noon) after Indiegogo fees I am within probably ~$30 of being able to apply to 6 schools if I don't send my subject test scores to all of them.  i might not have to send subject test scores to all 6 anyway.

Since there is quite a bit of time left on here, I would like to reiterate that you have all already done far more than I could possibly have dreamed. If I don't get a single penny more, I'll be happy as a clam.  However, if you feel like donating to my cause is waaay up on your priorities list, here is what I might end up using the unexpected excess of funding for:

  • Maybe applying for yet more schools if I get some good correspondence going with potential faculty.
  • Replacing the extremely bald tire on my car.
  • Getting more contact lenses since I'm almost out and have very little money right now.
  • Buying glasses for my boyfriend so he stops getting headaches.
  • Building up a safety net in case I don't get a new job before I lose mine in December (which is definitely happening).

I just want to make sure that anyone who donates from here on out is aware of what their generosity is going toward.  I am enormously humbled and amazed by the people I have in my life, and I absolutely don't know what I would do without all of you.  Also, you can all consider this as Christmabirthdaygraduation stuff.  You've done more than I could ever, ever want.


(I dont' think this .gif is always working... so if not, go here to get the point)


Hello and thank you for coming to my page!!!!

I am graduating with my BS in Biology from University of Houston this December, and after developing a passion for evolutionary biology research I have decided to go on to puruse a PhD in evolutionary biology!  I've already secured letters of recommendation, aced the GRE, gotten tons of relevant research experience and am on my way to potentially getting a publication (squeal!), but there is one absolutely vital component missing:  I don't have the money to pay for my application fees.  It costs about $100 for each program I apply to, and I ideally need to apply to at least 5 if possible to have a good chance of making it in somewhere.  More would be amazing.

Unfortunately, though, almost all of the programs have a deadline of December 1st for all application materials, including fees.  This date has snuck up on me BAD, so now I have to scramble... which is where you lovely, beautiful, incredibly good-looking and generous human beings come in.  Indie Go Go has a bit of a lag time between when your campaign ends and your money comes in, so I've got until NOVEMBER 19TH to get all the donations I can.

I know many of you are in financial situations just as bad as mine (or maybe worse), so if you can't donate anything, please feel free to share this with as many people as your heart desires.  If you can donate a dollar, I would love a dollar.  If you can donate more dollars, I love more dollars.

Please, oh please, help me pay for grad school applications. I will love you forever, in addition to some cool prizes (although they may not be delivered until after finals):

$10 donation level: I will make you a manipulated photo or MS Paint style image of adorably poor quality using your choice of subject(s). Like this:  

or this: 

$20 donation level: I will do an image like the one bove, but in the form of an animated .gif! How fun is that? Hopefully at least slightly fun.

$50 donation level: I will make you a small-ish crafty thing of your choice. Although that's super vague, we'll talk it out and it'll get done. Pretty much something that will take less than 3 hours of labor. Here's some of my crochet work, for example.

$100 donation level: I will first freak out in gratitude, and then I will make you a much bigger and more impressive thing than I would at the $50 level. Like something that could take me more than 3 hours of labor. I crochet, draw, do some sculpting, and all kinds of throwing things together out of random stuff. We'll figure something out. Here's a charcoal drawing I did of Annie Clarke as proof of my artistic ability.

Alternatively, if there's anything else I can do for you as a perk for your support, feel free to let me know.  Anything I can do to help those who help me.

THANK YOU for your time and consideration and THANK YOU for being supportive, wonderful people in my life!

story:
…Let’s give it FREE to the children because we have the answer: The power of Reciprocity…

We must help Alopecia children across the world that are trapped, and are without genuine help to “grow” their hair back. Dr. Frank Aidoo., PhD., an enzyme and alkaloid research scientist whose work on Alopecia has led to a breakthrough—the first of its kind to “actually” grow hair on Alopecia sufferers; including those with androgenic Alopecia, commonly known as “male and female pattern baldness.”

What is Alopecia? Click: www.aidooaid.com/englishQnA.htm

…Because of the importance of his work, and the threat it poses to the many “Alopecia Foundations” who have organized programs to help the children—even though, some claim to be researching for cures or “acceptable” treatment protocol, they refuse to tell the parents of these children about AidooAid…theirs is to keep them in the dark so as to continue to receive grants and donations to perpetuate indefinitely, their schemes. Dr. Aidoo, for the past years has requested them to notify the parents of all children in their groups that AidooAid is offered for free to all children below the age of 16 years; they are aware of AidooAid and the positive difference it would make in their lives. They maintain they would lose the donations and moneys received from the general public—including grants if it became known.

Dr. Aidoo has been giving AidooAid AloPlexidex-QM for free to children so they could grow their hair and win their confidence back… Though, these foundations organize and send these children to places of interest, their need is to GROW HAIR LIKE ALL CHILDREN!

Based on the above, and the deception evident in the behavior of some of these “foundations,” Dr. Aidoo is pledging $1.5 Million Dollars worth of AidooAid FREE OF CHARGE to initiate a campaign to help all children suffering from Alopecia.

There are over 1 Million Children in United States alone suffering from this debilitating malady; and the drugs on the market such as Rogaine and Propecia do not work! Most of the children have used them with no positive results—and the manufacturers themselves states their products may not work on Alopecia Totalis or Universalis; and unlike these drugs, AidooAid addresses the cause and etiology of the disease.

We are seeking donation(s) of $450,000.00 (Four Hundred and Fifty Thousand Dollars) or a match to Dr. Aidoo’s pledge, so we could help these children and remove the stigma and burden off the parents. Any amount would help.

Total Funding Needed: $1,950,000

Donation by Dr. Aidoo: $1,500,000

Amount needed/left to be raised: $450,000

Parents and children of Alopecia must bring this to the attention of Alopecia organizations across the world so they would not be used as baits any longer…

We are seeking parents and advocates who are prepared to join us achieve our mission.

WHAT THE $450,000 REMAINING DONATIONS WILL BE USED FOR:

  1. To cover shipping of AidooAid to the children.
  2. Organize distribution channels, including HUBS and logistics worldwide.
  3. Advertising of the Mission.
  4. Compensation to Doctors and Physicians, including wellness and clinic support.
  5. Replenishing and sustenance of AidooAid AloPlexidex-QM which is designed specifically for the children program.

Dr. Aidoo has pledged never to sell his formulas to any pharmaceutical company—even though, he corresponded with Pfizer, manufacturer of Rogaine, and Merck, makers of Propecia in March and June 2001, respectively, to offer them the technology…the children’s mission is of paramount importance to him; since he has witnessed firsthand the thrill and upbeat-demeanor upon seeing their OWN hair growing back—it’s an amazing sight and feeling!

To learn more about this important breakthrough and mission, go to: www.aidooaid.com where you will find lives that have been changed by his work. You will also find data on Christian, the boy on the video: Other “former” Alopecia Totalis and Universalis sufferers’ data are also posted; such as an 87 year old woman who went bald at 23 years of age and grew all her hair back after almost 65 years! www.aidooaid.com/alopecia5.htm Another is a “former” Alopecia Totalis sufferer who went bald in her late teens—growing it all back in her thirties! www.aidooaid.com/alopecia6.htm They had all been told there was nothing to help them and that they must learn to accept their fate! They were just about alopecia children then—and they have conquered it.

The “fate” of the 21st century alopecia child now is wedged in AidooAid; and it’s our duty to make it happen for them. We are calling on people of the world to donate, pray and meditate on our mission. You may share the mission with your friends and others in the social media—Face book, Twitter—local and national TV and Radio Stations; including all other platforms to spread the news…

AidooAid® AloPlexidex-QM/CS Series Topical(s) is formulated for:

1. Alopecia Arieta in children

2. Alopecia Totalis in children

3. Alopecia Universalis in children

4. "Hair Loss” in Children as a result of chemotherapy

5. "Hair Loss” in Children as a result of “Cancer” treatment.

AidooAid AloPlexidex-QM/CS corrects the cause of “hair loss” known as gHanaphe-bio; and as a topical—it does not GROW hair but allows the natural chemistry of the individual to elicit hair “growth,” naturally…where the follicles have been damaged, destroyed or negatively altered by “systemic” external or ingested interventional tool—follicle(s) positive re-activity may not result! …Normal functioning of sequential/progressive marking (phases) of Anagen, Catagen and Telogen will amiss. 

● Aborted consequence: Implies “negative” effect on hair follicle (Chemotherapy and ingested interventional treatments)

● Un-aborted consequence: Implies "non-distorted" effect on hair follicle (Chemotherapy and ingested interventional treatments) *From Dr. Aidoo’s Certified Page of Knowledge.

story:
*Important update below

Help the homeless.  It’s something you’ve heard a thousand times and
will probably hear a thousand more.  Odds are you’ve dropped some
change in a cup being held by someone on the street.  Maybe you’ve
gone the extra mile and dropped off some canned goods at a food bank
or volunteered some time at a soup kitchen.  Homelessness in a
country with so much wealth is a trajedy, and it’s impossible not
to want to help.  We felt that way too. 

That’s why we created Camp Unity Eastside.  We’re a collection of
like-minded individuals who came together with the common goal of
empowering the homeless.  We had a vision of creating an environment
condusive to the safety and wellbeing of those who need it the most.
We created a place where the disenfranchised can get everything from
resume help and career advice to counseling and dental care.  We
created a home, a community, and a family.


Camp Unity Eastside was born on November 15, 2012 at Lake Washington
United Methodist Church in Kirkland, Washington as a not for profit
privately owned and self-managed organization.  We
are a temporary shelter which moves every few months from city to
city on the east side of Lake Washington in the greater Seattle area.


LWUMC greeted us with open arms, and we found that besides hospitality,
true friendship was waiting for us.  Pastor Kelly Dalman-Oeth and his
congregation of angels, along with Sandi and Randy Hunt, were beyond
instrumental in helping us get up and running.  We made our first
official move as a camp on March 9th
to the Trinity Lutheran Church in Kirkland.


The transition was smooth, and our stay with TLC has been nothing short
of a blessing.  Time moves quickly, as always, and our visit here is
almost at an end.  We are scheduled to move again on September 14th,
and our next host will be First United Methodist Church in Bellevue, WA. 

The goal of our campaign is funding the day to day operations of the
camp.  Per our agreements with our host cities and our commitment to
our residents, we provide services and amenities that can range from
kitchen facilities and blankets to transportation and waste removal,
and everything in-between.  Our current operating budget stands at
almost $5000 per month, but the more we raise, the more services we
can provide.  CUE is a recognized nonprofit in the state of Washington                    and a 501c3 charity.

 

It’s easy to hand a couple of bucks to a guy standing by the road holding
a sign, and you hope you’re making a difference.  Your gift of
support to our campaign is just as easy and will go a long way to
ensure that fewer people will be forced to put themselves in that
position.  With your help, Camp Unity Eastside will continue its
ongoing effort to provide shelter, safety, and hope to all those in
need.  Please join us in making a difference in their lives and
making our world a better place to call home.

 

*Exciting news...your contribution just doubled!  A donor has pledged to match all funds raised, so your gift will go twice as far.  Let's make him write a really big check ;)

story:
--Introduction-- who are we and what we do

Food Hacking Base (fhb) is an open group of hackers and food&beverage enthusiast from all over the world who share the love of experimenting with food and beverages. We have promoted these concepts on some of the major hacker events in the last years and recently we started our website becoming permanently active. We are into building tools and coming up with new technologies often based on ancient wisdom of traditional societies merging our ancestors knowledge with today's scientific understanding and technology. Having a good time enjoying excellent food and drinks are important to us too :-)

At our projects you can come to hack food with us just joining or giving one of our donation based workshops, present and chat about some cool idea, cook your favorite dish, just have your pick. We build and run facilities which are supporting these activities like experimental kitchen, workshop venue, bio corner, washing area etc. We are documenting what we do sharing that with the community as our contribution to the open source paradigm with the hope of changing the world for the better and enjoying it on the way!

If you want to get rough idea what we plan to do at 30c3, please check the section --This project, bullet points--, for more detail information how we are going to run the base at the 30c3 and use the money from this campaign please check --The Base in detail--. Many thanks for spreading the word around and for your support, fhb team!


--This project-- bullet points

This crowdfunder is dedicated to building a food&beverage hacking hub at the 30c3, an appropriate place shared with the community where we can all play with food&drinks and more. IMPORTANTLY this is for the first time when we are going to build dedicated experimental kitchen and workshop venue on an indoor event, big challenge which we took up and we need your help! We also create supporting infrastructure and small bio corner and multimedia center. As usually we need tools and equipment (pots, pans, stoves), and of course food ingredient! We'll need all of these to make exotic and exciting experiments and make food hacking accessible getting people into this as we did at OHM2013, the last CCC camp in Finowfurt, 28c3 and 29c3 congresses.

Donations which we receive and do not use will be set aside for the future projects and events, and possibly for compensations of some of the travel and participation cost of our team.

If you want to know more about how the FHB will be used, please read on at the chapter --The base--.


--The base-- in detail

30c3 is a major hacker congress of this year and our fourth one, this time it is quite different because we decided to create as good environment for food, beverage and bio hacking on an indoor event as possible, building and running the necessary facilities, a major goal for us! This is a new thing, at least for us and CCC winter congresses so please promote, support and help!

We are after building a decent experimental kitchen where you can food&beverage hack, or just cook, it should suit 4-6 people at the time quite well. The workshop venue should fit 15-20 people for hands on workshops (donation based no one turned away for lack of funds) so you can learn from an experienced person how to make variety of things. Also on the list is presentation venue, bio corner and variety of supportive infrastructure like washing area, multimedia center, the chill out corner is self explanatory, isn't? We provide this to the community hoping to promote the importance of good food and drinks to our fallow hackers, very needy and important thing to do we believe. First we get the attention of the people by giving away delicious tasters. When they get their interest up we invite them to further "elucidate" themselves both theoretically and practically, learning during hands on workshops how to make their own kombucha, Korean traditional dinner or building their own incubator, the topics are as numerous as people who are involved. Documenting our activities online is crucial, our new fhb wiki portal is dedicated to that. If you prefer just to come and experiment and share with the community, we do our best to provide for you.

The true value of what we do stretches further beyond this event. It is the inspiration, bringing the people together around these topics, helping them to carry on in their own hackerspaces and homes, that is what really matters! This is making the hacker movement more social and "human soft" with the ancient art of food and drinks in the core, keeping it up to date based on an open source paradigm. It brought piece into the lives of our forefathers for thousands of years, lets cherish it too.

If you'd like to know in further detail how your money will be spent, we invite you to take a look at our 30c3 wiki page especially on the budget section.

We want to redistribute our equipment, tools and building material after the event to the communities and people who want to use it, hoping that some of it will join us again temporarily at the future events, please get in touch if interested!

We hope to see you at 30c3 at our spot, many thanks for supporting us, we really appreciate it! :-)

Bitcoins - we are happy to accept Bitcoins, please use this wallet!

Bitcoin account address: 1Ph2ce4rUZei5Bz9GXESAHduczBY2QP2FT

Thank you!

--The goals--


€1000 - The Food Hacking Base is possible! We will be able to build the basic infrastructure for experimental kitchen and workshops.

€1500 - We will be able to buy some better equipment which we can use on the future events.

€2500 - and over. We can design our infrastructure in a such manner that we can easily disassemble it and use it on another events in the future.
story_txt:
--Introduction-- who are we and what we doFood
 Hacking Base (fhb) is an open group of hackers and food&beverage 
enthusiast from all over the world who share the love of experimenting 
with food and beverages. We have promoted these concepts on some of the 
major hacker events in the last years and recently we started our 
website becoming permanently active. We are into building tools and 
coming up with new technologies often based on ancient wisdom of 
traditional societies merging our ancestors knowledge with today's 
scientific understanding and technology. Having a good time enjoying 
excellent food and drinks are important to us too :-)At our projects you can come to hack food with us just joining or giving one of our 
donation based workshops, present and chat about some cool idea, cook your favorite dish, just 
have your pick. We build and run facilities which are supporting these activities 
like experimental kitchen, workshop venue, bio corner, washing area etc. We are 
documenting what we do sharing that with the community as our 
contribution to the open source paradigm with the hope of changing the 
world for the better and enjoying it on the way!If
 you want to get rough idea what we plan to do at 30c3, please check the 
section --This project, bullet points--, for more detail information how
 we are going to run the base at the 30c3 and use the money from this campaign please check --The Base in 
detail--. Many thanks for spreading the word around and for your support, fhb team!
--This project-- bullet pointsThis
 crowdfunder is dedicated to building a food&beverage hacking hub at
 the 30c3, an appropriate place shared with the community where we can 
all play with food&drinks and more. IMPORTANTLY this is for the first time 
when we are going to build dedicated experimental kitchen and workshop venue on
 an indoor event, big challenge which we took up and we need your help! 
We also create supporting infrastructure and small bio corner and multimedia center. As usually we need 
tools and equipment (pots, pans, stoves), and of course food ingredient!
 We'll need all of these to make exotic and exciting experiments and 
make food hacking accessible getting people 
into this as we did at OHM2013, the last CCC camp in Finowfurt, 28c3 and 29c3 
congresses.Donations which we receive and do not use will be set aside for the future projects and events, and possibly for compensations of some of the travel and participation cost of our team.If you want to know more about how the FHB will be used, please read on at the chapter --The base--.
--The base-- in detail30c3 is a major hacker congress of this 
year and our fourth one, this time it is quite different because we decided to create as
 good environment for food, beverage and bio hacking on an indoor event 
as possible, building and running the necessary facilities, a major goal for us! This is a new thing, at least 
for us and CCC winter congresses so please promote, support and help! We
 are after building a decent experimental kitchen where you can 
food&beverage hack, or just cook, it should suit 4-6 people at the 
time quite well. The workshop venue should fit 15-20 people for hands on
 workshops (donation based no one turned away for lack of funds) so you can learn from an experienced
 person how to make variety of things. Also on the list is presentation venue, bio corner and variety of supportive infrastructure like washing area, 
multimedia center, the chill out corner is self explanatory, isn't? We provide this to the community hoping to promote the 
importance of good food and drinks to our fallow hackers, very needy and
 important thing to do we believe. First we get the attention of the people by giving away delicious tasters. When they get their interest
 up we invite them to further "elucidate" themselves both theoretically and 
practically, learning during hands on workshops how to make their own kombucha, Korean traditional dinner or building their own incubator, the 
topics are as numerous as people who are involved. Documenting our activities online is crucial, our new fhb wiki portal is dedicated to that. If you prefer just to 
come and experiment and share with the community, we do our best to provide 
for you. The true value of what we do stretches further beyond this event. It is the inspiration, bringing the 
people together around these topics, helping them to carry on in 
their own hackerspaces and homes, that is what really 
matters! This is making the hacker movement more social 
and "human soft" with the ancient art of food and drinks in the core, keeping it up to date based on an open source paradigm. It brought piece into the lives of our forefathers for thousands of years, lets cherish it too.If
 you'd like to know in further detail how your money will be spent, we 
invite you to take a look at our 30c3 wiki page especially on the budget section.We
 want to redistribute our equipment, tools and building material after 
the event to the communities and people who want to use it, hoping that some 
of it will join us again temporarily at the future events, please get in touch if interested!We hope to see you at 30c3 at our spot, many thanks for supporting us, we really appreciate it! :-)Bitcoins - we are happy to accept Bitcoins, please use this wallet!Bitcoin account address: 1Ph2ce4rUZei5Bz9GXESAHduczBY2QP2FTThank you!--The goals--€1000 - The Food Hacking Base is possible! We will be able to build the basic infrastructure for experimental kitchen and workshops.€1500 - We will be able to buy some better equipment which we can use on the future events.€2500
 - and over. We can design our infrastructure in a such manner that we 
can easily disassemble it and use it on another events in the future.

story:
The Entusi Women's Association - Kabale, Uganda

                                     

$30k will help us:

1).  Officially Launch a Business for the Women's Association that will provide employment opportunities and personal income for 65 women.


2).  Hire a local Ugandan to manage and market this business to rural Uganda.  


3).  Develop a more intentional public-private sector partnership with the GLI and our work with students from the University of Colorado Denver.

                                                                                                                                              

The Entusi Women’s Association (EWA) provides the opportunity for the women of Lake Bunyonyi to actively participate in community development. Engaging in projects inspired by the Entusi philosophy,the women have the capacity become agents of positive change through their collective voice. 

                                                                                                                                              

Mission Statement:

  • Establish a network and forum by which the women of Lake Bunyonyi can establish a dignified ,collective voice in developing their community.

Objectives:

  • Women’s Empowerment: By providing the space for women to join together with a collective voice, the women of Lake Bunyonyi will have the capacity to be agents of positive change.
  • Community Investment: The profits made by the various Entusi products will go to community projects by which the women will choose based on their own needs assessment.
  • Income Generation: The projects adopted by the women will provide a steady income tapping into various markets including the Entusi Retreat Center

Through the six established projects, the women will collectively combine the profits every three months. The Association will meet at this time to decide which community development projects will be awarded an EWA grant. These projects include educational opportunities, health clinics, community farming etc. 

The women will vote based where they see the biggest issues in their community. Creating a community network and investment program empowers these women to actively become agents of their own community development.

(Photo taken on first annual Women's Retreat in June 2013 - Women community leaders from the US, Uganda and Rwanda gather to discuss leadership and development).





￼Mission Statement

  • ￼Our goal is to provide the forum for important conversations in creating positive change while showcasing the beauty of East Africa.

Entusi Resort and Retreat Center: GLI at Lake Bunyonyi is a destination for travelers, community leaders and students alike to experience the beauty of Lake Bunyonyi in the Kabale District of Uganda.  The interactive facility provides accommodations, an affordable high-quality restaurant, and conference center open to anyone gathering for a meaningful purpose or simply to enjoy Lake Bunyonyi’s spectacular views.  Film festivals, music festivals, guest lectures, access to social media and creative dialogues are on the calendar each month to engage the minds of those who venture to Entusi.  ￼

￼Objectives

Inclusivity:

  • To create a truly unique and interactive environment of empowerment and dignity for everyone.

Community Asset:

  • To reinvest resources into the Lake Bunyonyi region.

Collaboration and Dialogue: 

  • To create a space for community collaborations, interactive conversations , and academic partnerships.

Community Building:

  • Provide a unique experience that engages and promotes the culture, community, and tranquil landscapes of Lake Bunyonyi.

Background

Entusi Resort and Retreat Center: GLI at Lake Bunyonyi is a destination for travelers, community leaders and students alike to experience the beauty of Lake Bunyonyi in the Kabale District of Uganda.  The interactive facility provides accommodations, an affordable high-quality restaurant, and conference center open to anyone gathering for a meaningful purpose or simply to enjoy Lake Bunyonyi’s spectacular views.  Film festivals, music festivals, guest lectures, access to social media and creative dialogues are on the calendar each month to engage the minds of those who venture to Entusi.  

Ultimately, the premise is consistent with the mission of the Global Livingston Institute and is designed to engage young people and community leaders to listen and think before acting.  Similarly, the Bellagio Center was designed to accomplish.  The Rockefeller Foundation Bellagio Center's mission is to promote innovation and identify impact-oriented solutions to critical global problems. The Center, through conferences and residency programs, supports the work of scholars, artists, thought leaders, policymakers, and practitioners who share in the Foundation’s pioneering mission to “promote the well-being of humanity.” The Center has a record of major impact, from meetings that led to the Green Revolution and the Global AIDS vaccine initiative, to residencies that furthered the work of Glenn Ligon. This legacy, the serene work environment on the shore of Lake Como in northern Italy, the diverse groups of people, and the promise of future achievements make Bellagio an inspiring and productive forum for fostering positive change. 

Entusi's Grand Opening

Learn more about Entusi on Tumblr

Check out GLI on 9 News! (2010)

Lean more about GLI

story:
Our Vision

Making art a vehicle of transformation to empower young Palestinian women’s social and political resistance against an environment of Israeli colonial occupation and violence.

Program Overview 

Since 2007 the AIC has been working with communities in the West Bank's Hebron region under the title Art is Resistance. With this program the AIC promotes change by enhancing social, political and cultural voices of Palestinian women, visioning and voicing ideas that create a future free of Israeli colonial occupation and violence.

The program trains 40 young women from the Hebron area yearly, helping them to develop artistic capacities while sharing perspectives on beauty, art and personal expression. Through the weekly, half-day program, participants are given tools of expression to help them cope with the violent reality of their surroundings, while strengthening their creativity and artistic senses, building confidence in their abilities and helping them produce their own art. Twice yearly art exhibitions in Hebron are an integral part of the program, providing participants the opportunity to publicly share their art with the wider community.

Why Art?

Art, as a language, empowers the participating women across cultural, economic and social barriers to voice realities of a life under the double oppression of colonial occupation and patriarchy. While emphasizing independence, art makes collaboration a tool to transform aspirations into reality, translating personal strengths into critical and creative thinking.

 Problem 

The occupied West Bank city of Hebron is a microcosm of the Israeli occupation, with settlements both surrounding and in the heart of the city; the Separation Wall choking residents from the east and north; massive Israeli military presence, land confiscations and daily violations of human and national rights.The devastation wrought by years of Israeli occupation, clashes and tensions has led to structural socio-economic and political instability, with an extremely negative impact on Palestinian culture and identity.

Opportunities are extremely limited in Hebron. The Hebron district suffers from the highest rates of unemployment and poverty in the West Bank, with women bearing the brunt of these hardships. This area is also one of the most socially conservative, and accepted opportunities for women to acquire cultural tools such as painting and drawing are almost non-existent.

The Participants

The participants are Palestinian girl children and women, aged 16 and above, who come primarily from the villages surrounding the city of Hebron. Many of the women don't work outside the home and their economic situations are difficult. For all participants, the art is resistance training opens a window onto their interior and exterior worlds, a life-changing window that would otherwise not be opened.

The Art Trainer

Renowned Palestinian artist Yousef Katalo studied art during his seven years in Israeli prison, and continued to create art when later imprisoned by the Palestinian Authority.  Katalo says that when empowering participants in the art workshop, "my aim is to make the students identify themselves and find ways to express all the different feelings arising from the Palestinian situation." Katalo adds that his art is "on the side of the weak, the poor, the oppressed. With my paintings I want to send a message that can create political and social awareness."

The Opportunity 

By invigorating participant’s personal strengths in meaningful ways the program provide them with new routes of participation in the resistance to colonial occupation as subjects of change. Participants are not passively waiting for a future beyond the realm of occupation and patriarchy, but helping to forge such a future.  

Our Current Need 

We need $10,000 to cover the 2014 art is resistance training costs: art supplies, a stipend for the trainer and two public exhibitions of the participants' art works.

$45 covers the cost of art supplies (canvases, paints, brushes, pencils and paper) for one week's training of 40 participants

$150 covers the art trainer's stipend for one week

$320 covers the costs of one exhibition

story:
TECHO is a youth led non-profit organization present in 19 countries across Latin America and the Caribbean. Through the joint work of families living in extreme poverty with youth volunteers,TECHO seeks to overcome poverty in slums. TECHO is convinced that poverty can be permanently eradicated if society as a whole recognizes it as a priority and actively works towards overcoming poverty.

TECHO – Ecuador was founded in May 2008. Ever since, TECHO Ecuador has built more than 1,500 transitional houses and has mobilized more than 15,000 volunteers. Furthermore, TECHO operates in over 12 provinces around Ecuador.


Description

In cooperation with In Terris Foundation, TECHO Ecuador seeks to install ecological sanitary facilities for 100 families who live in unreasonable living conditions in the most excluded regions of Ecuador. These sanitary facilities work without the usage of water and electricity. Additionally, they produce fertilizer for the agriculture.

What is the issue, problem or challenge?

2.5 billion people in the world live without access to sanitary facilities. In Ecuador, there are 3 million people that have never had access to adequate sanitation facilities. 

Communities without proper sanitation facilities create critical health hazards such as the contamination of fresh water reservoirs. In addition, communities are exposed to diseases that are transmitted by poor hygiene, resulting in gastroduodenal disorder which is the 3rd largest cause of death in the world.

What does the ecological sanitary facilities look like?

The ecological sanitary facilities are decentralized, in other words, they do not depend on a drainage system or water in general. The unit is installed to be used mechanically.

Feces are mixed with sawdust in order to not only ensure hygiene, but to create fertilizer that is used to grow crops.

Where and when?

The project will take place in Manabí, Guayas, Azuay, and Pichincha benefiting 100 families which equals 500 people. The installation will begin on April 2014.

Sustainability of the project:

Beginning on May 2014, TECHO Ecuador plans to evaluate the functionality of the unit and its ecological and hygienic effects through surveys in the communities and post-construction activities.

The most important objective is to improve the living conditions of these families living in the most excluded slums. In January of 2015, the project will be finished with a detailed report.


These ecological sanitary facilities have been in used in Guayaquil, Ecuador where they have experienced great success. These units not only improve the living conditions of families and their communities, but they also benefit the environment.

Together we can make a change.  


Montecristi, Manabi, Ecuador

story:
A group of dedicated individuals and organizations invites you to partner with us to make it possible for Israeli and Palestinian grassroots leaders to be together inside Palestinian Territory, to increase their effectiveness. We invite you to support us in exploring what happens. When we work together as peers and partners to develop our own skills, self-awareness and ability to contribute to the organizations, movements and communities which we serve?


Short Summary

Can you imagine Israeli, Palestinian, and international leaders, teachers, and organizers gathering together inside Palestinian Territory for four days to learn leadership and decision making that can propel their own organizations, projects, and communities to the next level of visionary growth and effectiveness? We imagined it, and are putting it into action December 19-22 in Beit Jalla, Palestine, in a historic event, the first ever training in Convergent Facilitation in the Middle East. We are asking for your support to make it possible for all who want to attend this training regardless of their own means. 


What is Convergent Facilitation?

Convergent Facilitation is leadership training based on Nonviolent Communication (NVC), developed by Miki Kashtan, a senior Nonviolent Communication trainer. Miki inspirers and mentors thousands of people in the global movement for transformation of ourselves, our consciousness, our societies and the power structures that are holding us all back from living together with dignity, safety, freedom and respect.

Miki was born in Israel and has lived in the USA for many years. As a senior NVC trainer, she particularly focuses on systems change, leadership and empowerment, all within the consciousness context of NVC. She is a master facilitator and teacher who inspires people around the world. She has developed Convergent Facilitation, an application of NVC that breaks new ground in supporting groups to work together effectively and make decisions that are acceptable to all. Her work demonstrates that we don't have to compromise either collaboration or efficiency when working with a group.  

With Convergent Facilitation, the principles of Nonviolent Communication are embedded into facilitation, decision making and leadership. 


Why Is This Important?

Underneath the radar of the struggling peace talks and continuing violence, there is a growing movement among Palestinians and Israelis that needs leadership and grassroots training for its leaders. This includes teachers, parents, doctors, business and community leaders and officials who are involved in their own communities to create a culture of nonviolence and a better life. This includes people who are open to discovering authentic new ways to be together, strengthening each others’ courage, determination and skills to work for peace and better lives. 

There is an urgent need for opportunities for people in the Mideast to learn, grow, and explore together.

These people, both public figures and unknown individuals, are sometimes risking their lives, often lovingly embracing the cost of social alienation and lack of resources, and always taking on systems and norms that perpetuate separation and even hatred. Their yearning for transformation, a future that works for all their children, and shared places at the table inspire us to offer them what we have to ease their struggles. 


Response to this Project

The response for this training has been deeply inspiring. We have an outpouring of people and organizations who want to attend, from Israel, Palestine, Jordan, Europe, North America, and all the way to Thailand. The range of organizations already represented in the list of attendees is giving us confidence that our efforts to make this happen are meeting a deep need for support and connection. We are overjoyed to imagine how much more effective everyone will be in their work and efforts towards transformation after immersing themselves in this learning environment. 


More Information about the Event Itself

For full details, go to www.steps2peace.com for a flyer in English, Arabic, or Hebrew. The training in Convergent Facilitation will take place over 4 days in Beit Jalla, Palestine, with 60 participants from a cross section of Israeli Jewish, Israeli Palestinian and Palestinian society. The program is hosted by Holy Land Trust and includes several other organizations from the region.

This is a unique opportunity for Jewish and Palestinian leaders and organizers, with counterparts from other parts of the world, to train as equal learners and partners together, to explore new territory together; in short, to experience and learn together as peers, colleagues and seekers


What We Need & What You Get

Our hosts and partners, the Holy Land Trust and NVC Mideast, are working tirelessly to make the training as financially accessible as possible. Together we have created a subsidized budget. Participants from US and European economies are asked to give the full cost of their participation, which is US$600 (including room and board at the Everest Hotel in Beit Jalla). People in the Mideast are asked to give NIS500 to participate. This difference reflects the divergent realities within which people in the region live. In total, we are attempting to raise $36,000. Some of this amount will come from contributions and donations that attendees will give based on their ability to do so. We also know that many will attend who cannot contribute the full amount or even part of it. We want everyone to be able to participate, and we want to be able to give some money to the trainers and organizers who are putting this event together. This is the reason we are creating this campaign: without it, we are not confident we can cover our costs, let alone give some money to the trainers and organizers whose livelihood is tied up with this kind of work. 

Whether or not you can be there, we hope you will be inspired by what we are trying to do, that you will choose to contribute from your heart to make this training a success, so that it becomes sustainable for Israeli-Jewish and Palestinian leaders and activists to be together as peers and partners to develop our skills, self-awareness, and ability to contribute to the organizations, movements, and communities which they serve.

What you get is the satisfaction of contributing to the ongoing efforts to bring vision and hope to the region, the possibility of attending the event, and a report we plan on writing after the event, so you know what your contribution supported. In addition, depending on the amount of your contribution, you can get additional gifts – see the sidebar for more information.


Who We Are

Miki Kashtan is certified NVC trainer, is a founder of Bay Area Nonviolent Communication and the North America Leadership Program. She is inspired by the role of visionary leadership in shaping a livable future, and works toward that vision by sharing the principles and practices of Nonviolent Communication through mediation, meeting facilitation, consulting, and training for organizations and for committed individuals. Miki blogs at the Fearless Heart. Her articles have appeared in Tikkun magazine, Waging Nonviolence, Shareable, and elsewhere. Her first book, Spinning Threads of Radical Aliveness: Transcending the Legacy of Separation in Our Individual Lives is due out in early 2014. She holds a Ph.D. in Sociology from UC Berkeley.


Roberta Wall is a lawyer, mediator, trainer, parent, activist, mindfulness practitioner and coach.  She shares her time between Israel and the beautiful Hudson River Valley of Upstate New York and travels the world coaching couples, individuals and organizations and facilitating workshops and retreats inspired by Nonviolent Communication (NVC) as developed by Dr. Marshall Rosenberg and Buddhist teachers Thich Nhat Hanh and the Dalai Lama, and teachers and rabbis from her root Jewish tradition. 


Sami Awad is is the Executive Director of Holy Land Trust. At a young age, Sami was influenced by the teaching of his uncle Mubarak Awad, the Palestinian activist who promoted nonviolent resistance to the occupation during the first Intifadah (popular uprising) and was arrested and deported for his peaceful / nonviolent activists by the Israeli government. Through working with Mubarak, Sami was introduced to great leaders and visionaries of the global nonviolence movement; from Jesus to Gandhi to King. Sami Awad holds a Masters Degree in International Relations from the American University in Washington D.C. and an undergraduate degree in Political Science from the University of Kansas.Since his return and establishment of HLT, Sami has engaged himself locally, through promoting and engaging in nonviolence, healing and transformation work and globally through visiting and speaking in different countries, communities, political and religious organizations in places such as India, South Africa, numerous European countries, and the US.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word! Think of people you know who are longing to see positive action in support of transformation in the region, people who want to value the lives of everyone in this tortured piece of land. Tell them about the opportunity to participate - both as learners at the event, and as partners and co-sponsors in making this possible. Speak about this at your synagogue, church, or mosque, share it on your Facebook page and elsewhere.

Thank you already for your heart and support. Remember, in these kinds of campaigns, no amount is too large or too small.


-Miki, Roberta, Sami and the many others who support this work.
story_txt: A group of dedicated individuals and organizations invites you to partner with us to make it possible for Israeli and Palestinian grassroots leaders to be together inside Palestinian Territory, to increase their effectiveness. We invite you to support us in exploring what happens. When we work together as peers and partners to develop our own skills, self-awareness and ability to contribute to the organizations, movements and communities which we serve?Short SummaryCan you imagine Israeli, Palestinian, and international leaders, teachers, and organizers gathering together inside Palestinian Territory for four days to learn leadership and decision making that can propel their own organizations, projects, and communities to the next level of visionary growth and effectiveness? We imagined it, and are putting it into action December 19-22 in Beit Jalla, Palestine, in a historic event, the first ever training in Convergent Facilitation in the Middle East. We are asking for your support to make it possible for all who want to attend this training regardless of their own means. What is Convergent Facilitation?Convergent Facilitation is leadership training based on Nonviolent Communication (NVC), developed by Miki Kashtan, a senior Nonviolent Communication trainer. Miki inspirers and mentors thousands of people in the global movement for transformation of ourselves, our consciousness, our societies and the power structures that are holding us all back from living together with dignity, safety, freedom and respect.Miki was born in Israel and has lived in the USA for many years. As a senior NVC trainer, she particularly focuses on systems change, leadership and empowerment, all within the consciousness context of NVC. She is a master facilitator and teacher who inspires people around the world. She has developed Convergent Facilitation, an application of NVC that breaks new ground in supporting groups to work together effectively and make decisions that are acceptable to all. Her work demonstrates that we don't have to compromise either collaboration or efficiency when working with a group.  With Convergent Facilitation, the principles of Nonviolent Communication are embedded into facilitation, decision making and leadership. Why Is This Important?Underneath the radar of the struggling peace talks and continuing violence, there is a growing movement among Palestinians and Israelis that needs leadership and grassroots training for its leaders. This includes teachers, parents, doctors, business and community leaders and officials who are involved in their own communities to create a culture of nonviolence and a better life. This includes people who are open to discovering authentic new ways to be together, strengthening each others’ courage, determination and skills to work for peace and better lives. There is an urgent need for opportunities for people in the Mideast to learn, grow, and explore together.These people, both public figures and unknown individuals, are sometimes risking their lives, often lovingly embracing the cost of social alienation and lack of resources, and always taking on systems and norms that perpetuate separation and even hatred. Their yearning for transformation, a future that works for all their children, and shared places at the table inspire us to offer them what we have to ease their struggles. Response to this ProjectThe response for this training has been deeply inspiring. We have an outpouring of people and organizations who want to attend, from Israel, Palestine, Jordan, Europe, North America, and all the way to Thailand. The range of organizations already represented in the list of attendees is giving us confidence that our efforts to make this happen are meeting a deep need for support and connection. We are overjoyed to imagine how much more effective everyone will be in their work and efforts towards transformation after immersing themselves in this learning environment. More Information about the Event ItselfFor full details, go to www.steps2peace.com for a flyer in English, Arabic, or Hebrew. The training in Convergent Facilitation will take place over 4 days in Beit Jalla, Palestine, with 60 participants from a cross section of Israeli Jewish, Israeli Palestinian and Palestinian society. The program is hosted by Holy Land Trust and includes several other organizations from the region.This is a unique opportunity for Jewish and Palestinian leaders and organizers, with counterparts from other parts of the world, to train as equal learners and partners together, to explore new territory together; in short, to experience and learn together as peers, colleagues and seekersWhat We Need & What You GetOur hosts and partners, the Holy Land Trust and NVC Mideast, are working tirelessly to make the training as financially accessible as possible. Together we have created a subsidized budget. Participants from US and European economies are asked to give the full cost of their participation, which is US$600 (including room and board at the Everest Hotel in Beit Jalla). People in the Mideast are asked to give NIS500 to participate. This difference reflects the divergent realities within which people in the region live. In total, we are attempting to raise $36,000. Some of this amount will come from contributions and donations that attendees will give based on their ability to do so. We also know that many will attend who cannot contribute the full amount or even part of it. We want everyone to be able to participate, and we want to be able to give some money to the trainers and organizers who are putting this event together. This is the reason we are creating this campaign: without it, we are not confident we can cover our costs, let alone give some money to the trainers and organizers whose livelihood is tied up with this kind of work. Whether or not you can be there, we hope you will be inspired by what we are trying to do, that you will choose to contribute from your heart to make this training a success, so that it becomes sustainable for Israeli-Jewish and Palestinian leaders and activists to be together as peers and partners to develop our skills, self-awareness, and ability to contribute to the organizations, movements, and communities which they serve.What you get is the satisfaction of contributing to the ongoing efforts to bring vision and hope to the region, the possibility of attending the event, and a report we plan on writing after the event, so you know what your contribution supported. In addition, depending on the amount of your contribution, you can get additional gifts – see the sidebar for more information.Who We AreMiki Kashtan is certified NVC trainer, is a founder of Bay Area Nonviolent Communication and the North America Leadership Program. She is inspired by the role of visionary leadership in shaping a livable future, and works toward that vision by sharing the principles and practices of Nonviolent Communication through mediation, meeting facilitation, consulting, and training for organizations and for committed individuals. Miki blogs at the Fearless Heart. Her articles have appeared in Tikkun magazine, Waging Nonviolence, Shareable, and elsewhere. Her first book, Spinning Threads of Radical Aliveness: Transcending the Legacy of Separation in Our Individual Lives is due out in early 2014. She holds a Ph.D. in Sociology from UC Berkeley.Roberta Wall is a lawyer, mediator, trainer, parent, activist, mindfulness practitioner and coach.  She shares her time between Israel and the beautiful Hudson River Valley of Upstate New York and travels the world coaching couples, individuals and organizations and facilitating workshops and retreats inspired by Nonviolent Communication (NVC) as developed by Dr. Marshall Rosenberg and Buddhist teachers Thich Nhat Hanh and the Dalai Lama, and teachers and rabbis from her root Jewish tradition. Sami Awad is is the Executive Director of Holy Land Trust. At a young age, Sami was influenced by the teaching of his uncle Mubarak Awad, the Palestinian activist who promoted nonviolent resistance to the occupation during the first Intifadah (popular uprising) and was arrested and deported for his peaceful / nonviolent activists by the Israeli government. Through working with Mubarak, Sami was introduced to great leaders and visionaries of the global nonviolence movement; from Jesus to Gandhi to King. Sami Awad holds a Masters Degree in International Relations from the American University in Washington D.C. and an undergraduate degree in Political Science from the University of Kansas.Since his return and establishment of HLT, Sami has engaged himself locally, through promoting and engaging in nonviolence, healing and transformation work and globally through visiting and speaking in different countries, communities, political and religious organizations in places such as India, South Africa, numerous European countries, and the US.Other Ways You Can HelpPlease spread the word! story:
Summary

The Savannah College of Art and Design is one of the country's leading arts institutions with programs in Savannah, Atlanta, Hong Kong, and online. Students of SCAD's Masters program in Arts Administration have the opportunity to be members of Student Arts Managers.

The online program's SAM club is raising funds in order to attend the annual Arts Advocacy Day hosted by Americans for the Arts.

Arts Advocacy Day is a 3-day event in Washington, DC where artists from all over the country have the opportunity to network and to reach out to Congress in an effort to drive reform and advocate for arts and arts education.

What We Need & What You Get

The $4,500 we need will go towards the following:

Registration costs: $110/person

Lodging: Host hotel (Omni Shoreham) $239/night/room plus tax and $42/day for parking

Travel: $200/person to pay for gas, rental cars, and plane flights. eSAM members are not based on campus in Savannah, and must travel separately in order to get to DC.

Food: $60/day/person

Perks:

We understand that the economy is rough; that's why we have come up with unique perks in order to thank you for your generosity!

Postcards from DC, souvenirs from each participant's home state, and video proof that we are all talented artists are just a few of the rewards that we have prepared for you!


If we don't reach our entire goal, we don't all get to go to DC. That's not fair, so help us raise enough money for everyone to benefit from this experience!

The Impact

The arts and arts education are constantly suffering on Capitol Hill. At Arts Advocacy Day, we will not only take away valuable information that will help further our careers, but we will meet with legislators and be advocates to help garner support for the arts in Congress.

As artists ourselves, we have experienced the impact that they have had on our lives and how our art forms have shaped us as individuals. With any luck, everyone will soon realize how important the arts are to our identity as a nation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign with your family and friends!

story:
Tremors Nation

Tremors is a team of young skaters dedicated to the challenging and fun sport of synchronized skating. We represent the Skate Club of San Francisco and the Yerba Buena Ice Skating Center. Our teams compete in US Figure Skating and ISI sanctioned events, including Sectional and National Synchronized Skating Championships.

Building on our success in recent years, the members of the 2013 Tremors Intermediate team, which won the silver medal in last year's Pacific Coast Sectional Championships and sixth in the US National Championships, challenged themselves to move up to the Junior level for the 2014 season.  As second highest level in US Figure Skating, Junior teams skate at a higher level and are required to skate two programs in each competition. The key to success is more practice and workouts to develop team cohesiveness and skating skills. With your help, the Tremors Junior team will be prepared to represent San Francisco and the entire Pacific Coast at the US Synchronized Skating Championship in Colorado Springs!

What We Need & What You Get

Practice, Practice, Practice. For any team sport this is important. For Synchronized Skating, this involves reserving an entire ice rink. Taking advantage of discounts at different times and rinks, Tremors Junior team skaters practice at 5 am and travel over an hour to make sure they can get the hours of workouts needed to be successful. The cost of these practices far exceed the $5,000 target for this campaign, but helps defray the expense for our skaters who need the help.

We hope this campaign will help the Tremors continue building our organization and our effort to increase the popularity of and participation in Synchronized Skating in the San Francisco Bay Area.

Contributors will be updated on the Tremors progress as we prepare for our trip to the USFS National Synchronized Skating Championships.

The Impact

The Tremors Synchronized Skating teams are largely funded by the skater's families. Moving up and building the Tremors organization has added new demands for funds. Addition practices required to prepare at the Junior level. A sport that already stretches family budgets are stretched further, especially for our skaters with lesser means. Building a diverse Junior team helps inspire the younger Tremor teams and the Tremor organization as we promote the amazing sport of Synchronized Skating.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can make a donation, but you can help in many other ways:

  • Please let others know about this campaign and the Tremors 
  • If you know a skater, let them know about the Tremors and synchronized skating
  • Visit our website regularly to see how our teams are performing and where Tremors will be skating.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools on this site.

Thank You from the
San Francisco Tremors Synchronized Skating Teams!

story:
Tuition Fee for human trafficking and sex slavery victim Bekunda Sunday


(If you would like with use other payment methods than PayPal or credit card, or if you have any questions, please contact: tuitionfee.for.bekundasunday@gmail.com.)

(Dear companies, if you would like to sponsor this campaign and wish for further cooperation, please contact: tuitionfee.for.bekundasunday@gmail.com.)

About me and the idea

My name is Valerio Montanari. I am a 20-year-old student in Germany and I read about Bekunda Sunday's history on RNW.org. He is a victim of human trafficking and sex slavery and needs money to pay his tuition fees. I was able to contact him personally by giving my contact information to RNW which forwarded it to Bekunda Sunday.


About Bekunda Sunday

Bekunda Sunday is a 26-year-old student at Makerere University in Kampala, Uganda. He is aiming for a Bachelor's Degree in Tourism. Less then 0.2% of the total Ugandan population is in higher education at the moment (in Germany it's almost 4%, in the US around 5,5%). This means he is offered a big chance.

When he was looking for a job to pay his tuition fees, he met a gentleman named Charles in early January 2013. He offered him a job and seemed to be very nice and friendly, so Bekunda went with him and other students to Kenya. In Kenya he and the other victims were forced to give away their IDs and were threatened with death. To brake the victims' spirit, Charles and his accomplices killed a victim who tried to escape and made the whole group watch.

Bekunda and the other victims were forced to have sexual intercourse, with boys and girls, in front of cameras, and were given alcohol and intravenous drugs. They were constantly mistreated, beaten up, threatened with death and also forced to prostitute themselves. Every day Bekunda was forced to have intercourse with 5 to 10 people, catching all major venereal diseases and suffering from the pain caused by the medication they gave him to keep him going.

The escape

After being held the whole January and February, Bekunda was able to escape in early March 2013 when a man from the UK contacted Charles. He wanted him to send Bekunda to the UK so that he could have his private love partner. Because Bekunda does not speak Swaheli it would not have been believable to fake a Kenyan passport, so they had to go back to Uganda to get the original passport. On the way to Uganda Bekunda was able to escape.

Living with the trauma

He reported the case to the police but since Charles is a powerful man, nothing was done to him. After living on the street for a while and three months of medical and psycho-social therapy Bekunda reported the case to the newspapers. He has been receiving threats by human traffickers ever since. Two weeks after his mother had read about his ordeal in the newspaper, she passed away.

Bekunda insisted that his name should be in the newspapers because he did not want to hide anymore. He wants to warn young people about human traffickers and hopes he can be of help one day.

I contacted Mnason Tweheyo, Professor and Dean at Makerere University, who has confirmed that this story is real.


The Project: Help for Bekunda Sunday

Even though the University has allowed him to finish his studies, he still needs to pay tuition fees. Since Uganda is a country with an extremely high youth unemployment rate (62% according to theguardian.com and 83% according to the African Development Bank) he was not able to find a job. 

This is what this campaign is taking care of. 

The 4000 USD will be spent for:

  • Tuition fee: 600 USD
  • Functional fee: 300 USD
  • Accommodation: 320 USD
  • Meals: 400 USD
  • Stationery: 80 USD
  • debt for paying rent and maintenance in 2013 and 2014: 2100 USD (including transaction fees)
  • campaign expenses: 200 USD (approx. 200 USD for indiegogo)

4000 USD are enough to ensure that Sunday can finish his studies. All money raised above 4000 USD will be used to help Sunday start up a business after university. 

All numbers are confirmed by Prof. Tweheyo.

Please note the perks I offer: For 5 USD I thank you publicly on Facebook (see link below). For 35 USD your name will appear in the outro of the Thank-You-Video. For 75 USD you will also be thanked personally in the video by Bekunda Sunday himself. For 200 USD you will additionally get a personal thank-you-letter, hand-written by Bekunda Sunday.

If you do not want to or can not donate money, you can also help by telling your friends and sharing this campaign on social media. 

If you would like to use other payment methods than PayPal or credit card or if you have any questions, please contact: tuitionfee.for.bekundasunday@gmail.com

For more information see the following links:

http://www.rnw.nl/africa/article/ugandan-university-students-forced-be-porn-actors-against-their-will
http://www.rnw.nl/africa/article/ugandan-student-forced-porn-now-under-threat
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GavHFH4jdG4
http://www.facebook.com/tuitionfee.for.bekundasunday

Thank you very much.
Valerio Montanari

For more information see the following links: 
http://www.rnw.nl/africa/article/ugandan-university-students-forced-be-porn-actors-against-their-willhttp://www.rnw.nl/africa/article/ugandan-student-forced-porn-now-under-threathttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GavHFH4jdG4http://www.facebook.com/tuitionfee.for.bekundasundayThank you very much.Valerio Montanari

story:
I have an audacious goal to help 100,000 women in developing and emerging economies pursue the careers and lives they dream of. 

If you are also passionate about seeing women succeed and reach their economic potential, I hope you'll help and donate a book today! 

FULFILLING MY LIFELONG DREAM: WRITING THIS BOOK

The past 20 years of my life have been dedicated to helping women advance in their careers and businesses.

Four years ago, I founded TheWayWomenWork.com, a career advice platform for women in emerging economies. Thousands of women visit the site every month to seek the career guidance they need. 

Over these past four years, I have also conducted global research and written the first career advice book for women in emerging markets. 

The book, set for an early 2015 release, is titled Undeterred: The Six Success Habits of Women in Emerging Economies.

Most of you have been with me on this long journey to realize my lifelong professional dream: thank you for all of your encouragement, guidance and support!

TWO WAYS YOU CAN HELP ME LAUNCH THE BOOK

If unleashing the success of women around the world moves you, here are two things you can do TODAY:

  1. Back this campaign now! Donate to help a young women launch their careers or businesses. Below is an example of the type of woman you will be helping. 

  2. Help spread the word! Share this project with one person you know who is also passionate about seeing women succeed. 

We have 17 days to make this campaign a success! 

I am confident that together we can get this important book into the hands of aspiring young women around the world who need inspiration and actionable advice to succeed in their careers and businesses.

You and I have the power to use our voices and financial resources for good - and in this case, to make a difference in the lives of so many others.

Will you help me accelerate the success of 100,000 women around the world?

WHY?

  1. THERE'S A GAP. There’s a gap between the knowledge women gain through their university education and the workplace skills they need to succeed at work. 
  2. THERE'S A NEED. Women in emerging economies regularly tell me that they don’t have access to non-western, culturally relevant career guidance to help them close that gap.
  3. THE FUTURE WORKFORCE. Businesses around the world are increasingly dependent on the skills and work of highly-educated women in emerging economies. As women graduate from universities at higher rates than men, companies have to figure out how to bring them into the workforce. The future of these companies and the global economy is dependent on women succeeding at work.
  4. ENOUGH NEGATIVITY. I’ve grown weary of hearing the media and others talk almost exclusively about the obstacles women in developing and emerging economies face. While much of it is true, the fact of the matter is that there are also MILLIONS of women that we never hear about who are succeeding (see thewaywomenwork.com). I want to share women’s progress, not their plight!

My heritage, expertise and unrelenting passion make me uniquely qualified to close these gaps. Learn more about my background at raniaanderson.com.

UNDETERRED: The Six Success Habits of Women in Emerging Economies

I’ll let you in on the secret ingredients that make Undeterred so unique: it's based on the experiences of 250+ relatable business women in emerging economies. Inside, I share very specific actions that the reader can take to succeed at work. It provides women with the what, why and how to succeed.

Undeterred features women of all ages (24-64), at all stages in their careers (from just out of college to the C-Suite), who are both entrepreneurs and women in corporate careers. 

These are not Western women and they aren’t on the ‘Forbes 100’ lists; they are women in emerging markets with everyday challenges. In spite of the numerous obstacles they face, they are bold and successful, with inspiring stories about their professional paths. They are heroes, not victims. They are the example that other women look to and think, “I want to be like her - I can do that too.”

Undeterred is about empowerment. It's about giving a whole new generation of women in emerging economies the ability to achieve financial self-sufficiency and to make a contribution in the world.

MEET ONE OF THE WOMEN THE BOOK IS FOR & ABOUT

Regina Agyare had a good job in information technology (IT) at a bank in Accra, Ghana. But she wanted something more. She wanted to use her coding skills and passion for technology to start her own business. 

She wanted to be a catalyst for social change in her country.

When she decided to leave her job and steady paycheck, all she heard were warnings and negative comments: “You will probably come back; you aren’t married; you should wait until you are older, until you have more assets...”

But she didn’t let that stop her. In March 2012, she left the bank to start her company, Soronko Solutions. And even though she was confident in her choice, “It [was] scary and I felt alone,” Regina said. 

It was around that time that she found me on Twitter. 

“The Way Women Work was my saving grace,” Regina said. “I didn't have access to mentors or a network. On the site I got access to stories shared by other female entrepreneurs from all over the world. I was motivated, inspired and most importantly, I learned valuable lessons that helped me shape my entrepreneurial idea and build my business.”

Regina returned to The Way Women Work many times to seek the advice and relatable stories as she needed. 

Regina has continued to build her business over the past two years and is currently working on developing a sex education web platform for young people at noyawagh.com.

To share just a few of Regina's accomplishments over the past few years: in 2013 Regina founded Tech Needs Girls, an organization aimed at getting Ghanaian girls to get started in tech. In March 2014, Regina and her business was featured on CNN African-Startups and was selected to be a part of the U.S. White House Young African Leaders Initiative. She is an Aspen New Voices Fellow, and was recently mentored a group of 720 girls in the MasterCard Scholars Program. 

“I think there is a need for The Way Women Work's advice and website, for professional women in Ghana and in other emerging economies," Regina said. 

"I was in some dark times when I first started my business, and The Way Women Work really lifted my spirits and gave me ideas on what to do next.”

To meet more women like Regina, who the book is for and about, see our Inspiring Women section on The Way Women Work.

(Photo credit for Regina's photos: CNN http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/26/tech/gallery/tech...)

MY INVESTMENT + YOUR INVESTMENT

I’ve been self-funding all of this work with money I set aside from my executive coaching business over the past 15 years. It’s an investment I feel privileged to have been able to make. 

During the past two and a half years, I’ve also employed Erin Risner as Director of Community Engagement, hired designers and other key people to support my efforts. We've launched three websites, written hundreds of career advice articles and branded The Way Women Work.

I have traveled around the world to meet and interview hundreds of women so I could uncover the keys to professional success for women in emerging economies. 

And I have spent the past eighteen months writing and editing this book, working first with a writing coach and then with an editor to ensure that the book would be clear and most helpful to the women who need it the most. 

Its been a journey full of passion, tears, frustration, hope, self-doubt, challenges, love, countless hours of incredibly hard work, and JOY - and I have already seen the positive impact this project has made on women, businesses and communities. 

For me, this journey has never been about selling books. It has ALWAYS been about enabling women to succeed. 

Now, is THE BEST moment in history for millions of women graduating from universities in emerging economies to find or create jobs in their countries. 

Through this crowdfunding campaign, I invite you to help one, a few, or many graduating female university students in emerging economies succeed at work. My goal of $30,000 will get 1,200 books in the hands of deserving young women, and get me started on my overall goal of helping 100,000 women with this book. 

I cannot reach them without your help!

WHAT YOUR GENEROSITY WILL DO

Your generosity will help unleash the potential of thousands of women in emerging economies to find jobs, start businesses and create more jobs! They can go on to make even more of a difference in the lives of their families, their communities and our global economy!

We will work with top universities in emerging economies to identify the most deserving eligible young women to receive your donated books.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

  • Know someone else who is passionate about seeing women succeed? Share this campaign with them now via email or social media!
  • A corporate or personal sponsorship to give books to female employees.
  • Host a book launch event in a emerging economy city.
  • Connect us to your university so we can get more book in the hands of graduating women in emerging economies.
  • Start a book club for Undeterred.

THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!

Thank you for letting me share my dream with you. 

It's been an honor and a challenge to write Undeterred. This is the absolute best time to share a book like this to encourage young women around the world. 

I truly believe that together we can change lives and propel economic prosperity.
story_txt:
I have an audacious goal to help 100,000 women in developing and emerging economies pursue the careers and lives they dream of. If you are also passionate about seeing women succeed and reach their economic potential, I hope you'll help and donate a book today! 
FULFILLING MY LIFELONG DREAM: WRITING THIS BOOK
The past 20 years of my life have been dedicated to helping women advance in their careers and businesses.

Four years ago, I founded TheWayWomenWork.com, a career advice platform for women in emerging economies. Thousands of women visit the site every month to seek the career guidance they need. Over these past four years, I have also conducted global research and written the first career advice book for women in emerging markets. The book, set for an early 2015 release, is titled Undeterred: The Six Success Habits of Women in Emerging Economies.Most of you have been with me on this long journey to realize my lifelong professional dream: thank you for all of your encouragement, guidance and support!
TWO WAYS YOU CAN HELP ME LAUNCH THE BOOK
If unleashing the success of women around the world moves you, here are two things you can do TODAY:


Back this campaign now! Donate to help a young women launch their careers or businesses. Below is an example of the type of woman you will be helping. 


Help spread the word! Share this project with one person you know who is also passionate about seeing women succeed. 

We have 17 days to make this campaign a success! I am confident that together we can get this important book into the hands of aspiring young women around the world who need inspiration and actionable advice to succeed in their careers and businesses.
