story:
Who we are / Quem somos nós


Iris Ministries Machava was the first base to be founded by Iris Global Ministries. Our orphanage, has been caring for orphan children in Mozambique for about 20 years! Run by two Brazilian families, the Bragas and the Marcolinos. Today cares for around 65 children from all over Africa.

The school is used primarily to provide education for our orphan children as well as many students from the outside community. There are 370 children currently studying at the Iris Machava School.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

O Centro Arco-íris Machava foi a primeira base a ser fundada pelo Ministério Arco-íris Global. Ela existe a quase 20 anos e é dirigida por duas famílias brasileiras, os Bragas e o Marcolinos. 

  1. Hoje, 65 crianças de todo Moçambique vivem em seu orfanato. A escola foi primeiramente formada para eles, mas também atende a crianças de toda a comunidade local. Ao todo 370 crianças são matriculadas na escola Arco-íris Machava.


What we need / O que precisamos

Our biggest need at the moment is to rebuild our school!

In March 2014, strong rains fell over Mozambique and it left the Center and the community of Machava under water.

The Iris Ministries Machava School was founded in 1995. When it started, the chilldren studied under cashew trees. Only in 1996 the school was built from a local small bamboo-like material called "caniço", and it stood for 15 years, in difficult situations such as strong rains, floods, and even two tornados. 

However, after the 2014 floods we decided it's time to rebuild our school with a stronger and safer material.

We are counting with you to rebuild it! =D

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Nossa maior necessidade agora é reconstruir nossa escola.

Em março de 2014, as fortes chuvas que caíram sobre Moçambique combinadas com obras feitas pelo município, deixaram o Centro e a comunidade inteira da machava em baixo d'água. 

A Escola Arco-íris Machava foi fundada em 1995, a princípio as crianças estudavam em baixo dos cajueiros. Somente em 1996 a escola foi construída por caniço e por 15 anos esteve em pé.

Sobreviveu a difíceis situações, fortes chuvas, alagamentos e até dois tornados, mas após as cheias de 2014 decidimos que é hora de reconstruir nossa escola com um material melhor, em um local mais seguro, indicado por profissionais.

Contamos com vocês para isso! =D


    What we dream / O que sonhamos

    Everybody can dream, right? So here is our dream: to build 5 new classrooms. Each classroom would cost U$12,000! This is a large amount, but we are dreaming big and trusting God will provide for  U$60,000!

    If we are able to raise the first U$12,000 dollars and build the first classroom, we will be very very VERY happy! =D

    ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    Todos podem sonhar, certo? Nós sonhamos em construir 5 novas salas de aula. Cada sala de aula nos custará 12 mil dólares, então 5 novas classes equivale a 60 mil dólares, o que é muuuito dinheiro, mas estamos sonhando alto e crendo que o Senhor pode prover!

    Se conseguirmos alcançar os 12 mil dólares e construir uma primeira sala, já é uma grande conquista e ficaremos muito muito MUITO felizes! =D


      Other ways you can help / Outras formas de ajudar

      If you want to help us but are unable to do so financially, there are many other ways!

      • You can help us by sharing this link with your friends on facebook and twitter to help spread awareness of our campaign.
      • You can also help donating construction material or offering hands-on support. If you are interested, please contact us through e-mail:  jessemoz@hotmail.com or send us message on our facebook page. 
      • And most importantly, you can remember us in your prayers. We know that nothing is impossible with God!

      ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

      Se você quer nos ajudar, mas não pode ajudar agora financeiramente,  não fique constrangido, existem outras formas de nos ajudar!

      • Você também pode nos ajudar compartilhando este link com seus amigos no facebook e no twitter e nos ajudar a divulgar nossa campanha.
      • Pode nos ajudar também doando materiais de construção ou ajudando com a mão-de-obra. Se você tem interesse nisso, entre em contato conosco pelo e-mail jessemoz@hotmail.com ou nos mande um inbox pra nós no facebook. 
      • E o mais importante: você pode nos ajudar intercedendo e orando por nós. Nós sabemos que nada é impossível com Deus! 


      KHANIMAMBO

      Before you start giving, we want you to know, no matter how much was your donation. Gratitude  is one of Iris Machava Center's value and we will integrate your name into a mural that will be painted on the outer wall of the school. Once the mural is finished you all will receive photos of it and your name specifically as a part of the composition, so that we will never forget what you are doing for us. We can't thank you enough for helping our dreams come true. So we will do in every language we know...

      ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

      Antes de você começar a doar, queremos que saibam que não importa o quanto você doar, gratidão é uma de nossos valores e nós integraremos teu nome em um mural que será pintado em nossa escola somente para agradecer a vocês e para que jamais nos esqueçamos que isso só foi possível por tua causa. Assim que o mural estiver pronto você receberá fotos dele com o seu nome especificamente listado em meio a composição. Nós nem conseguimos agradecer o suficiente por sua contribuição e por tornar nosso sonho realidade, mas vamos fazer isso em todas as línguas que conhecemos...


      THANK YOU VERY MUCH !!!

      MUITO OBRIGADO !!!

      KHANIMAMBO !!!


      *Versão do vídeo em Português


      *Music License | Licensa de uso da música

      Video Song: Love . By Chris Tomlin (with Watoto Children's Choir). From the Album Hello Love. © September 2, 2008 - Used with permission.

story:
My Story

Hi there. I'm Johanna.  I was born in Gloucestershire, England,  located in the beautiful rolling hills of the Cotswolds.  I moved to the States when I was 11 years-old, and lived several years in Richmond, Virginia before heading off to college at the University of Virginia, where I majored in Sociology.  After that, I headed West to San Diego, California and got my masters and doctorate degrees in Clinical Psychology at the California School of Professional Psychology at Alliant International University. After receiving my doctorate degree, I completed a postdoctoral fellowship at the University of California San Francisco (UCSF), and then headed Southeast to Atlanta, Georgia, where I plan to settle long-term.  
I've been living in Atlanta, Georgia for  a little over 6 months now, and have tried in ernest to find employment here -- both in my field of psychology, and outside my field in the hospitality industry, restaurant industry, and retail industry --  but to no avail.   I found that I am in a bit of a "Catch 22" situation,  whereby I am found to be "overqualified" for many jobs, but I am not yet licensed in my field of psychology, so I don't qualify for the majority of psychologist positions advertised.  I've had several recruiters and employers say that they would hire me as a psychologist, with an income that was commensurate with my education and experience, but I need to be licensed first.  And the problem is, of course, that I haven't had the money for licensure because I haven't been able to secure a job.  


Here's What I Need

Getting licensed as a clinical psychologist is no cheap thing, especially when you're fresh out of training and not earning any money.  At minimum, I estimate that I need $1765.00 to complete the licensure process.  My next steps are to get registered with the Georgia Board of Psychology, take the  Examination for Professional Practice of Psychology (EPPP),  and the Georgia Jurisprudence Exam.   I will also need updated study materials because the materials I currently own are from 2011 and outdated as there have been significant changes to our diagnostic manual, now the DSM 5.  I plan to take the EPPP in November, 2014, and be fully licensed within a couple of months after that.    The fees are as follows:   
  • Georgia Board of Psychology Application Fee $100.00
  • ASPPB PLUS Program Application Fee  $200.00
  • EPPP Application Fee $600.00
  • EPPP Test Site Fee $80.00
  • EPPP Study Materials, Academic Review $700.00
  • Georgia Jurisprudence Examination Fee $85.00
Anything you can contribute will be greatly appreciated. 

The Impact

I've been working in the field of clinical psychology for about 20 years now, and I have worked with diverse populations.  My biggest passion is doing social justice work  by removing  barriers to quality mental health treatment to disadvantaged populations.  While at UCSF, I was instrumental in securing a  living wage for clinical psychology postdoc fellows, thereby removing a socioeconomic barrier to quality training for  low-income individuals. I have been living below the poverty line for a few years now, and I am very committed to helping people escape the poverty trap.  It is such a trap. 


Other Ways You Can Help

It's a tough economy, I know, so I understand if you are not in a position to contribute financially.  Another way you can help is by sharing this link with your own circle of friends -- through Facebook, email, LinkedIn, or whatever social media tool you use.  Any help would be much appreciated. 
Thanks for reading my story.  
Dr. Johanna Workman, Psy.D.
story_txt:
My Story
Hi there. I'm Johanna.  I was born in Gloucestershire, England,  located in the beautiful rolling hills of the Cotswolds.  I moved to the States when I was 11 years-old, and lived several years in Richmond, Virginia before heading off to college at the University of Virginia, where I majored in Sociology.  After that, I headed West to San Diego, California and got my masters and doctorate degrees in Clinical Psychology at the California School of Professional Psychology at Alliant International University. After receiving my doctorate degree, I completed a postdoctoral fellowship at the University of California San Francisco (UCSF), and then headed Southeast to Atlanta, Georgia, where I plan to settle long-term.  
I've been living in Atlanta, Georgia for  a little over 6 months now, and have tried in ernest to find employment here -- both in my field of psychology, and outside my field in the hospitality industry, restaurant industry, and retail industry --  but to no avail.   I found that I am in a bit of a "Catch 22" situation,  whereby I am found to be "overqualified" for many jobs, but I am not yet licensed in my field of psychology, so I don't qualify for the majority of psychologist positions advertised.  I've had several recruiters and employers say that they would hire me as a psychologist, with an income that was commensurate with my education and experience, but I need to be licensed first.  And the problem is, of course, that I haven't had the money for licensure because I haven't been able to secure a job.  


Here's What I Need

Getting licensed as a clinical psychologist is no cheap thing, especially when you're fresh out of training and not earning any money.  At minimum, I estimate that I need $1765.00 to complete the licensure process.  My next steps are to get registered with the Georgia Board of Psychology, take the  Examination for Professional Practice of Psychology (EPPP),  and the Georgia Jurisprudence Exam.   I will also need updated study materials because the materials I currently own are from 2011 and outdated as there have been significant changes to our diagnostic manual, now the DSM 5.  I plan to take the EPPP in November, 2014, and be fully licensed within a couple of months after that.    The fees are as follows:   


Georgia Board of Psychology Application Fee $100.00
ASPPB PLUS Program Application Fee  $200.00
EPPP Application Fee $600.00
EPPP Test Site Fee $80.00
EPPP Study Materials, Academic Review $700.00

Georgia Jurisprudence Examination Fee $85.00

Anything you can contribute will be greatly appreciated. 


The Impact
I've been working in the field of clinical psychology for about 20 years now, and I have worked with diverse populations.  My biggest passion is doing social justice work  by removing  barriers to quality mental health treatment to disadvantaged populations.  While at UCSF, I was instrumental in securing a  living wage for clinical psychology postdoc fellows, thereby removing a socioeconomic barrier to quality training for  low-income individuals. I have been living below the poverty line for a few years now, and I am very committed to helping people escape the poverty trap.  It is such a trap. 

Other Ways You Can Help
It's a tough economy, I know, so I understand if you are not in a position to contribute financially.  Another way you can help is by sharing this link with your own circle of friends -- through Facebook, email, LinkedIn, or whatever social media tool you use.  Any help would be much appreciated. Thanks for reading my story.  Dr. Johanna Workman, Psy.D.

story:
Found in Translation helps bilingual women overcome homelessness and poverty by capitalizing on their language skills and becoming professional medical interpreters. 

I'm Maria. As a social worker in Boston working with low-income and homeless women, I saw how poverty disproportionately affects ethnic, racial, and linguistic minorities. Women face further barriers to achieving economic self-sufficiency, particularly if they have children. However, there is a highly sought-after skill that is abundant in low-income communities: Language.

Careers for bilingual people, such as medical interpreting, are growing at a much faster rate than other professions.

  • 42.2% employment opportunity growth by 2020 
  • The median salary for a medical interpreter is $43,380 (Source: Bureau of Labor Statistics)

 The answer seems simple, right? However, getting the education to become a medical interpreter is nearly impossible for qualified women who can't afford tuition, lack transportation or childcare, and have no connections in the field. 

That's why I founded Found in Translation. We provide free Medical Interpreter Training to low-income and homeless bilingual women, along with wrap-around services, mentoring, and job skills coaching, to make them more likely to succeed even if they are single mothers, or living in a shelter, or lack the community supports that most successful professionals have. Over half of our students live below the federal poverty line ($15,510 for a single mother with one child). The chance for a career as a medical interpreter is life transforming for them and their children.

Even knowing this need, I was overwhelmed by the response we got when we launched. For our first 12-week Medical Interpreter Course we received 165 applicants for 20 positions. For our second course we received 195 applicants for 30 positions. Over 50 dedicated volunteers—interpreters, nurses, community advocates—help us coach and mentor our women in job skills. We've even been asked by people in 4 other cities to help them start similar programs!

And we've done all this without any office space whatsoever! Our staff meetings take place at Panera or Starbucks. Our supplies are kept in my living room. Our classes are in borrowed rooms.

But we could do so much more with our own space!

 Here's what we offer now:

  • We provide one 12-week Medical Interpreting Certificate Course to about 30 women per year, as well as job and internship placement support to our alumnae.

Here's what we could offer with our own classroom and office space:

  • Multiple Certificate Courses, on different topics, serving up to 120 women per year.
  • Workshops for medical employees, serving up to 300 people per year.
  • An Interpreter Resource Center for students and alumnae to receive ongoing instruction, guidance, and collegial support. In 3 years, that will serve over 230 alumnae
  • On-site job placement service, creating a direct pipeline for our grads into Boston's medical agencies. In 3 years, this employment will have lifted 230 families out of poverty, including about 400 children.

We already have support to launch the above services. All we're missing is the space to do it in!

You might be thinking, “But renting an office is expensive. Wouldn't your program save money in the longrun by cutting out that overhead cost?” Here's the super cool part: having our own space will make our program more financially self-sustaining. That's because some of the programs we can launch with our new space—job placement, workshops, video-interpreting services—will generate revenue that we'll reinvest into our core programs. Also, think about all the money we'll save on lattes!

Here's what you can do to help:

  • First, donate to our campaign. $9,000 is the minimum amount we need to start searching for an office this summer (roughly 3 months of rent). However, the more we raise, the more months we can fund. With $36,000 we can fund an entire year of office and class space. 

  • Second, join our community. “Like” us on facebook. Follow us on Twitter. Sign up for our e-newsletter.

  • Third, share our campaign with your friends and social networks. Use the links on this site to spread the word about our campaign to all your networks. We want everyone to know about us!

Found in Translation builds connections across communities and cultures, creating jobs and saving lives. We are delighted to build this connection with you and your community!

Thank you, Sharon Crumrine, for sharing your beautiful song, "Variation on Snow Ghosts," performed by Ginger Ibex, with our campaign! To hear more of Ginger Ibex's music, visit www.gingeribex.com. 

Also, Thank you Hannah Rose, our fantastic Youth Board Member for sacrificing her sanity and her grades to edit this wonderful video on schedule for us!

See those cute buttons below? Click on them to learn more about Found in Translation.

story:
Short Summary

Dale Fotsch met a guy, they lived together, they split up. He sued her for part of her property and she fought him in court, like you are supposed to do. It took nine years, but she finally got an outcome.

During the process, she signed a $100000 re-mortgage on the property she was fighting for, which her lawyer agreed to take as security, because the bill was getting too high.

Well, she won, and the courts ordered her ex to pay her court costs, but he went bankrupt, so she was on the hook for the $90000, give or take.

By the time this happened, the 18% interest had taken it's toll, and the bill has ballooned to $180000, and her lawyer is going to forclose on her to get payment for his years of work.

This isn't a question of who is right or wrong, but to try and help someone who truly needs it. The CBC link at the bottom will fill you in more on the details of the story, if you have any doubts.

As for me, my name is Chris Bird, and I'm a former trucker, and wannabe blogger. I hadn't even heard of this, or Ms. Fotsch until the day I started this campaign.

The thing is, I hate to see good people get the shaft, and while this lawyer is going to get his fee no matter what, I would really hate for this woman to lose her home in order for that to happen.

I think that if we could get 40000 people to kick in $5 a piece, we could drastically improve this woman's life, and it really isn't going to change ours at all. I'm sure that if you watch the video and read the article that you'll find below, you will see what kind of emotional torment this woman is going through. She's not shirking her responsibility. She's not crying foul. She is just looking for some sort of deal where she can keep her home that she's worked hard for all of her life.

I was raised by a single mother, and when I think about what it would have been like if this happened to her, it brings tears to my eyes. We have everything we need, and there are people who are losing everything they have. We (my family) have suspended gift giving for our extended families in order to give to people who have less, at the time of year when charity means the most, and we hope that you could find it in your heart to help too. 

What We Need & What You Get

I'd like to raise enough for her to be able to keep her home, but if we can't do that, then at least give her a leg up in whatever her next step is. What you get is a knowledge that you truly helped someone, with no expectation of getting something in return. You did it just because you could, and you would hope someone would help if it was you.

The Impact

I can't say for sure, but I'm sure the impact is huge. If you could save a person's mental health, family life, or reason to get up in the morning. Wouldn't that be about the biggest thing in the world?

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you can't help out financially, but maybe you could tell your real friends about it, share it with your pretend friends on Facebook, Google+, or Twitter, or tack up a homemade sign at your grocery store. Anything you can do to get the word out will mean a lot to this woman. If you tell 100 people about it, and 1 person gives $5, then you've done a great thing. If ten of them share it with 100 people and they get the same result, that's getting exponentially huge fast. Every little bit helps, and that's the plain truth.

story:
Join the Party of Light!

Dharma Center serves the public by offering classes in meditation and mindful self-discovery. We’ve worked in the public eye, visible and accessible to anyone and everyone who has an interest in meditation. So far, it’s been a wonderful and exciting ride!

We’re asking for your help so we can reach even more people and continue to share meditation with anyone who wants to learn.

Dharma Center began in 1998 with just two Buddhist monks of the Rama lineage who had a passion to teach meditation. Since then, we’ve had dozens of different teachers and thousands of students pass through our door. As a volunteer organization, we’ve survived on a shoe-string budget, always reinvesting every dime we’ve every collected. Now we want to do something BIG!

Dharma Center is planning the largest event and fundraiser we’ve ever attempted, and we want you to be a part of it. Dharma Center’s 16th anniversary will be on the fall equinox this year. However, we wish to celebrate not only Dharma Center and all the people who have made our little meditation hall possible, but also our roots in the Rama Tribe. Therefore, we’ve planned the event to coincide with the 2015 Rama birthday celebration.

The Sweet 16 Unity Celebration will take place the weekend of February 7, 2015. The main event will be an exquisite evening of practitioners with roots in the Rama lineage sharing the Path. We’ll also have an open house during the day so everyone can experience meditation at Dharma Center, as well as a couple of optional events on Sunday.

To help us plan, we’re asking everyone to answer our short, confidential survey. Please be sure to include your contact information on each question where asked if you want to hear from us. Here’s the link to the survey: http://www.surveyact.com/s/5eseak73B1EfPmPK

In addition to collecting donations for our marketing efforts, we’re selling tickets to the big celebration. We’ve booked an event room at the Sheraton Bay Tower on Harbor Island in San Diego, and look forward to celebrating with you! 

We hope you’ll also become a Dharma Center member so we can invite you to our many member-only events. Your membership will become effective immediately upon donation. If you're already a member, your membership will be extended. 

At Dharma Center, we delight in the diversity and variety of the Rama lineage. We see this diversity as a great strength, as we can help guide many different types of people, and as a great opportunity for tribe members to learn from one another and move forward on the spiritual path. Dharma Center operates as a
collaborative teaching model, where each teacher is respected as a unique spiritual warrior who shares the knowledge she has earned along her own path.

It is in this spirit of collaboration that we invite you and your students and friends to be a part of the Sweet 16 Unity Fundraiser Celebration.

It is with sincere gratitude all of us at Dharma Center thank you for your support!

We currently have 6 volunteer teachers offering meditation classes at Dharma Center. (Five of us are pictured here.) We also have a wonderful group of student volunteers who keep the Center clean and running.  

With your help, we can double the number of students we serve and still keep class tuition affordable for everyone.

 

Gifts For You!

We’ve gone through our closet, and with generous cooperation from Buddha For You, we’ve found some wonderful and unique gifts for our fundraiser. Please donate early and as often as you are able.

Please check out the list of wonderful and unique gifts for donors at all levels!

For Business Owners, we've created two special Perks to advertise your business, and make your donation an advertising tax deduction. At the $25 level, we'll list your business name as a Sponsor, and at the $75 level we'll include an image of your 2x3 business card in a special edition of "Thunderbird Journal" magazine to be distributed at the event to all participants. Half-page and full page ad sizes are available for purchase through our website: http://dharmacenter.com/fundraiser/ad-in-thunderbird-journal/.

We have Bliss emails and beautiful postcards, Rama talks on CD and books. And for donations $108 and above, you’re invited to the Party! We’re also offering Dharma Center Memberships, an exclusive VIP meditation the evening before the event, an antique statue of Vishnu, statues of Saraswati, Lakshmi, and Guatama Buddha, a beautiful OM wall hanging, a Tibetan Singing bowl, and even a weekend retreat at Lake Arrowhead!

For detailed descriptions and pictures of these treasures, please scroll to the bottom of this posting.

It is with sincere gratitude all of us at Dharma Center thank you for your support!

Please note: Dharma Center is not a charity, so please do not claim your donation on your taxes as a charitable gift. Dharma Center is a small, volunteer-based business that operates on a revenue-neutral basis. This means no one (teachers, administrators, etc.) gets paid for their services, and all money collected is re-invested back into Dharma Center. Dharma Center is truly a labor of love for all involved.

 

Learn More

To learn more about Dharma Center, drop by for a class, call us at 619-797-5483, or visit: www.DharmaCenter.com

To hear Rama’s teachings and find online classes, visit: www.RamaMeditationSociety.org

The Network Tribe has created a series of amazing meditation videos. Watch here:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dqp6gQADEDU  (full hour at the Grand Canyon)
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r0D8see68P8  (6 minutes at Pound Ridge)


Other Ways You Can Help

Every donation of money and time is greatly appreciated. Whether or not you can donate money or purchase a ticket, here's a few things you can do right now to help:

  • Please share our plans with everyone and anyone you know who is interested in meditation. Perhaps there's a long lost friend you know of, or a new friend, or a family member curious about meditation you can connect us with. 
  • Write! We’ll need your words of wisdom for a special edition of Thunderbird Journal magazine, which will be distributed at the Sweet 16 Unity Celebration. Please send submissions (1000 words or less of your original writing and/or artwork) to Jenna@DharmaCenter.com with "Sweet 16 TbJ" in the subject line.
  • Volunteer! A fundraiser and event this big needs lots of help, as does our little meditation hall. Please contact Hathor, our Volunteer Coordinator at Volunteer@DharmaCenter.com to find out more.
  • Add a comment to this fundraiser page. Let other know how you feel about Dharma Center, Rama's teachings, and meditation.
  • Please use the SHARE buttons to get the word out! Post a link on your Twitter feed or on your Facebook timeline, or on LinkedIn, etc., or on your blog.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!



Gift Details


Tantric Buddhism with Rama DVD

Watch Rama as he explains the intricacies of Tantric Buddhism in this fun, silly, yet profound video. Count the outrageous outfit changes and be electrified by his humor and grace!

On the Road with Rama CD Set

With this lovely box set, you can listen to Rama speaking from 7 different power places in the Unites States, ranging from Hawaii to Nantucket, MA. Connect with the energy of these places and explore intense topics with Rama such as Unity, Magic, Kundalini Yoga, and more!

 

"Om Mani Padme Hum" sticker (Tibetan script)

Share the blessings with this fun Om Mani Padme Hum sticker written in Tibetan script, approximately 9" long.

 

"Insights: Tantric Buddhist Reflections on Life" by Rama - Dr. Frederick Lenz

Enjoy this book of "non-poems" as Rama called them that covers the intricacies of Tantric Buddhism with wit, humor, and an abundance of Light. Wonderful to read over and over again, as new levels open with each reading. With its short sections, this is a perfect commuter book to read on the train, or at your lunchtime break, or whenever you need a lift into Light.

 

OM wall hanging - metal, made in India

This metal, 8" tall Sanskrit OM in gold would make a wonderful addition to any décor!

 

Meditation Starter Kit
Everything you need for a great meditation!
You'll get a brand new Zafu meditation cushion from Carolina Morning Designs to give you the just right seat, a copy of "How to Meditate" lectures by Rama provides instructions, "A Way of Light" by Kelly McTavish to keep you inspired, a "Samadhi" cd for the perfect meditation music, and a bag of Dark Chocolate to ground you when it's time to get up from your cushion.

 

 

Saraswati statue, resin from Nepal
Saraswati is the goddess of Learning and Wisdom. As a goddess of music and poetry, she is revered by Brahmans and Buddhists. Saraswati represents the free flow of wisdom and consciousness. This statue is approximately 6" tall and She is represented seated holding the Bina.

 

Lakshmi statue, painted resin from India, 7" tall
Lakshmi is the Hindu goddess of wealth, prosperity (both material and spiritual), light wisdom, fortune, fertility, generosity and courage, and the embodiment of beauty, grace and charm. Lakshmi brings good luck to her devotees. She is believed to protect her devotees from all kinds of misery and money related sorrows.

 

Tibetan Singing Bowl from Nepal
Tibetan singing bowl from Nepal. 5" diameter, beautifully decorated with a heavenly tone when played. Includes wooden mallet and silk cushion. A double vajra appears inside the bowl.

 

Gautama Buddha statue

This beautiful statue of Guatama Buddha stands 12” tall. It is heavy (about 11 pounds), but the folks at Buddha's Light Bookstore were not sure of what material it's made. He sits in sublime meditation. The statue is decorated with exquisite detail all the way around. Both the front and back are shown below.

 

 

 

 

Vishnu statue, bronze antique from Thailand

This antique bronze statue stands 9” tall and is estimated to be 75 to 100 years old by the folks at Buddha For You. It originates from a monastery in Thailand where it was sold to support the monastery. We are asking Vishnu once again to support the Dharma by being this one of kind gift.

Rama stated several times he was an incarnation of Vishnu. Here is a quote from one of his recorded talks:

“The only way light can enter you is when you love, and that is a fact. If I have anything to teach you as an incarnation of Vishnu, it is that love is the way.

All incarnations of Vishnu are incarnations of love, of that strand of light we call Vishnu. In other words, I am an embodiment of the quality of love. Enlightenment takes many forms. Yet in an individual being it manifests through a series of qualities. So different teachers are different incarnations of different things, and the qualities we give names to.

Vishnu is the quality of love. In the Hindu trinity there’s Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva.  Brahma is the creative force, a very intensive transmuting force that brings the unmanifest into the manifest. Shiva goes in the other direction, Shiva transforms, destroys, changes. But Vishnu is the aspect of love.

Love is preserving and persevering. In other words, the aspect that they call Vishnu is that which wants to hold life and keep it alive because of love. Love is in all the aspects, Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva.  These are names for a cycle, a circle. But Vishnu is the aspect of love, so when I say to you… Your particular teacher named Rama, the quality of his soul is love. …The one thing anyone can learn from me is how to love. Love is self-giving with discrimination and detachment, yet with rhapsody and absorption.

The reason I took the name Rama is because Rama is an incarnation of Vishnu, and the very strand of energy that I have been in this and other lives is Vishnu, is love. … What I am is love. That’s the aspect of God that we see through this being that we call Rama.”

~Rama

from "Modular Mysticism: Love: The Fourth Level Of Ecstasy" in TALKS ON THE NATURE OF EXISTENCE by RAMA

Lake Arrowhead Lodge Private Retreat Weekend (3-days/2-nights)

Head up to the mountains and the pristine water of Lake Arrowhead alone or with 20 of your friends.

The “Alpen Lodge” as we’ve come to know it is privately owned and has been the site of many Dharma Center retreats. The Lodge is, in a word, HUGE!

 

There are 4 floors overlooking the majestic lake, with 7 bedrooms and 4 ½ bathrooms, plus a loft. There are 9 beds: 2 Kings, 1 Queen, 2 standard, 3 twins and an air bed in loft. There’s also plenty of room for more if they bring their own sleeping bags. Sleeping on the deck under the stars is a favorite spot for some. The long dining room table is enormous and fit for a castle! An excellent place for a fabulous group dinner that can be prepared in the fully equipped kitchen.

The Lodge weekend has been generously donated for this fundraiser.

We hope you enjoy these wonderful and unique gifts. We sincerely appreciate whatever level of support you can provide. And we look forward to seeing you at the Sweet 16 Unity Celebration!!!
story_txt:
Join the Party of Light!Dharma Center serves the public by offering classes in meditation and mindful self-discovery. We’ve worked in the public eye, visible and accessible to anyone and everyone who has an interest in meditation. So far, it’s been a wonderful and exciting ride! We’re asking for your help so we can reach even more people and continue to share meditation with anyone who wants to learn.Dharma Center began in 1998 with just two Buddhist monks of the Rama lineage who had a passion to teach meditation. Since then, we’ve had dozens of different teachers and thousands of students pass through our door. As a volunteer organization, we’ve survived on a shoe-string budget, always reinvesting every dime we’ve every collected. Now we want to do something BIG!Dharma Center is planning the largest event and fundraiser we’ve ever attempted, and we want you to be a part of it. Dharma Center’s 16th anniversary will be on the fall equinox this year. However, we wish to celebrate not only Dharma Center and all the people who have made our little meditation hall possible, but also our roots in the Rama Tribe. Therefore, we’ve planned the event to coincide with the 2015 Rama birthday celebration. The Sweet 16 Unity Celebration will take place the weekend of February 7, 2015. The main event will be an exquisite evening of practitioners with roots in the Rama lineage sharing the Path. We’ll also have an open house during the day so everyone can experience meditation at Dharma Center, as well as a couple of optional events on Sunday.To help us plan, we’re asking everyone to answer our short, confidential survey. Please be sure to include your contact information on each question where asked if you want to hear from us. Here’s the link to the survey: http://www.surveyact.com/s/5eseak73B1EfPmPKIn addition to collecting donations for our marketing efforts, we’re selling tickets to the big celebration. We’ve booked an event room at the Sheraton Bay Tower on Harbor Island in San Diego, and look forward to celebrating with you! We hope you’ll also become a Dharma Center member so we can invite you to our many member-only events. Your membership will become effective immediately upon donation. If you're already a member, your membership will be extended. At Dharma Center, we delight in the diversity and variety of the Rama lineage. We see this diversity as a great strength, as we can help guide many different types of people, and as a great opportunity for tribe members to learn from one another and move forward on the spiritual path. Dharma Center operates as acollaborative teaching model, where each teacher is respected as a unique spiritual warrior who shares the knowledge she has earned along her own path.It is in this spirit of collaboration that we invite you and your students and friends to be a part of the Sweet 16 Unity Fundraiser Celebration. It is with sincere gratitude all of us at Dharma Center thank you for your support!We currently have 6 volunteer teachers offering meditation classes at Dharma Center. (Five of us are pictured here.) We also have a wonderful group of student volunteers who keep the Center clean and running.  With your help, we can double the number of students we serve and still keep class tuition affordable for everyone. Gifts For You!We’ve gone through our closet, and with generous cooperation from Buddha For You, we’ve found some wonderful and unique gifts for our fundraiser. Please donate early and as often as you are able.Please check out the list of wonderful and unique gifts for donors at all levels!For Business Owners, we've created two special Perks to advertise your business, and make your donation an advertising tax deduction. At the $25 level, we'll list your business name as a Sponsor, and at the $75 level we'll include an image of your 2x3 business card in a special edition of "Thunderbird Journal" magazine to be distributed at the event to all participants. Half-page and full page ad sizes are available for purchase through our website: http://dharmacenter.com/fundraiser/ad-in-thunderbird-journal/.We have Bliss emails and beautiful postcards, Rama talks on CD and books. And for donations $108 and above, you’re invited to the Party! We’re also offering Dharma Center Memberships, an exclusive VIP meditation the evening before the event, an antique statue of Vishnu, statues of Saraswati, Lakshmi, and Guatama Buddha, a beautiful OM wall hanging, a Tibetan Singing bowl, and even a weekend retreat at Lake Arrowhead!For detailed descriptions and pictures of these treasures, please scroll to the bottom of this posting.It is with sincere gratitude all of us at Dharma Center thank you for your support!Please note: Dharma Center is not a charity, so please do not claim your donation on your taxes as a charitable gift. Dharma Center is a small, volunteer-based business that operates on a revenue-neutral basis. This means no one (teachers, administrators, etc.) gets paid for their services, and all money collected is re-invested back into Dharma Center. Dharma Center is truly a labor of love for all involved. Learn MoreTo learn more about Dharma Center, drop by for a class, call us at 619-797-5483, or visit: www.DharmaCenter.comTo hear Rama’s teachings and find online classes, visit: www.RamaMeditationSociety.org The Network Tribe has created a series of amazing meditation videos. Watch here:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dqp6gQADEDU  (full hour at the Grand Canyon)http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r0D8see68P8  (6 minutes at Pound Ridge)
Other Ways You Can HelpEvery donation of money and time is greatly appreciated. Whether or not you can donate money or purchase a ticket, here's a few things you can do right now to help:Please share our plans with everyone and anyone you know who is interested in meditation. Perhaps there's a long lost friend you know of, or a new friend, or a family member curious about meditation you can connect us with. Write! We’ll need your words of wisdom for a special edition of Thunderbird Journal magazine, which will be distributed at the Sweet 16 Unity Celebration. Please send submissions (1000 words or less of your original writing and/or artwork) to Jenna@DharmaCenter.com with "Sweet 16 TbJ" in the subject line.Volunteer! A fundraiser and event this big needs lots of help, as does our little meditation hall. Please contact Hathor, our Volunteer Coordinator at Volunteer@DharmaCenter.com to find out more.
Add a comment to this fundraiser page. Let other know how you feel about Dharma Center, Rama's teachings, and meditation. 

Please use the SHARE buttons to get the word out! Post a link on your Twitter feed or on your Facebook timeline, or on LinkedIn, etc., or on your blog. 
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!
Gift DetailsTantric Buddhism with Rama DVDWatch Rama as he explains the intricacies of Tantric Buddhism in this fun, silly, yet profound video. Count the outrageous outfit changes and be electrified by his humor and grace!On the Road with Rama CD SetWith this lovely box set, you can listen to Rama speaking from 7 different power places in the Unites States, ranging from Hawaii to Nantucket, MA. Connect with the energy of these places and explore intense topics with Rama such as Unity, Magic, Kundalini Yoga, and more! "Om Mani Padme Hum" sticker (Tibetan script)Share the blessings with this fun Om Mani Padme Hum sticker written in Tibetan script, approximately 9" long. "Insights: Tantric Buddhist Reflections on Life" by Rama - Dr. Frederick LenzEnjoy this book of "non-poems" as Rama called them that covers the intricacies of Tantric Buddhism with wit, humor, and an abundance of Light. Wonderful to read over and over again, as new levels open with each reading. With its short sections, this is a perfect commuter book to read on the train, or at your lunchtime break, or whenever you need a lift into Light. OM wall hanging - metal, made in IndiaThis metal, 8" tall Sanskrit OM in gold would make a wonderful addition to any décor! Meditation Starter KitEverything you need for a great meditation! You'll get a brand new Zafu meditation cushion from Carolina Morning Designs to give you the just right seat, a copy of "How to Meditate" lectures by Rama provides instructions, "A Way of Light" by Kelly McTavish to keep you inspired, a "Samadhi" cd for the perfect meditation music, and a bag of Dark Chocolate to ground you when it's time to get up from your cushion.  Saraswati statue, resin from Nepal Saraswati is the goddess of Learning and Wisdom. As a goddess of music and poetry, she is revered by Brahmans and Buddhists. Saraswati represents the free flow of wisdom and consciousness. This statue is approximately 6" tall and She is represented seated holding the Bina. Lakshmi statue, painted resin from India, 7" tallLakshmi is the Hindu goddess of wealth, prosperity (both material and spiritual), light wisdom, fortune, fertility, generosity and courage, and the embodiment of beauty, grace and charm. Lakshmi brings good luck to her devotees. She is believed to protect her devotees from all kinds of misery and money related sorrows. Tibetan Singing Bowl from NepalTibetan singing bowl from Nepal. 5" diameter, beautifully decorated with a heavenly tone when played. Includes wooden mallet and silk cushion. A double vajra appears inside the bowl. Gautama Buddha statue This beautiful statue of Guatama Buddha stands 12” tall. It is heavy (about 11 pounds), but the folks at Buddha's Light Bookstore were not sure of what material it's made. He sits in sublime meditation. The statue is decorated with exquisite detail all the way around. Both the front and back are shown below.    Vishnu statue, bronze antique from ThailandThis antique bronze statue stands 9” tall and is estimated to be 75 to 100 years old by the folks at Buddha For You. It originates from a monastery in Thailand where it was sold to support the monastery. We are asking Vishnu once again to support the Dharma by being this one of kind gift.Rama stated several times he was an incarnation of Vishnu. Here is a quote from one of his recorded talks:“The only way light can enter you is when you love, and that is a fact. If I have anything to teach you as an incarnation of Vishnu, it is that love is the way.All incarnations of Vishnu are incarnations of love, of that strand of light we call Vishnu. In other words, I am an embodiment of the quality of love. Enlightenment takes many forms. Yet in an individual being it manifests through a series of qualities. So different teachers are different incarnations of different things, and the qualities we give names to. Vishnu is the quality of love. In the Hindu trinity there’s Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva.  Brahma is the creative force, a very intensive transmuting force that brings the unmanifest into the manifest. Shiva goes in the other direction, Shiva transforms, destroys, changes. But Vishnu is the aspect of love.Love is preserving and persevering. In other words, the aspect that they call Vishnu is that which wants to hold life and keep it alive because of love. Love is in all the aspects, Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva.  These are names for a cycle, a circle. But Vishnu is the aspect of love, so when I say to you… Your particular teacher named Rama, the quality of his soul is love. …The one thing anyone can learn from me is how to love. Love is self-giving with discrimination and detachment, yet with rhapsody and absorption.The reason I took the name Rama is because Rama is an incarnation of Vishnu, and the very strand of energy that I have been in this and other lives is Vishnu, is love. … What I am is love. That’s the aspect of God that we see through this being that we call Rama.”~Ramafrom "Modular Mysticism: Love: The Fourth Level Of Ecstasy" in TALKS ON THE NATURE OF EXISTENCE by RAMALake Arrowhead Lodge Private Retreat Weekend (3-days/2-nights)Head up to the mountains and the pristine water of Lake Arrowhead alone or with 20 of your friends. The “Alpen Lodge” as we’ve come to know it is privately owned and has been the site of many Dharma Center retreats. The Lodge is, in a word, HUGE! There are 4 floors overlooking the majestic lake, with 7 bedrooms and 4 ½ bathrooms, plus a loft. There are 9 beds: 2 Kings, 1 Queen, 2 standard, 3 twins and an air bed in loft. There’s also plenty of room for more if they bring their own sleeping bags. Sleeping on the deck under the stars is a favorite spot for some. The long dining room table is enormous and fit for a castle! An excellent place for a fabulous group dinner that can be prepared in the fully equipped kitchen.The Lodge weekend has been generously donated for this fundraiser.We hope you enjoy these wonderful and unique gifts. We sincerely appreciate whatever level of support you can provide. And we look forward to seeing you at the Sweet 16 Unity Celebration!!!

story:
A Short Summary

Hi,

Brigitta stone-johnson , commonly referred to as ‘brigs’, grew up in rural kwazulu natal in a farming community near Vryheid, South Africa, between 1982 - 2000. educated at The University of the Witwatersrand, faculty of architecture and the built environment 2001-2006. Lives in Brixton Johannesburg from 2010 - present day with her husband Wayne Johnson , she lives with her husband + her dog Shigeru - a hyperactive poodle. where she gardens, draws , designs, photographs and tries to convince everyone she meets to be kinder, more present and engage in the community around them and their fellow man. 

  • The campaign is to help raise funds for my travel too and accommodation for the duration of the summer school - 21 days in Darmstadt, Germany from 7th-27th of July.  The summer school will be focusing on Collective building as an experiment.  We will get the chance to explore and improve design ideas using life-size models. Building will becomes an active process that reacts directly to the location at hand; the unforeseen represents not a nuisance, but rather: potential.  You can find out more about the summer school here. Osthang Project - 2014
  • Having worked largely in isolation from an academic perspective for the last few years I would love the opportunity to work with a larger team of people who are as passionate about community spaces as I am. Looking forward I hope to work to a greater extent both within my local neighborhood and in my broader regional context, Hopefully by means of a business I hope to start, but also by any means available to me, be they large or small. 
  • In helping me achieve this small goal, you will be joining me in the first steps toward the future goal of starting a business which will work specifically with community organisations finding creative solutions to a multitude of design problems.

What is the Osthang Project ?

The Short Version - The Osthang project is a summer school program and Experimental building, workshop - which will be taking place in - Mathildenhöhe - a former artist colony in Darmstadt, Germany. It is a 21 day program from the 7 -27 july this year. It project is hosted by International Music Institute Darmstadt, in conjunction with Raumlaborberlin. Since 2008 the Darmstadt Architecture Summer has used artistic interventions in the public sphere to promote discourse on urban development in Darmstadt, the Rhine-Main metropolitan region and beyond; since 2011 it has done so in conjunction with the cities of Frankfurt, Offenbach and Wiesbaden as the Architecture Summer Rhein-Main (ASRM). The Gernal idea is to expore new idea's around the concept of living together and to deign and build those spaces while exploring experimental ideas, materials etc.
More about raumlabor
More about internationales-musikinstitut
More about The RHEIN-MAIN SUMMER OF ARCHITECTURE

    What I Need & What You Get

    Here is the break down of what is required and what it is for:

    • To total amount of funding required is 3500$. This is broken up into the following amounts. 
    • 410 $ - conference fees.
    • 730 $ - Youth Hostel Accommodation.
    • 1048 $ - Airplane ticket to Frankfurt 
    • 82 $ - Visa
    • 477$ - Food and any other unforeseen expenses.
    • remainder tax, banking fees. 

    In thanks for contributing to my campaign - each contributor will receive a mention - on the blog I will set up for the duration of the project. I am also an accomplished photographer and Cartoonist. I will hand craft and send to you a once off printable cartoon of your choice from my blog ( The Mutterings ) or Photograph print of your choice from. (Stone-photography ) 

    Please note:

    • In the event that I do not go to summer school in Mathildenhöhe in Darmstadt. I will donate the proceeds to the following charity- where I volunteer each week. Hotel Hope Ministries , who could also really use any donation they can get. 

    The Impact you will have

    I know to many people a summer school is just a trip a time to blow off a little steam and have fun. For some of us however it is an opportunity to learn, things I cannot learn at home. The chance to meet people who would never visit my home land. Help me to engage with and learn from a global team of experts. Help me to come back to my job at the end, with more experience, new ideas and a fresh enthusiasm to make a diffidence right here where I live. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you cannot contribute perhaps you can spread the word :

    • If you have the time please forward this campaign on via Facebook, Twitter and email.
    • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hi! 

Our names are Clare, Neil, and Lizzy and we are three spirited seniors at Casco Bay High School in Portland, Maine. Casco Bay is a small, public Expeditionary Learning school. Expeditionary Learning is an acclaimed national model for school reform that emphasizes high achievement through learning that is active, challenging, meaningful, public and collaborative. Not only is a large part of the curriculum focused on hands-on learning, but it is also often student organized. We are currently in the midst of an immense research project that focuses on the physical and mental health benefits of connecting with nature. The three of us are extremely passionate and enthusiastic about the outdoors and would like to share that passion with others.

Our Vision

Our vision for this project is to motivate young people in our community to spend more time outdoors and help them foster an appreciation for the natural environment. We intend to culminate this project with a week-long, overnight trip to Hurricane Island, off the coast of Rockland, Maine. We would like to give Casco Bay High School students, who may not normally have an outdoor opportunity such as this, the chance to immerse themselves in nature as well as challenge themselves to step outside their comfort zone. We would like to give students a taste of what it is like to set up a campsite, sleep under the stars, cook their own food over a fire, completely separate themselves from technology, and immerse themselves completely in the natural world.

What We Need 

 In order to make our vision a reality and make a difference in our community, we have to raise roughly $700 dollars. This money will go towards transportation to and from Hurricane Island for roughly eighteen students and staff; breakfast, lunch, and dinner for the week; and camping and hiking equipment for students to use during the trip which would be used for future outdoor trips by the newly founded Casco Bay Outing Club. 

The Impact

We plan to make a short film documenting the weeks activities, high points and low points, and the impact that it has on participants by the end of the week. Our plan is to share the video on various sites including YouTube and Reddit with the hope of expanding our impact to the youth across the world, teaching them about the effects of "nature deficit disorder" and encouraging everyone to get outside.

We hope we can make enough people love the world as much as we do, as well as inspire people to want to make positive changes to their life.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

  • Help us get the word out about our campaign! 
  • Learn more about the physical and mental health benefits of nature at www.childrenandnature.org.
  • Get involved with a local nature club or campaign! Find one near you! http://www.childrenandnature.org/directory/clubs/ 

 Thanks!

story:
Help Me Get to Portugal

Did you watch the video? Folks, you know I'm better in writing than in person!

After seventeen years of writing and five years of writing with the intent to publish, things are happening. I won a partial scholarship on the MERITS of my writing to the Disquiet International Literary Program. This program brings writers to Lisbon, Portugal to work together in workshops and exposes writers to new experiences through travel. However, I am broke, so broke, and while I'm eager to work with the established writers and publishers who'll be present, I need your help to go.

Where Your Cash Goes 

The scholarship was for $500 for the tuition but I still need more funds. Specifically:

  • $1550 for the remaining tuition.
  • $1538 for a round trip flight from San Diego.
  • $700 for accommodation, food, transportation, and "networking"  (i.e.,drinking with other writers)
  • $152 for the fees that Indiegogo charges (4% of the costs of funds raised)

How I Can Thank You

I wish I had more time and money available to do nice things for you. I know that when I've given money to things like this, it's been for the fun crap that they give you. However, I can give you some original, made-by-me crap like:

  • an individual haiku that I have written at some point in my life 
  • a pdf of the story that got me the scholarship (it's fucking good, kittens)
  • a postcard from Portugal with a haiku on it
  • a recording of one of my stories
  • acknowledgment on my blog
  • an in-the-flesh visit from me (applicable only if you live in North America)

What This Will Do For My Writing Career

Asking for money has been hard. I know there are more deserving causes--hell, one of my Ecuadorian friends would find her life drastically changed if she had fifty extra dollars a month. I've also spent my adult life working to afford my travels and support myself. After five years of missing weddings and other events because of work commitments in Asia, I've delayed getting back to work so that I can attend a wedding and visit people this summer. A trip to Portugal will also cut into my ability to earn money. However, participating in this program this year is important because of the writers that will be there. 

  • Alissa Nutting is a young author whose recent novel, Tampa, has received widespread attention and acclaim. She also published my first work in The Fairy Tale Review: The Grey Issue. I'm hoping that through the program, she'll be interested in mentoring me.
  • Dan Bern is a singer-songwriter who has put out over eighteen albums and written or co-written the songs in Judd Apatow movies like Walk Hard and Get Him to The Greek. I've recently starting writing songs and I'd love to learn more about the craft of it. This was canceled. Boo-urns!
In addition to working with this writer, there will be literary agents, publishers and various magazines (New York Review of Books anyone?) present, and opportunities to expand my network of people involved in publishing. In the past three years of sending my work out for publication, I've gotten really nice rejection letters. I'm hoping that by being more than just a strange name attached to a piece of paper, the content of those letters will change.

The Disquiet International Literary Program seeks to expand the influences of writers through travel. This has been my life for the past thirteen years. And while I feel a bit like Frederick, the free-loading poet-mouse, especially when there are so many causes that I would give money to, writing is important. If you've enjoyed my writing, either in blog posts or stories or poems, then I hope you'll help me take things to a wider audience. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you are probably as broke as I am. In that case, please help me spread the word. 

  • Share this campaign along with a message of how much (metric units please) and why you love me enough to ask people to donate on your behalf.
  • Get on the horn with one or both of your Canadian parents who I have charmed the pants off of and get them to give me some money.
  • Know someone in Lisbon who can house me for a few days? That would be lovely! (my plan is to couch surf first before I stay in cheap accommodation)
story_txt:
Help Me Get to PortugalDid you watch the video? Folks, you know I'm better in writing than in person!After seventeen years of writing and five years of writing with the intent to publish, things are happening. I won a partial scholarship on the MERITS of my writing to the Disquiet International Literary Program. This program brings writers to Lisbon, Portugal to work together in workshops and exposes writers to new experiences through travel. However, I am broke, so broke, and while I'm eager to work with the established writers and publishers who'll be present, I need your help to go.Where Your Cash Goes The scholarship was for $500 for the tuition but I still need more funds. Specifically:
$1550 for the remaining tuition.
$1538 for a round trip flight from San Diego.


$700 for accommodation, food, transportation, and "networking"  (i.e.,drinking with other writers)

$152 for the fees that Indiegogo charges (4% of the costs of funds raised)
How I Can Thank YouI wish I had more time and money available to do nice things for you. I know that when I've given money to things like this, it's been for the fun crap that they give you. However, I can give you some original, made-by-me crap like:
an individual haiku that I have written at some point in my life 
a pdf of the story that got me the scholarship (it's fucking good, kittens)
a postcard from Portugal with a haiku on it
a recording of one of my stories
acknowledgment on my blog
an in-the-flesh visit from me (applicable only if you live in North America)
What This Will Do For My Writing CareerAsking for money has been hard. I know there are more deserving causes--hell, one of my Ecuadorian friends would find her life drastically changed if she had fifty extra dollars a month. I've also spent my adult life working to afford my travels and support myself. After five years of missing weddings and other events because of work commitments in Asia, I've delayed getting back to work so that I can attend a wedding and visit people this summer. A trip to Portugal will also cut into my ability to earn money. However, participating in this program this year is important because of the writers that will be there. 

Alissa Nutting is a young author whose recent novel, Tampa, has received widespread attention and acclaim. She also published my first work in The Fairy Tale Review: The Grey Issue. I'm hoping that through the program, she'll be interested in mentoring me.

Dan Bern is a singer-songwriter who has put out over eighteen albums and written or co-written the songs in Judd Apatow movies like Walk Hard and Get Him to The Greek. I've recently starting writing songs and I'd love to learn more about the craft of it. This was canceled. Boo-urns!
In addition to working with this writer, there will be literary agents, publishers and various magazines (New York Review of Books anyone?) present, and opportunities to expand my network of people involved in publishing. In the past three years of sending my work out for publication, I've gotten really nice rejection letters. I'm hoping that by being more than just a strange name attached to a piece of paper, the content of those letters will change.The Disquiet International Literary Program seeks to expand the influences of writers through travel. This has been my life for the past thirteen years. And while I feel a bit like Frederick, the free-loading poet-mouse, especially when there are so many causes that I would give money to, writing is important. If you've enjoyed my writing, either in blog posts or stories or poems, then I hope you'll help me take things to a wider audience. Other Ways You Can HelpSome of you are probably as broke as I am. In that case, please help me spread the word. 
Share this campaign along with a message of how much (metric units please) and why you love me enough to ask people to donate on your behalf.
Get on the horn with one or both of your Canadian parents who I have charmed the pants off of and get them to give me some money.
Know someone in Lisbon who can house me for a few days? That would be lovely! (my plan is to couch surf first before I stay in cheap accommodation)

story:
Hi there. I'm Frankie.

I'm a senior at Royal High School in Royal City, Washington, a small farming town in Eastern Washington of about 2,000 people. Outside of school, I've attended the Washington Business Week summer camp for the past 3 years, becoming heavily invested in the program.

This year, Washington Business Week has given me the opportunity to travel to Poland to assist with their Polish program. I will be a student adviser for the Polish students, guiding them through their week of learning and running a simulated business as well as learning myself.

Running this wonderful program is expensive, as is international travel. Without many opportunities to make money in my small town, I need to find a way to pay for this opportunity. This is where you can help me.

The Plan

The money is going to go into the following:

  1. The total cost of the program

  2. Airline tickets, there and back

  3. Day-to-day spending overseas

  4. A good camera to document the adventure (can't use my phone overseas)

  5. A tablet for portable international blogging (desktops aren't portable)

I may not be able to maintain the blog or document the adventure as well without a camera or a tablet of sorts, but the real important thing here is the program and the flight. The international experience and helping these students is what this is all about.

Any additional funds past the the goal will go towards sponsoring students willing to broaden their educational horizons at various Washington Business Week summer programs in the future, as well as assist with my collegiate education at University of Washington.

I can't offer much as for perks so everything is rather modest, but with modesty comes heart, sincerity, and thankfulness for your contributions.

For donations of $1-$4, thanks for your contribution. Every dollar helps in the end!

Starting at $5 to $9, you will receive a personally-typed thank you letter including a picture from the trip. I would hand write it, but I figure you would actually want to read the note (my handwriting is borderline-legible.)

From $10 to $49, you receive the thank-you note mailed to you as well as a public post of thanks on the blog about your contribution. You may also add your own personal message to the post as well.

At $50 to $99, I will make a personal video of me singing, reciting, or reading whatever you want me to and post it on YouTube as well as the blog. I've been told I have a good, deep reading voice, as well as being a pretty competent singer. Whether you want me to read Green Eggs and Ham, Sonnet 116, or sing a tune from Taylor Swift, I'll do it as passionately or comedically as you want me to. I might even get all dressed up for the video too. All previous perks included too!

From $100-$499, backers can join an hour-long livestream I will hold on a to-be-determined streaming service to discuss the trip, from experiences to funny happenings and everything in between. The thank-you note and public post are also included.

Finally, for donations $500 and up, backers will be treated to a lunch with me in Seattle to discuss experiences from the trip and whatever else springs upon us. Other arrangements can be made if you are unable to attend the lunch. Planning and details for the lunch will be cemented in the weeks to come. You will also receive the physical and public thanks.

The Impact

International opportunities are rare to come by for kids in my situation, especially at this age. Being given this chance to travel to another country to educate other students with the same passion as I do is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity.

The Business Week program had a profound impact on my life back when I was 15. I really had no idea what I wanted to do when I grew up, especially when "What do you want to do when you grow up?" evolved into "What do you want to do in 4 years?" I attended the program and it changed me. Not only did I learn about the business, but the connections I made with professionals and students alike kept me going back to the camp year after year. There's a certain environment at the camp that's indescribable. It's happy, fun, inviting: a plethora of good feelings. I hope to give this same experience to other students overseas.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are unable to contribute to my cause, it's totally okay! You can still help!

    1. Go to wbw.org and select the contribute tab. Here you can donate to give another student the opportunity to learn more about business during the summer.
    2. Talk to your teen about enriching their education with a summer program such as Washington Business Week or a different program with their interests in mind. Get them to branch out and try something new!
    3. Talk to your friends, family, neighbors, colleagues, anyone to get the word out about my campaign.
    4. Share my campaign on Facebook. Tweet about my campaign; heck, use the hashtag #getme2poland if you want. Post it on Reddit. Blog about it on Tumblr. Do what you can to get my campaign around the Internet.

    Thanks for reading and have a great day!

story:
STEMpowered, Inc is a non-profit organization founded in Detroit, MI. Women are unequally represented in the STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) fields and we know this is not due to unequal abilities. Our goal is to provide opportunities to young girls in Detroit to explore the STEM fields in a creative and interactive environment, because we believe all girls deserve encouragement, support and the empowering belief that their potential has no limit. 

We are excited to be bringing our second annual summer day camp to the 4th and 5th grade girls of Detroit Public Schools! Our campers attend on 100% scholarship and we need your help to make this happen. Your donation helps cover the cost of experiments, meals, transportation and field trips. Last year, we had a blast building Rube Goldberg machines, watching Elephant Toothpaste come alive, dropping eggs from the roof, and witnessing STEM impact the city all around us. We can't wait to see what 2015 has in store!

story:
Even after my campaign ended, you can still support it!

Write me for my bank account: georg_lind [ät] web.de.

Violence, deceit, and power are evitable

Moral competence is the ability to solve problems and conflicts on the basis of one's moral principles through thinking and discussion, instead of through violence, deceit, and power. Unfortunately, this competence is lacking in many people, not the least in many political and economic leaders.

The results of this shortage of moral competence are twofold: on the one side, a growing number of victims of violence, deceit, and power world-wide, who leave their homes to find a better life, and, on the other side political reflexes which make these victims' fate even worse: fences, racism, mobbing, deportation and bombing.

Obviously, the costs, in terms of money and life quality, of such morally stupid behavior are extremely high. A couple billion dollars doesn't seem too high an estimate. Why does nobody get the idea that with a tiny fraction of the money wasted on fences, prisons, and bombs, we could build schools and train teachers and, thereby foster moral competence and reduce violence, deceit and power. Not possible? Well, I have seen many spots in the world where there is nearly no violence, deceit and power. Why should it be impossible to achieve this for the rest of the world?

OECD has calculated that the interest rate of investment in general education is much higher than any other investment. But their figures (about 8%) are based on conventional education. I believe that we could top these interest rates if we would introduce moral and democratic competence education in all schools world-wide. I believe this because I have tried it out in many countries. See my web-site: http://www.uni-konstanz.de/ag-moral/home-e.htm

I have summed up my experience and my research in my book "Moral ist lehrbar." I am sure that the information I have documented in my book could substantially help to make a better, more peaceful world.

You say that you can't read my book because it is not in English? Well, you can help to translate it into English by donating to my crowd-funding campaign. But hurry. It will end soon, January 24, 2016: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/make-morality-can-be-taught-available-in-english--2#/

Yours sincerely
Georg

Voices on the KMDD

In the following video, participants of a KMDD-workshop-seminar from Czech Republic, China, Turkey, Hungary, and Germany give testimonials:


For a detailed abstract of my book in English visit:
http://www.uni-konstanz.de/ag-moral/buch-lind/target34.html#abstract

More info on research and development in the field of moral-democratic competence education and a comprehensive list of references visit:
http://www.uni-konstanz.de/ag-moral/home-e.htm


"Dr. Lind, What Got You Interested in Moral Competence?"

A conversation with students and staff of the University of California at Irvine

Help the Campaign

You can also support this campagn by telling friends and colleagues about it and passing on the campaign-link (see also below).

You can also support it by adding a link to this campaign on your web-site. I suggest to use (or modify) this text:
English: Georg Lind asks for support for the funding of the English edition of his book "Moral ist lehrbar". If you think that this is an important project and wish to donate, you can click here and get a free copy:
http://igg.me/at/moralitycanbetaught/x/12968762

Deutsch: Georg Lind bittet um Unterstützung für die Finanzierung der englischen Ausgabe seines Buchs "Moral ist lehrbar". Wenn Sie das für wichtig halten und unterstützen möchten, können Sie hier spenden und ein freies Exemplar erhalten:
http://igg.me/at/moralitycanbetaught/x/12968762

story:
Our Story

DRYVE is a project-based group that was created by Northeastern University students in Boston, Massachusetts. Our mission is to enrich, educate, and empower underprivileged communities by providing youth with sustainable resources of knowledge, tools, and skills. Founded in 2009 by passionate youth, DRYVE aims to provide students the opportunity to go abroad and create sustainable solutions to the worldâ€™s problems. Our main focus is on education, and our past two trips have centered on the installation and improvement of schools in the Dominican Republic. 


This year, we are working in collaboration with YMCA International to install an Uninterrupted Power Supply (UPS) for an elementary level school in La Yuca, Dominican Republic. Additionally, we will be completing the construction of a library and conducting various workshops, such as permaculture (sustainable gardening), computer skills, leadership, and proper sanitation. Despite being full-time students, we fundraise in full for every aspect of this project. This includes: the purchase of the the UPS, travel, food and lodge, and for the materials and supplies needed to complete the library. 


The Impact

The Dominican Republic suffers from frequent electrical blackouts. Children in schools do not have access to a constant source of electricity which prohibits them from having the opportunities to work with computers. Likewise, the opportunity to allow children and even adults the opportunity to attend night school is life changing. We believe that with the addition of electricity and the completion of a library, DRYVE is establishing two essential components to improve the educational welfare for these children. 


What We Need & What You Get

We are planning to purchase all the necessary supplies for the completion of the library, as well as pay for the UPS to be installed professionally in the YMCA school. Your contribution will help DRYVE accomplish providing all of the necessary materials. All money will be received and distributed by La Alianza Hispana, a 501(c)(3) non-profit, and will be earmarked for this project only. Donations made to La Alianza Hispana are tax deductible. 


Other Ways You Can Help/ Build-a-thon

Spread the word! Post this link to websites you have a presence in. Share our link on social media outlets such as Facebook, Twitter, and Reddit. With your assistance, you will be contributing to our Build-a-thon initiatives to help our DRYVE members reach their individual goal of $1,600. Help us impact the education for the underprivileged youth in the Dominican Republic. Your support can change a child's future for the better!
