story:
TEEN INSIGHT LEADERSHIP MISSION STATEMENT:
 
We are Teen Insight Leadership, traveling the world and creating opportunities to empower and support leaders of tomorrow by giving and receiving service and connecting with the global community.

 

Can you support us in achieving our goal?  It takes just $10....or more…

We have raised $58,000 so far and we are in are final phase.  

Can you please please please help us reach our goal of raising $117,000 to pay for our expenses and our workshops in Tanzania.

 

Why we are doing this:

This is an investment in the future, ours and yours.  We are 14 creative teenagers and young adults from the Los Angeles area that are creating a Service Project to empower ourselves and the young people of Moshi, Tanzania.  This is a project we are creating for ourselves and for 600 students in Moshi, Tanzania.  We are working on this project with the support of our coach (the Director of the program) and are really proud of it.

 

We have found that we can accomplish anything when we set a clear intention.  Our intention is to give back to the world and support other young people in their growth.  This project in Africa gives us an opportunity to learn practical skills of how to achieve our goals, plan events on a large scale, go outside our comfort zone to ask for what we need and manage our money and time.

 

The affect this project will have is exponential as it is showing us how to take risks and create something larger than ourselves and it is helping African kids further their education so they can start creating the lives they want, too.

 

Project: 

The Journey to Tanzania Service Project

We will be in Tanzania from August 2-19, 2011.

In the fall of 2008, teen graduates of the Teen Insight Leadership Program decided they wanted to give back and give back in a big way.  They were understanding the value of service and wanted to make the biggest impact they could.  So they researched and chose to travel to Moshi, Tanzania in East Africa to partner with Knock Foundation (who ensure the kids have food, shelter and access to education) to volunteer with a poverty and AIDS stricken area.  We completed our first Journey to Tanzania Service Project in August, 2009 and the teens fundraised the entire amount they needed, even giving a small donation to Knock after we left. 

There have been over 60 teens selected to be part of the Teen Insight Leadership Program.  They have taken all graduate level seminars of Teen Insight and volunteered with many programs over the course of at least 1 year.  

  

While in Tanzania in 2009, they built a new classroom for the Kindergarden class, painted a Dream Tree Mural and repainted the front of the school, facilitated Self Esteem Workshops for all the students of Mrupanga Primary (the kids from Matumaini Orphanage attend this school) and helped to create an Educator Workshop. 

This year we will be expanding to new primary schools and opening up the Educator Workshops to all the teachers in Moshi.  

 

The Journey to Tanzania Service Project is an opportunity for our new class of Graduates to Facilitate all the Self-Esteem Workshops and English Classes, as well as, help to create the Educator Workshops.

This is an amazing project to be working on at such a young age.  

The group of teens and young adults begin in February and start to fundraise for all of their expenses, as well as, learn Swahili and help to create curriculum and special projects.  This is a 7 month process that culminates into the experience of a lifetime in Tanzania. 

We invite you to join us in our project and donate to help make this Service Project happen.  

We will keep donors updated on our progress before we leave and email pictures once we are there.

  

What We Need & What You Get

In this campaign, we are raising money to pay for the airline tickets for 17 teens and chaperones flying from Los Angeles to Moshi, Tanzania as well as, insurance, Visas and Educator & Student Workshops as well as the English Class expenses when we get there. Those include: local translators (employing local college students for 2 weeks), construction paper, pens, scissors, flyers, notebooks and audio equipment.  Our full fundraising goal is closer to $117,000 to pay for all 14 participants and 3 chaperones to travel to Moshi, all accommodations, meals, transportation, insurance and administrative costs.  We have raised over $58,000 at this point, so this is our final phase as we need all of the money raised by July 3, 2011.

  

We want to include you in the project as much as possible so you can get to know all of us that are involved.  We will send you pictures and video from Tanzania and updates from here during our planning.  If you become a Best Friend Sponsor or Family Sponsor, we will happily advertise your logo on our tshirts and website.  Also, we are handmaking 300 unique bracelets to give as gifts to the students of Mrupanga Primary School and Matumaini Orphanage, so the more you donate, the more it not only ensures our expenses getting paid for, but a child gets a handmade bracelet they can wear and can think of us and his/her dreams when he/she looks at it. The bracelets will be mailed out to you before we leave.

 

A bit of history

The value and accessibility of education is different in Tanzania than in the US.  Public schools in the US can be free and taught in the same language we all speak.  Our intention is to work with Primary Schools in Moshi to help them not only learn better English so they can pass the test for Secondary School, but also see what the possibility of achieving dreams can do for their future.

In Tanzania, government secondary schools have a tuition around $15 USD per year plus fees. A typical private school tuition is around $525 USD. This creates quite a burden on many families that mostly make around $280 USD a year. It is even harder for large families, single parent families and orphans. Families where the parents do not yet appreciate the value of education, especially for girls, is often enough to keep them from agreeing to pay for schooling.

By law, all secondary education must be taught in English. For many students, English is their third language.  In 2009, only 35.44% of students sitting for the National Standard 7 Exam received passing marks in English. This means that numerous students who did not pass their Standard 7 Exam in English will be thrust into a school using only English for classroom instruction and textbooks. To further the issue, not all teachers in the Primary Schools speak English well enough to teach it.

This is why we are focusing on teaching English in the Primary Schools, so they can be better prepared for the Grade 7 Exam.  We want to bring the percentage of students from Mrupanga Primary that pass the Grade 7 Exam up above 50% this year alone and hope that the classes we offer will assist with that.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Donate $50

2. Ask your friends to donate and share our link

 

Thank you for supporting us,

Lisi, Eldrick, Gabe, Gabe, Tasha, Kaitlyn, Madeleine, Tessa, John, Austin, Emma, Hayley, Ben and Christina
story_txt:
TEEN INSIGHT LEADERSHIP MISSION STATEMENT:
 
We are Teen Insight Leadership, traveling the world and creating opportunities
to empower and support leaders of tomorrow by giving and receiving service
and connecting with the global community.
 
Can you support us in achieving our goal?  It
takes just $10....or more…
We have raised $58,000 so far and we are in are
final phase.  
Can you please please please help us reach our
goal of raising $117,000 to pay for our expenses and our workshops in Tanzania.
 
Why we are doing this:
This is an investment in the future, ours and yours.  We are
14 creative teenagers and young adults from the Los Angeles area that are creating
a Service Project to empower ourselves and the young people of Moshi, Tanzania.  This is a project we are creating for ourselves and for 600 students in Moshi, Tanzania.  We are working on this project with the support of our coach (the Director of the program) and are really proud of it.
 
We have found that we can accomplish anything when we set a clear
intention.  Our intention is to give back to the world and support other young
people in their growth.  This project in
Africa gives us an opportunity to learn practical skills of how to achieve our
goals, plan events on a large scale, go outside our comfort zone to ask for what we
need and manage our money and time.
 
The affect this project will have is exponential as
it is showing us how to take risks and create something larger than ourselves
and it is helping African kids further their education so they can start
creating the lives they want, too.
 
Project: 
The Journey to Tanzania Service Project
We will be in Tanzania from August 2-19, 2011.
In the fall of 2008, teen graduates of the Teen
Insight Leadership Program decided they wanted to give back and give back in a
big way.  They were understanding the value of service and wanted to make
the biggest impact they could.  So they researched and chose to travel to
Moshi, Tanzania in East Africa to partner with Knock Foundation (who ensure the
kids have food, shelter and access to education) to volunteer with a poverty
and AIDS stricken area.  We completed our first Journey to Tanzania
Service Project in August, 2009 and the teens fundraised the entire amount
they needed, even giving a small donation to Knock after we left. 
There have been over 60 teens selected to be part
of the Teen Insight Leadership Program.  They have taken all graduate
level seminars of Teen Insight and volunteered with many programs over the
course of at least 1 year.  
  
While in Tanzania in 2009, they built a new classroom
for the Kindergarden class, painted a Dream Tree Mural and repainted the front
of the school, facilitated Self Esteem Workshops for all the students of
Mrupanga Primary (the kids from Matumaini Orphanage attend this school) and
helped to create an Educator Workshop. 
This year we will be expanding to new primary
schools and opening up the Educator Workshops to all the teachers in Moshi.  
 
The Journey to Tanzania Service Project is an
opportunity for our new class of Graduates to Facilitate all the Self-Esteem
Workshops and English Classes, as well as, help to create the Educator
Workshops.
This is an amazing project to be working on at such
a young age.  
The group of teens and young adults begin in
February and start to fundraise for all of their expenses, as well as, learn
Swahili and help to create curriculum and special projects.  This is a 7
month process that culminates into the experience of a lifetime in
Tanzania. 
We invite you to join us in our project and donate
to help make this Service Project happen.  
We will keep donors updated on our progress before
we leave and email pictures once we are there.
  
What We Need & What You Get
In this campaign, we are raising money to pay for
the airline tickets for 17 teens and chaperones flying from Los Angeles to Moshi,
Tanzania as well as, insurance, Visas and Educator & Student Workshops as well as the English Class expenses when we get there.
Those include: local translators (employing local college students for 2 weeks),
construction paper, pens, scissors, flyers, notebooks and audio equipment.  Our
full fundraising goal is closer to $117,000 to pay for all 14 participants and
3 chaperones to travel to Moshi, all accommodations, meals,
transportation, insurance and administrative costs.  We have raised over $58,000 at this point, so this is our final phase as we need all of the money raised by July 3, 2011.
  
We want to include you in the project as much as
possible so you can get to know all of us that are involved.  We will send
you pictures and video from Tanzania and updates from here during our planning.
 If you become a Best Friend Sponsor or Family Sponsor, we will happily
advertise your logo on our tshirts and website.  Also, we are
handmaking 300 unique bracelets to give as gifts to the students of Mrupanga
Primary School and Matumaini Orphanage, so the more you donate, the
more it not only ensures our expenses getting paid for, but a child gets a
handmade bracelet they can wear and can think of us and his/her dreams when
he/she looks at it. The bracelets will be mailed out to you before we leave.
 
A bit of history
The value and accessibility of education is
different in Tanzania than in the US.  Public schools in the US can be
free and taught in the same language we all speak.  Our intention is
to work with Primary Schools in Moshi to help them not only learn better
English so they can pass the test for Secondary School, but also see what the
possibility of achieving dreams can do for their future.
In Tanzania, government secondary schools have a
tuition around $15 USD per year plus fees. A typical private
school tuition is around $525 USD. This creates quite a burden on many families that
mostly make around $280 USD a year. It is even harder for large families,
single parent families and orphans. Families where the parents do not yet
appreciate the value of education, especially for girls, is often enough to
keep them from agreeing to pay for schooling.
By law, all secondary education must be taught in
English. For many students, English is their third language.  In
2009, only 35.44% of students sitting for the National Standard 7 Exam received
passing marks in English. This means that numerous students who did not
pass their Standard 7 Exam in English will be thrust into a school using only
English for classroom instruction and textbooks. To further the issue, not all
teachers in the Primary Schools speak English well enough to teach it.
This is why we are focusing on teaching English in
the Primary Schools, so they can be better prepared for the Grade 7 Exam.
 We want to bring the percentage of students from Mrupanga Primary that
pass the Grade 7 Exam up above 50% this year alone and hope that the classes we
offer will assist with that.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
1. Donate $50
2. Ask your friends to donate and share our link
 
Thank you for supporting us,
Lisi, Eldrick, Gabe, Gabe, Tasha, Kaitlyn,
Madeleine, Tessa, John, Austin, Emma, Hayley, Ben and Christina

story:
About O-MUN

We have developed the first online Model United Nation’s program, a project that allows any high school student, anywhere in the world, the ability to debate and discuss global issues through the Internet without any cost.

After a year of building and recruiting, the program is taking on some critical momentum, and is now spreading in places like Qatar, Somalia, Swaziland, China, India and the UK. Currently, we have students from over 30 countries, and this is just the beginning. You can listen to a condensed demo debate here.

What We Need

At the invitation of The Hague Model United Nations, one of the most prestigious MUN conferences in the world, a group of nine students will be travelling in January 2013 to present O-MUN to over 3500 students and their Directors. We have been able to secure a generous donation from a benefactor, but still have a shortfall in covering the conference fees, hotel and travel costs. In order for O-MUN to capitalize on this amazing opportunity, we need to secure additional funding. All told, this trip will cost in the range of $10, 000 USD, and raising even just $3, 000 will significantly ease the burden on our travel team. The cost breakdown is as follows:

$2000 USD for registration fees

$8000 USD for hotel expenses for the delegation

Any funds raised above our reg fees will be split evenly between team members to offset hotel costs.

We are very close to getting the global recognition that would allow us to launch a fully independent, not-for-profit educational organization, and presenting at the Hague will open these final doors for our on going expansion.

Why This Matters

Model United Nations is the largest academic role-playing simulation in the world. Students assume the role of a diplomat at the United Nations and then research, collaborate and debate issues like disarmament, human rights or the environment. All of these debates are held in a traditional face to face environment, often at huge expense to schools and families who wish to have their child experience this powerful academic simulation.

But many families simply cannot afford this expense. There are students who are not allowed to travel outside their cities due to safety or cultural reasons. Homeschooled students have few opportunities to attend conferences. In some countries, MUN simply does not exist.

Our first delegate from Somalia said:

“O-MUN makes me feel that I have the right to be part of global youth citizenry. Success cannot be measured in wealth, fame or power, but by whether you have made a positive difference for others, and that is what O-MUN is allowing me to do” Ugbad Kasim, Norther Somalia.

Absent expansive and diverse student representation, MUN debates lack a truly global nature. But students, logging into a virtual classroom from literally anywhere in the world, can discuss and debate important global issues. Technology becomes the great equalizer, making meaningful youth dialogue and collaboration an easy reality for many.

O-MUN is quickly developing into more than a debating program. It is a global youth leadership incubator. At a time when serious and seemingly intractable problems face us at every turn, young people need to be empowered with the knowledge and skills to move forward, become problems solvers and be skilled at finding consensus with people who are on the other side of the world.

All of us at O-MUN feel that we have created something that fills a real need: a global and inclusive program that builds community, promotes dialogue and discussion, and friendship between people.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, but are a former MUN student or director, you can help us greatly by promoting this effort through your own channels. If you know of a business or organization that might be willing to contribute, please send them our campaign information. We have grown tremendously this past year. Your support gives us a much-needed boost. We hope we can count on your support, great or small, to help us make the world’s first truly global, online MUN program, a reality for thousands of students!

story:
"You can never cross the ocean unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore" - Christopher Columbus/André Gide

WHO I AM:

  • I was born and raised in Singapore where I went to local schools and completed Junior College, fully immersed in drama as an 'O' and 'A' Level Subject. At 15 years old I was inspired to commit my life to being an 'Athlete of the Heart', an Actress. 
  • I found my VOICE in America. After Junior College, I moved to the U.S.A. I began my Musical Theatre BFA at Syracuse University
  • After 2 years at Syracuse, I decided to do something about my dream of training in a Top English Conservatory. In lieu of high application fees, I allowed myself to apply for only one school with the Curriculum that spoke most to me. This was GUILDHALL.
  • The IMPOSSIBLE happened: After 3000 applicants and 3 rounds of auditions, I was offered one of the coveted 26 places.

WHAT I NEED: 

It is a hefty sum to pay, and truthfully, any help would be greatly appreciated, be it a dollar, 1000 dollars or a thousand words of wisdom on how to live cheaply in London. 

WHY I NEED IT:

The programme involves a large number of contact hours (for acting, this is a minimum of 35 hours per week in the first year for three 12-week terms) so it is not possible to finance the program through part time work. 

I come from humble beginnings growing up in a small flat in Clementi, Singapore, with my two younger sisters, mother and Grandmother; my single mother being the sole Breadwinner, struggling to make ends meet. She taught me what it means to work hard, always. She wanted to give us the opportunity to claim our American birthright - my father is American so my sisters and I have dual citizenship - hence our move to America. 

BUT. I am 21 years old and my mother has bled enough for me. I want my sisters to have the same opportunity to pursue their aspirations. I want to pay for school on my own, but even as I combine my savings with the money I have made from working over the last 4 years, I still need a tremendous amount of help. As a non-EU/UK citizen, a lot of funding is unavailable to me. Furthermore, after incurring a hefty sum of loans from my first 2 years at Syracuse, I want to minimise the Loans I have to borrow as a last resort.

WHAT YOU GET:

I cannot give you anything in return at the moment, apart from thank you notes and personalised poems, but you will always have my appreciation. Regardless of how much you give, if you visit London over the next three years, my doors will be open to you to stay with me for the entire duration of your trip. One day, when I do have the means, I will give back in whatever capacity I can. This would include tours around London, free tickets to shows etc.

GUILDHALL is the CHANCE OF A LIFETIME. One does not get the opportunity to train there twice. If I cannot pay for it NOW, I can NEVER go. 

A little bit about Guildhall:

Alumni include Rhys Ifans, Joseph Fiennes, Daniel Craig, Michelle Dockery, Jude Law, Orlando Bloom and Ewan McGregor, to name a few. 

Faculty includes leading Voice Coach, Author and Theatre Director Patsy Rodenburg. 

The program is extremely current with preparation to match the changing face of the Acting market. 

Almost all of the third year students have agent coverage and even secured jobs 6 months before graduation

WHY ACTING:

  • I am in love with learning. With acting, the learning never stops :)
  • Nothing has taught me more about how to live generously, with an open heart and spirit founded by a deep sense of community.
  • There is nothing more fulfilling than the pursuit of truth and the hope that it may resonate with someone. 
  • I am chronically shy. Acting is the only subject where I am not a passive spectator but an engaged participant. It continuously forces me out of my comfort zone, out of my shell - a reason why I am dedicating my life to ensuring as many students get the same opportunity to grow into their confidence via Drama as a subject. 
  • Acting makes me a better person - a more sensitive, open minded, confident, generous citizen of the world. 
Acting is my way of life. It is my hope, my joy, my one true love. Please help me 'cross the ocean' and get closer to living my dream of being a working Actress. 

CONTRIBUTE IF YOU CAN!

SPREAD THE WORD! 

THANK YOU SOOO MUCH :D

story:
WHAT IS GIRLS ROCK CAMP TORONTO?

Girls Rock Camp Toronto is a volunteer based organization that builds self esteem through music creation. Female musicians offer music instruction and coach the bands during band practices. We provide a safe space for girls aged 8-16 to learn instruments, write songs, and rock out on stage. No previous music experience is necessary!

At Girls Rock Camp Toronto we help girls find their voices through unique programming that combines music education and performance; arts and crafts; empowerment and social justice workshops; positive role models, and collaboration and leadership skill building.

This fall, with your help, we will launch the first of many programs outside of summer camp. Our plan for 2014-15 and into the future is to pilot an after school program, followed by other year round programming including a ladies rock camp and a workshop series. We hope to begin employing year-round staff, paying our key instructors a dedicated wage, and finding office space to keep Girls Rock Camp Toronto growing and get more girls rocking.

We are members of the worldwide Girls Rock Camp Alliance and share its values:

  • We value the power of music as a means to create personal and social change;

  • We value efforts that actively expand opportunities for girls and women;

  • We value positive approaches to fighting sexism;

  • We value integrity, honesty and respect;

  • We value appropriate sharing of resources, cooperation, and collaboration;

  • We value using our collective voice to further our mission;

  • We value diversity.

  • We value contributing a woman’s voice to the male dominated music industry.

WHAT HAVE WE DONE SO FAR?

In a culture that often has a negative impact on girls body image, self esteem and skills ability, we wanted to create a safe environment for girls to be themselves in every shape and form and to express themselves in the best way we know how... ROCKING OUT!!!

Girls Rock Camp Toronto was formed by a group of musicians in Toronto in the spring of 2010. Our first camp session ran in 2011 and was a huge success with 25 girls forming 5 bands and writing original songs together. The highlight was the showcase concert, where the pride our campers felt in themselves was undeniable. Each band performed their original song, written over the course of the week with the help of our expert band coaches, to a roaring crowd of over 100 family members, fans, and supporters of Girls Rock Camp Toronto.

In our second year we expanded to two equally successful, sold out camp sessions, added a chef to the staff, and continued to improve and expand on our programming. Each band recorded at least one original song, which was released on CD for friends and family. 

2013 was our biggest year yet, with three sold out camp sessions and an extensive waiting list. We launched our first Indiegogo campaign and started dreaming about the future.

THE GOAL

Is to raise $15000 towards launching an after-school program. For many young people, the hours following the end of school are spent alone. We believe that providing a structured, supervised and nurturing program that is fun and builds skills, can make a long-lasting and positive impact on young women, their families and their communities.

Our after-school pilot program will run for ten weeks in winter 2014, with more sessions to follow. Girls aged 8-16 will learn to play an instrument of their choice (guitar, bass, drums, and keys), form bands, and write songs with strong female mentors and role models, and be given tools to develop life skills and confidence. We'll be adapting our highly successful summer camp model to give girls the opportunity to rock year-round. 

Our mandate is to ensure that our programming is accessible to girls of all economic backgrounds. To do this our tuition is very low and we want to keep it this way. We want to increase the number of subsidized spots and get the word out to youth who would not otherwise hear about camp! As our demand for Girls Rock Camp programming grows, so do our expenses. We rely on donations to keep our organization thriving.

Expenses that YOUR donations help cover are:

  • Scholarships: Through this campaign you can choose to sponsor a participant or an entire band, or add to our scholarship fund - helping us offer more subsidized spots so all girls can rock out!

  • Gear: Because we are committed to giving every girl the opportunity to participate in the after-school program, we do not require campers to bring their own instruments. We rent instruments for participants and repair and maintain the instruments that have been donated to us.

  • Other music “stuff”: Participants wouldn’t be able to go electric, stay in tune or bring the noise without patch cords, tuners, drumsticks, guitar picks, instrument cases etc.

  • Program Supplies: What would camp be without glitter, glue, paint, silk screen materials, notebooks, camper t-shirts, button making supplies, a projector, flip chart paper etc!?

  • Logistics: These things may not sound so rock’n’roll, but they are essential to making our programs possible: venue rental, insurance costs, accounting and legal services, administrative costs, website hosting and maintenance, graphic design and printing costs.

  • Artist Fees: We value the contributions of all of our volunteers! For the most part, GRCT cannot pay the skilled, hardworking people who volunteer at camp, however we aim to offer a small honorarium to instrument instructors, band coaches, and other lead positions.  

HOW ELSE CAN YOU HELP?

If you want to be involved but simply do not have the finances-there are other ways you can help.  Get the word out about GIRLS ROCK CAMP! By pasting links to this page (facebooking, tweeting, pinteresting, instagramming, tumblring, emailing, etc etc etc)  you are helping spread the word more than we could alone.

Here are some tweets to get the ball rolling:

Let’s get this after school rock party started! Support @girlsrockcampTO ‘s after-school program! http://igg.me/at/girlsrocktoronto

Sugar and spice, and everything Rock 'n Roll...that's what girls are made of! Support @girlsrockcampTO! http://igg.me/at/girlsrocktoronto

Everyone knows girls rock, but help them rock even harder by supporting @girlsrockcampTO http://igg.me/at/girlsrocktoronto

Q: How do you make Rock & Roll even better? A: Teach a girl to play guitar! Support @GirlsRockCampTO http://igg.me/at/girlsrocktoronto

A bit of extra change can go a long way. Help @GirlsRockCampTO toward their $15000 goal & spread the word:GIRLS ROCK! http://igg.me/at/girlsrocktoronto

THE IMPACT

By helping Girls Rock Camp Toronto you are changing the future for young women! We are inspiring girls to be who they are and letting them be themselves. We know what it's like to grow up without strong female role models. Here is a chance to support and encourage girls to do what they love and have mentors by their side.

THANK YOU

We’ve come so far thanks to the help of many GRCT supporters who include:

  • Our incredible volunteer staff of 50+ women who are our band coaches, instrument instructors, support staff, workshop facilitators and all around amazing women. They give up weeks of their time and measureless amounts of patience, wisdom and mentorship to our campers.

  • All the local bands who have played fundraisers in support of GRCT and lunch time bands who inspire our young music-makers throughout their week-long songwriting process.

  • The Girls Rock Camp Alliance for their guidance and mentorship

  • Art Starts who is providing us with guidance as we develop into a sustainable organization

  • Collective Concerts, Fuzzy Logic Recordings, Godin Guitars, Kids Can Press, Six Shooter Records, and the Sony Centre for donating prizes for this campaign

  • Past donors for contributing to our scholarship funds and helping get things off the ground!
story_txt:
WHAT IS GIRLS ROCK CAMP TORONTO?Girls Rock Camp Toronto is a volunteer based organization that builds self esteem through music creation. Female musicians offer music instruction and coach the bands during band practices. We provide a safe space for girls aged 8-16 to learn instruments, write songs, and rock out on stage. No previous music experience is necessary!At Girls Rock Camp Toronto we help girls find their voices through unique programming that combines music education and performance; arts and crafts; empowerment and social justice workshops; positive role models, and collaboration and leadership skill building.This fall, with your help, we will launch the first of many programs outside of summer camp. Our plan for 2014-15 and into the future is to pilot an after school program, followed by other year round programming including a ladies rock camp and a workshop series. We hope to begin employing year-round staff, paying our key instructors a dedicated wage, and finding office space to keep Girls Rock Camp Toronto growing and get more girls rocking.We are members of the worldwide Girls Rock Camp Alliance and share its values:
We value the power of music as a means to create personal and social change;
We value efforts that actively expand opportunities for girls and women;
We value positive approaches to fighting sexism;
We value integrity, honesty and respect;
We value appropriate sharing of resources, cooperation, and collaboration;
We value using our collective voice to further our mission;
We value diversity.

We value contributing a woman’s voice to the male dominated music industry.



WHAT HAVE WE DONE SO FAR?In a culture that often has a negative impact on girls body image, self esteem and skills ability, we wanted to create a safe environment for girls to be themselves in every shape and form and to express themselves in the best way we know how... ROCKING OUT!!!Girls Rock Camp Toronto was formed by a group of musicians in Toronto in the spring of 2010. Our first camp session ran in 2011 and was a huge success with 25 girls forming 5 bands and writing original songs together. The highlight was the showcase concert, where the pride our campers felt in themselves was undeniable. Each band performed their original song, written over the course of the week with the help of our expert band coaches, to a roaring crowd of over 100 family members, fans, and supporters of Girls Rock Camp Toronto.In our second year we expanded to two equally successful, sold out camp sessions, added a chef to the staff, and continued to improve and expand on our programming. Each band recorded at least one original song, which was released on CD for friends and family. 2013 was our biggest year yet, with three sold out camp sessions and an extensive waiting list. We launched our first Indiegogo campaign and started dreaming about the future.THE GOALIs to raise $15000 towards launching an after-school program. For many young people, the hours following the end of school are spent alone. We believe that providing a structured, supervised and nurturing program that is fun and builds skills, can make a long-lasting and positive impact on young women, their families and their communities. Our after-school pilot program will run for ten weeks in winter 2014, with more sessions to follow. Girls aged 8-16 will learn to play an instrument of their choice (guitar, bass, drums, and keys), form bands, and write songs with strong female mentors and role models, and be given tools to develop life skills and confidence. We'll be adapting our highly successful summer camp model to give girls the opportunity to rock year-round. Our mandate is to ensure that our programming is accessible to girls of all economic backgrounds. To do this our tuition is very low and we want to keep it this way. We want to increase the number of subsidized spots and get the word out to youth who would not otherwise hear about camp! As our demand for Girls Rock Camp programming grows, so do our expenses. We rely on donations to keep our organization thriving.Expenses that YOUR donations help cover are:
Scholarships: Through this campaign you can choose to sponsor a participant or an entire band, or add to our scholarship fund - helping us offer more subsidized spots so all girls can rock out!
Gear: Because we are committed to giving every girl the opportunity to participate in the after-school program, we do not require campers to bring their own instruments. We rent instruments for participants and repair and maintain the instruments that have been donated to us. 
Other music “stuff”: Participants wouldn’t be able to go electric, stay in tune or bring the noise without patch cords, tuners, drumsticks, guitar picks, instrument cases etc.
Program Supplies: What would camp be without glitter, glue, paint, silk screen materials, notebooks, camper t-shirts, button making supplies, a projector, flip chart paper etc!?
Logistics: These things may not sound so rock’n’roll, but they are essential to making our programs possible: venue rental, insurance costs, accounting and legal services, administrative costs, website hosting and maintenance, graphic design and printing costs.

Artist Fees: We value the contributions of all of our volunteers! For the most part, GRCT cannot pay the skilled, hardworking people who volunteer at camp, however we aim to offer a small honorarium to instrument instructors, band coaches, and other lead positions.  



 HOW ELSE CAN YOU HELP?If you want to be involved but simply do not have the finances-there are other ways you can help.  Get the word out about GIRLS ROCK CAMP! By pasting links to this page (facebooking, tweeting, pinteresting, instagramming, tumblring, emailing, etc etc etc)  you are helping spread the word more than we could alone.Here are some tweets to get the ball rolling:Let’s get this after school rock party started! Support @girlsrockcampTO ‘s after-school program! http://igg.me/at/girlsrocktorontoSugar and spice, and everything Rock 'n Roll...that's what girls are made of! Support @girlsrockcampTO! http://igg.me/at/girlsrocktorontoEveryone knows girls rock, but help them rock even harder by supporting @girlsrockcampTO http://igg.me/at/girlsrocktorontoQ: How do you make Rock & Roll even better? A: Teach a girl to play guitar! Support @GirlsRockCampTO http://igg.me/at/girlsrocktorontoA bit of extra change can go a long way. Help @GirlsRockCampTO toward their $15000 goal & spread the word:GIRLS ROCK! http://igg.me/at/girlsrocktorontoTHE IMPACTBy helping Girls Rock Camp Toronto you are changing the future for young women! We are inspiring girls to be who they are and letting them be themselves. We know what it's like to grow up without strong female role models. Here is a chance to support and encourage girls to do what they love and have mentors by their side. THANK YOUWe’ve come so far thanks to the help of many GRCT supporters who include:
Our incredible volunteer staff of 50+ women who are our band coaches, instrument instructors, support staff, workshop facilitators and all around amazing women. They give up weeks of their time and measureless amounts of patience, wisdom and mentorship to our campers.
All the local bands who have played fundraisers in support of GRCT and lunch time bands who inspire our young music-makers throughout their week-long songwriting process.
The Girls Rock Camp Alliance for their guidance and mentorship
Art Starts who is providing us with guidance as we develop into a sustainable organization
Collective Concerts, Fuzzy Logic Recordings, Godin Guitars, Kids Can Press, Six Shooter Records, and the Sony Centre for donating prizes for this campaign

Past donors for contributing to our scholarship funds and helping get things off the ground!

story:
Women Step Out and Step Up!

This conference will bring together marginalized women from around Kenya to share and strategize on how to break past barriers, amplify their voices, and achieve their ambitions.

Millions of the womenfolk practicing  sex work, or living in the slums, or with low or no formal education, or who harbor deep wounds from violence and abuse, illnesses and poverty remain caged in a world of great vulnerability.

The theme of this conference is “Women take the lead: creating a more united and inclusive voice.”

At the conference, women will share and celebrate their experiences, the strategies they have tested, and the challenges and breakthroughs in creating safe spaces for enhanced dignity of their  groups. We will discuss how to create more inclusive participation in their communities.

We will also begin a new mentoring initiative at this conference, pairing conference participants with women leaders for 6 months. This creates the support that many Kenyan women aspiring towards leadership desire. 

Why we need your help

Unfortunately, majority of the grass-root women representing very active groups are not able to afford the conference costs of approximately $120 each (travel, accommodation, food, speakers, etc), and so could lose this opportunity to share, celebrate, learn and develop a common strategy. 

Through your support, 40 more women will come, share and learn how others have innovated strategies that have led to broken barriers of poverty, helplessness and  vulnerability,  freeing thousands and thousands of women to become entrepreneurs, community and household leaders and champions for important causes! In their wake, they have supported children to break the chains that have kept their families below the ground level and taken charge of their own destiny! 

Who are we?

The conference is being hosted by Life Bloom Services International (LBSI), an organization that advocates for vulnerable women and children, particularly commercial sex workers and prisoners (view some of our achievements here http://www.lifebloom.org/Achievements.html). 

My name is Catherine Wanjohi, founding member and CEO of LBSI. I invite you on behalf of the 6000 strong Life Bloom family to support 40 women passionate about sharing and learning, yet unable to afford to participate at the conference. 

Thank you!

Life Bloom would be excited to add your name on the Wall of Honor of the Women One Stop Center, our safe skills learning center for women facing stigma and marginalization in Kenya (sex workers and women leaving prison). The Center will be launched on Sept 5th 2014 at the conclusion of the conference. The women you sponsor will enter into history as being among the first to benefit at the center.  The Center has cost US$ 47,235 to date, all from repeated personal donations. 

We will highly appreciate it if you share this campaign and action among your networks, and join Kenya in creating the transformation so much desired by the women and households living in the margins of our society!

story:
En resumen

Somos Luis Y Trice, realizadores audiovisuales en Iquitos-Perú, parte del colectivo Kinoiquitos (colectivo que busca promover la realización audiovisual en la amazonía peruana, utilizar el cine como medio de expresión de nuestra realidad)

En esta oportunidad, surgió una propuesta genial.

La Escuela de Cine Amazónico (Espacio cultural de capacitación y desarrollo profesional creado con el fin de formar a los nuevos realizadores audiovisuales de la Amazonia) ha convocado a un Taller de producción de documentales en Pucallpa y queremos ir!!!! Seria una oportunidad genial para aprender… en la Amazonía Peruana!

El taller es del 6 al 31 Octubre.

La participación en este evento nos ayudaría enormemente a mejorar nuestras capacidades como documentalistas, haciendo que nuestros futuros proyectos tengan una calidad mas optima y expresar con nuestras obras la realidad de nuestra amazonía.

Lo que necesitamos

Como el taller es de Lunes a Sábado nos tendríamos que mudar un mes a Pucallpa (pasajes) y necesitamos alquilar un cuarto y cubrir lo básico (comida y transporte)

Estamos buscando donaciones para cubrir los gastos y poder participar de esta genial experiencia. Cualquier monto ayuda!!!!!!!

Comida diaria 15 soles cada uno = 15x2x30 = 900soles

Pasajes aprox 150 dólares cada uno = 300 dólares = 867soles

Transporte local 15 soles diarios = 450soles

Alquiler de un cuarto en Pucallpa = 600soles

TOTAL= 2817 (Pedimos 1000 dolares)


    El impacto

    Como Kinoiquitos, colectivo audiovisual aqui en la amazonia, tratamos de generar cine en esta parte del mundo, utilizar la herramienta del video como medio de expresión de problematicas, de lucha y tambien de arte.
    Esta oportunidad de capacitarnos y de compartir experiencias nos permitira obtener mas recursos para la realizacion de nuestros proyectos, generando asi obras audiovisuales de mayor calidad y documentales que retraten la amazonía de una manera sensible, veraz y respetuosa.

    Queremos visibilizar problemáticas que aun no han sido cubiertas de manera que todos tengan acceso a la realidad en esta region del Peru.

      Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

      Tambien les pedimos que compartan esta campaña con sus amigos y amigas, ayudarnos a recaudar fondos para alcanzar nuestras metas.
      Es una oportunidad en la que creemos y nos gustaria que tu tambien creas. Sabemos que tenemos pocos dias para recaudar el monto total, cualquier donacion es bienvenida!

story:
LAMPA: Lesson & Activity Management, Planning & Access

LAMPA is a completely unique, and potentially revolutionary, social/professional networking medium for educators connecting teachers all over the world and allowing them to create communities to exchange ideas, to learn from one another, to employ new methods and tools, and to use learning management infrastructure that they may not have access to otherwise. 

To complete and launch this project, we need to raise $34,500. We thank you for anything you are able to contribute; every little bit helps!

By supporting LAMPA, you will be providing tools to teachers and learners in every corner of the earth where the Internet is available and thus improving the quality of education.  

- Lance Adam LaSalle, Co-director, EdCentre School, s.r.o., Vsetín, Valašské Meziříči & Rožnov pod Radhoštěm  (http://www.centrumjazyku.cz)

The Need

Teachers need to be better connected through networks to encourage the free flow of ideas. Although social and professional networking (e.g. Facebook, Linked In) are omnipresent and there are many learning management system applications (e.g. Moodle) being used by school management, these technologies are not yet being used to their full potential. LAMPA integrates these concepts to focus on the needs of the teacher and learner.

- Hana Sívková (teacher & former English student) 

The Company

We are a small, private educational services company with a very big idea. At the moment, LAMPA consists of four team members. 

Our mission is to facilitate excellence in education with innovation.

Roman and Steve at work

    So, what is LAMPA?

    LAMPA is a simple, user-friendly networking platform that gives teachers all the tools they need to do their jobs well, no matter where they are located and whether they work alone or as part of an institution. In fact, the tools, support and infrastructure it provides are especially attractive to smaller schools and independent teachers since LAMPA is free and so easy to use. 

    - Jana Rabštejnková (teacher)

    LAMPA is:
    • social/professional networking for teachers
    • an electronic lesson planner and lesson tracking system
    • an activity writer, resource and library
    • a library for articles and lesson plans
    • a timetable management system
    • a grade and attendance book
    • a homework tracker 
    • a learning management system for school managers
    • a platform for learning games that reinforce material taught
    • a report writer
    • a personal vocabulary database (dictionary) for language learners

    - Milagros Abon-Blazek (teacher)
    What else does it do?
    • It reduces teacher workload
    • It improves quality and continuity
    • It communicates with learners and their guardians or corporate sponsors
    • It networks teachers and their students
    • It facilitates team teaching and substitute teaching

    - Melinda Brasher (teacher)
    • It helps learners learn
    • It adds accountability to teaching
    • It increases the teacher's effectiveness
    • It provides access to supplementary learning materials

     - Michael J. Whittemore, Academic Director , Engish2Go, Heredia, Costa Rica. (http://www.english2go.co.cr)

    System Testing

    The original version of the system (without the global networking function) is currently being used on trial bases by language schools in the Czech Republic, Italy and Costa Rica. There have been roughly 3500 users to date including teachers, administrators, students and their parents or corporate sponsors. These users are very satisfied, but new modules must be completed and refinements must be made before we can take this ground-breaking concept and service to a global level.

    LAMPA's timetable options

    A view of a colour-coded timetable

    What We Need

    To begin to bring LAMPA to teachers throughout the world, we need to raise $34,500. If we exceed our goal, we will invest more heavily in promoting the launch.

    Approximately two thirds of the funds raised will go into funding programming activities. We estimate that this will take two months' work for three full-time programmers. Other activities and expenses will include social media marketing and perks and international shipping. The breakdown is as follows:

    There is a sense of desperation in that, if we are not successful in meeting our self-imposed deadline of April 2015, we will miss the upcoming school year, and the developers will be challenged to continue investing their time and money as they need to provide for their families. However, should we fail to meet our goal, we will continue development to the best of our abilities, in the knowledge that we will not be able to complete and test the system in time. 

    We trust that we have provided you with enough information that you are able to see the potential and how you and LAMPA can help educators around the world. 

    Our own faith in this project's enormous potential is evidenced in the time, effort and resources we have already invested.

    From Us to You

    We sincerely thank everyone who makes a contribution of any size! But we would also like you to have a token of our appreciation for helping us out. 
    • All contributors of $10.00 or more will be listed on the new MyLAMPA.com website. 
    • All individuals or organizations who help bring LAMPA to life by contributing $50.00 or more will be eligible to link a website to LAMPA's website and receive a certificate of thanks. 

    • Contributors in the amount of $75.00 - $249.00 will receive stylish limited edition LAMPA apparel and a certificate of thanks.

    All those who contribute in excess of $250.00 are major sponsors and will be awarded a Sponsorship Certificate.
    • In addition to a personalized sponsorship certificate, we would like to offer major sponsors the opportunity to try out LAMPA as a learner in a Skype course. A course would also be a great idea as a unique and meaningful gift to a friend or loved one, or as a company perk. Study English, Spanish, German, Russian, Czech, Polish, Slovak or another subject, provided we can supply a teacher, in the privacy of your own home or office. Of course your learning will be managed using our new system, so you can be directly involved in the piloting - we would be thrilled to have your feedback!

    LAMPA on-line school screen shots (www.mylampa.org)
    Reach & Impact
    Considering English language teaching alone, the potential is massive. The British Council estimates that there are one billion people learning the English language world-wide. 
    If we are able to reach 0.1% of the teachers and learners only in that market, LAMPA would be helping 1 million people. In addition to the 1 billion English language learners, LAMPA is universal in its appeal for any teacher of any subject. 

    A group of teachers mingling at a LAMPA workshop
    The peer-to-peer social media nature of the system will allow LAMPA to expand exponentially. Many teachers already use social media services such as Linked In and Facebook, so they are used to this type of medium.  Furthermore, these same teachers and their schools can be reached relatively easily through these same existing social media with targeted campaigns. 

                                             Language teachers testing the     system 
     LAMPA is ideal for smaller schools and independent teachers who may have limited technological know-how. LAMPA has been designed to be intuitive and easy to use, so it is not necessary for schools to have an IT administrator on staff - this is a criticism of traditional learning management systems.

    Using LAMPA with a group of young language learners

    Other Projects Completed

    In addition to the LAMPA modules developed to date, LAMPA Systems, as a company, has also developed a video conferencing/e-learning system (www.virtualni-trida.cz) to facilitate the delivery of language courses to learners who are house-bound, e.g. parents on parental leave and learners with physical limitations that prevent them from attending regular courses. This was a three-year project that finished in 2013. Although it is a separate project, eventually we would like to integrate the materials and technologies developed into the LAMPA platform so that they can be freely accessed by all.

      A LAMPA presentation to local teachers

      Risks & Challenges

      If we fail to meet our deadline with a quality product, we may fail to create the goodwill needed to grow and sustain demand. Of course, the risk of this happening depends on the amount of work we are able to complete before April 2015 - it is a matter of financing.

      We know that our core system is solid. If we meet our funding goal, we are confident that the planned new modules can be added successfully to complete the system. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you are interested in our project but are not in a position where you can make a financial contribution, you can still be part of LAMPA.

      As you can imagine, a project such as this relies on 'word of mouth'. 

      • If you are a teacher or a school administrator, let us know you are interested and be part of the piloting;
      • E-mail this presentation to friends using Indiegogo share tools or share it on twitter or Facebook;
      • Share the link on Linked In;
      • Tell all of your teacher friends that LAMPA is coming; 
      • Let people know who work in human resources where they provide training activities for their employees; 
      • And tell language learners to mention it to their teachers.

      Thank you!

Our own faith in this project's enormous potential is evidenced in the time, effort and resources we have already invested.
From Us to YouWe sincerely thank everyone who makes a contribution of any size! But we would also like you to have a token of our appreciation for helping us out. 

All contributors of $10.00 or more will be listed on the new MyLAMPA.com website. 


All individuals or organizations who help bring LAMPA to life by contributing $50.00 or more will be eligible to link a website to LAMPA's website and receive a certificate of thanks. 




Contributors in the amount of $75.00 - $249.00 will receive stylish limited edition LAMPA apparel and a certificate of thanks.





All those who contribute in excess of $250.00 are major sponsors and will be awarded a Sponsorship Certificate.

In addition to a personalized sponsorship certificate, we would like to offer major sponsors the opportunity to try out LAMPA as a learner in a Skype course. A course would also be a great idea as a unique and meaningful gift to a friend or loved one, or as a company perk. Study English, Spanish, German, Russian, Czech, Polish, Slovak or another subject, provided we can supply a teacher, in the privacy of your own home or office. Of course your learning will be managed using our new system, so you can be directly involved in the piloting - we would be thrilled to have your feedback!




LAMPA on-line school screen shots (www.mylampa.org)

Reach & ImpactConsidering English language teaching alone, the potential is massive. The British Council estimates that there are one billion people learning the English language world-wide. If we are able to reach 0.1% of the teachers and learners only in that market, LAMPA would be helping 1 million people. In addition to the 1 billion English language learners, LAMPA is universal in its appeal for any teacher of any subject. 




A group of teachers mingling at a LAMPA workshop

The peer-to-peer social media nature of the system will allow LAMPA to expand exponentially. Many teachers already use social media services such as Linked In and Facebook, so they are used to this type of medium.  Furthermore, these same teachers and their schools can be reached relatively easily through these same existing social media with targeted campaigns. 



                                         Language teachers testing the system 

 LAMPA is ideal for smaller schools and independent teachers who may have limited technological know-how. LAMPA has been designed to be intuitive and easy to use, so it is not necessary for schools to have an IT administrator on staff - this is a criticism of traditional learning management systems.






Using LAMPA with a group of young language learners

Other Projects CompletedIn addition to the LAMPA modules developed to date, LAMPA Systems, as a company, has also developed a video conferencing/e-learning system (www.virtualni-trida.cz) to facilitate the delivery of language courses to learners who are house-bound, e.g. parents on parental leave and learners with physical limitations that prevent them from attending regular courses. This was a three-year project that finished in 2013. Although it is a separate project, eventually we would like to integrate the materials and technologies developed into the LAMPA platform so that they can be freely accessed by all.



A LAMPA presentation to local teachers
 Risks & Challenges If we fail to meet our deadline with a quality product, we may fail to create the goodwill needed to grow and sustain demand. Of course, the risk of this happening depends on the amount of work we are able to complete before April 2015 - it is a matter of financing.
We know that our core system is solid. If we meet our funding goal, we are confident that the planned new modules can be added successfully to complete the system. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you are interested in our project but are not in a position where you can make a financial contribution, you can still be part of LAMPA.
As you can imagine, a project such as this relies on 'word of mouth'. 



If you are a teacher or a school administrator, let us know you are interested and be part of the piloting;

E-mail this presentation to friends using Indiegogo share tools or share it on twitter or Facebook;
Share the link on Linked In;

Tell all of your teacher friends that LAMPA is coming; 


Let people know who work in human resources where they provide training activities for their employees; 


And tell language learners to mention it to their teachers.


Thank you!

story:
GROM MAGAZINE

 We love the kids and the kids love Grom Magazine. Myself and my partners continue to devote a ton of time and money to keep it going. Even with the few advertisers we have, the mag unfortunately comes well short of paying for itself, which is why we've started this crowd funding campaign. Check out what we are all about and the opportunties we have for national distribution listed below, and please help by contributing. Whether it's $5 or $100, every contribution counts. 

About Grom: 

 Grom Magazine is a one of a kind, exciting new publication that builds kids up in their sport at all levels. Showcasing the top kids in the country and across the globe, as well as the undiscovered kids trying to get noticed. Each issue is filled with exciting photos, informative profiles, contest updates, and all sorts of fun and educational editorials. GROM Surf has definitely found its place amongst the established surf magazines by making an accessible platform for young grom surfers to get the exposure they deserve. Many of the competitive groms today are striving to make it to the pro ranks, but whichever road they choose, free surfer or competitor, every grom is stoked to "make it in the mag".

Here's The Vision:

SURF, SKATE, SNOW, AND MOTO- It is our dream to see all four magazines up and running. We want to see the kids in our community and yours get excited about a mag that they can be a part of, not just wonder what it would be like to actually ever get chance to make his or her debut. Some kids are looking for exposure, some just want to see whats happening. We want to help these groms to be constantly informed about ways to grow in their sport, as well as keeping them captivated by providing quality photos of the top groms doing the most progressive manuevers. GROM Surf has been our primary focus, and has had a great impact on the surf community. It is our goal to be able to help snow, skate and moto groms as well through our other three magazines. With the lack of capital to fund all four, we hope to launch them soon as we build momentum.

Impact on the kids

The reaction from kids when they discover that they really did "make it in the mag" is complete elation and very uplifting for there confidence and self esteem. So far, we have printed volumes 1 through 5 of GROM Surf, and volume 1 of GROM Snow, which has resulted in a ton of stoked groms and their parents following us on our website and FB page. 

How we came to be:

 My name is Curt Hanneman. About 2 years ago I came up with the idea- GROM MAGAZINE, a group of action sports magazines devoted entirely to kids (GROMS) under the age of 18, where kids can "get in the mag" by just emailing their photos to us. Myself and two partners, Paul Smart and Rick Waring have been the driving force behind GROM. The youngest of my 4 kids is Eli, which loves to surf and skate, so we are continuosly going to surf and skate contests where all the little athletes are trying to make a name for themselves in the industry, hoping to one day "get sponsored". If you know much about the mainstream surf magazines, you are well aware that only the top names, maybe 1% at the most will "make the mag" the other 99% of kids in the surfing community would be unsuccessfull at getting their photo in a national publication. GROM has already published over a hundred undiscovered groms in the first 5 issues, as well as capturing epic photos of the top ranked and well sponsored groms.  

 

Where you find GROM Magazine:

  • Printed Magazine: We have been distributing GROM Surf to over 50 surf shops in California, Hawaii, the East Coast, and Puerto Rico.
  • Digital Magazine: available globaly online at: www.grommag.com
  • Website: www.grommagazine.com
  • Facebook: www.facebook/grommagazine

 

Our financial goals:

We currently have the opportunity to work with a national distributer to increase our circulation, (concentrating on GROM Surf for now) and put us on news stands across the nation in places like Barnes and Noble and Longs Drugs. To get advertisers more interested and pay for marketing, printing, and distribution, we need to be able to sustain costs through a few more issues. 

5000 copies  

Printing cost:              $4778.00  per issue            

Production cost:          $2972.00  per issue              

Total cost:                 $7750.00  per issue

Three issues             $23,250.00 

 

The Impact of Your Contribution:

This campaign and the funds that we raise here will greatly impact the future of GROM Magazine! If you would like to see us continue to support this "Grom generation" through this positive influence publication, please donate here and spread the word!  

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can't make a donation to the campaign, you can still help GROM succeed by contributing in other ways. We would love it if you:

Spread the word!  Please forward this campaign on to all friends, colleagues, and family. Let them know how important GROM Magazine is to the community and to the future of surfing kids everywhere. Help us get the word out about this campaign and drum up support!

Join the working group.  We need more people with resources, expertise, and most importantly, energy and time to help out in making this happen. If you can volunteer some time we would love for you to get involved. Contact me at: curt@grommagazine.com

Last but not least we will be listening closely to you: What's your view of GROM Magazine? -- Do you have any suggestions, and how would you like to be involved?

story:
What is Movember?

Mustache November: An opportunity to excuse inexcusable facial hair by virtue of doing so to raise awareness for a good cause.

Our Goal

An Afghan child working on the streets of Afghanistan selling gum, plastic bags, or car fresheners, or merely begging, earns on average $20/month to support his or her family.  For $20/month, we can compensate that family for sending its child to school.

Additionally, Aschiana, our partner charity, helps the child attend school by providing them with food, clothing, stationery, and necessary hygiene supplies.  An adult member of the family is also encouraged to come to the center to participate in instructional programs.

We hope to sponsor 8 children this coming year--at $300/year (which includes administrative costs), our target is $2400.  Any money we raise above this target will be directed to the Aschiana programs facing the greatest need at this time, be it education or healthcare.

Who We Are

We four mustachioed men are working in Kabul, Afghanistan.  We have worked with Aschiana in the past and can vouche personally for their credibility.

Our vital stats and facial hair evolution are as follows:

Marin Susac (second from left): 6'2", 95kg.  In the name of Sean Connery.  With a great mustache comes great responsibility!!!

Farouk Ramji (second from right): 5’9½”, 81kg.  Thin slick handlebars like smooth leather straps....My icon is Ravi Singh.

Nick Pugliese (far right): 5’9¾” 79kgs (1kg less than with a beard).  My scraggly and multi-colored ‘stache is referred to by his friends as Bork in honor of the Swedish Chef.  A shout out as well to the vast majority of the Village People.

Wayne Kennedy (bottom): 6', 90kg.  Lushessly thick with bold handlebars, my mo is called Ron which relates equally to two mustached greats Ron Burgundy and Jeremy. 

To view more Movember pictures, click here.

What is Aschiana?

  • Aschiana provides working street children in Afghanistan with a daily nutritious meal, a basic education, and medical care. Aschiana is based in Kabul but also operates in refugee camps and in five provinces in Afghanistan.
  • Aschiana works with families of children to improve the lives of all members of a family unit.
  • After decades of conflict, some 600,000 Afghan children have been forced onto the streets to earn money for their families. They are too poor to attend school.
  • Aschiana started in 1995 in a single warm room in Kabul, and has operated uninterrupted for 15 years. Under the steady guidance of its head, Engineer Yousef, and resourcefulness of its teachers and social workers, thousands of children have been trained, nourished and mentored.
  • For the first time Aschiana will have a permanent home when it opens a children’s center in Kabul. The center will have a medical clinic, library, classrooms, cafeteria, garden and playground. Funds are needed to furnish the center.
  • A small grass-roots organization trusted for being financially responsible, Aschiana is in a unique position to effectively address the health and educational needs of children often forgotten by others. Aschiana is an Afghan organization staffed entirely by Afghans that relies on generosity of donors in the U.S. and other countries.
  • The Aschiana Foundation in the U.S., a nonprofit organization with a volunteer Board of Directors, is audited annually. With extremely low (less than 3%) administrative costs, the foundation is able to send the funds it raises directly to Aschiana in Kabul.

http://www.aschiana-foundation.org/sponsor-a-child.php 

Other Ways You Can Help

No problem if you can't contribute.  Please do forward our campaign link to a friend or family member!

story:
The fact is there are many teachers and students that are required to use royalty free or public domain music in their projects, lessons, video broadcasts and whatever creative projects they may have.

The problem is that MOST MODERN royalty free music is not very good and hard to find affordably. Also, not all schools are equipped with easy methods to deploy and share media amongst their students.

 

Our project is to expand our current website and develop a multi-seat program that helps teachers, students and anyone else that would gain from an easy to use multi-seat music delivery interface. Also, we are to start a sound effect library. All music and sound effects will be professionally done with awesome royalty free terms to give you creative freedom to use our work in any of your creative productions. Even for commercial use!

 

Features of this multi seat program would be:

  • Auto Login Portal
  • Choice of Open or password protected accounts
  • Easy mass account creation with username and password generation
  • Account management tools (delete, add, edit, modify)
  • Fast immediate downloads
  • Great royalty free music and sound effects!
  • Any other ideas you have ?

 

There are a small handful of reputable royalty free, production and creative common music libraries.  But these other companies are not focused on your project. They have other sub-agendas in order to draw traffic.

 

Our PRIMARY goal is always to provide you great music and sound effects so that you can enhance YOUR creative project with little to no hassles from us. In line with keeping our focus on you, some of the features we want to grow into are:

 

  • Always creating quality and affordable music
  • Full length tracks
  • 1 minute or 30 second edits from the full length tracks (coming soon)
  • 5 to 15 second bumpers/stingers (coming soon)
  • Flawless looping segments (coming soon)

 

Can we do it? Absolutely!! We have 15 years+ experience in music and entertainment technologies. We have 8 years experience in web development. PLUS, we have 6 years of previous experience in this industry of delivering production music online.

 

Check out our video in the gallery for a quick walk through on how we are different from the competition!

 

First, we have to remember the whole point to this. EVERYONE is on a tight budget. Especially school budgets that keep on shrinking.

 

We critically think about every decision and evaluate the most bank for our buck while always focusing on keeping our overhead low. Plus it helps that we have the musical and technical background to do everything in house. Just like recording artists are cutting out the record labels, we are producers cutting the middleman of publishing companies and certain marketing agencies.

 

It is our goal to be so affordable that a teacher or student with whatever income restraints, can afford our music. The stereotypical starving musician and songwriter can afford our music to build from and practice their skills.

 

Also we are not trying to take over any industry. We just want to be a great tool in your tool box for creative production work. When you fix a car or do something in web development, or many other analogies I can think of, there are often more than one set of tools you use. We simply want to be that trusty wrench that is always there for you!

 

As the library grows naturally certain costs will rise and our prices will also slightly rise. But they will always be small, modest and justifiable. (Check out our life time discount club below)

 

 

 We are very excited about our perks and we hope you will be to.

You not only have the opportunity to obtain access to our music, but you have the easy ability to gift our music program to another person and to a SCHOOL!!.

 

 Before we go through the details of our perks let me help make one thing clear.

Standard subscription means our music and sound effects available in MP3 format 192 kbps resolution for a year.

Premium subscription means our music and sound effects available in the same MP3 format as standard, AND broadcast WAV 16bit 44.1khz resolution for a year.

These subscription are for single seat use. The schools and companies will indicate multi-seat use. Also, we may open up to higher resolutions and/or formats but we will cross that bridge when we get to it. Meanwhile we are already recording sound effects at 96khz 24 bit!

 

Check out our video in the gallery to get little more information about our subscriptions.

 

Lets go through details of each perk:

 

  • Personal Email Thank You - We want you to know how appreciative we are for your support!
  • Subscription - It is our number one priority to see this campaign successful. We are offering a discounted price of our standard subscription currently on the website
  • Website Thanks - We will be dedicating a page on our website to display our gratitude. The higher the pledge amount you give, the larger your name will appear on the page. We will list names from highest pledge amounts on top to lowest pledge amounts.
  • Subscription For You & Friend - You will get a standard subscription and you can gift a subscription to anyone else. Give us their email address and we will set them up with their gift subscription.
  • Premium Subscription For You & Friend - Same thing as above, just with the higher file formats available to you.
  • T-Shirt - You will have a choice of 2 or 3 designs and can specify S,M,L,XL. Shipping in the U.S. is already included in pledge. For international we are only intending to ship via USPS and an additional flat rate of $17 will be required.
  • Standard Subscription For School (Or Company)* - You are gifting a 20 seat license for a school or company. We require the school contact information and hopefully a contact person. We will send them correspondence with notification that they are receiving this gift from YOU, and the steps to get started. If you are gifting to a school (with 501c3 status), once they accept this gift, we will then supply a receipt back to you of a 'Quid-Pro-Quo' status. This means the amount of the total pledge minus the perks you personally received are tax deductible. Basically calculating on the portion of the pledge that goes to the school. Please UNDERSTAND we are not your tax advisers and do not warrant nor guarantee tax deduction status.
  • Premium Subscription For School (Or Company)* - Same as above but with the higher file formats available to the users.
  • Name A Track - As we produce the music we will allow you to name a track that is about to be completed in the production cycle. You will get to hear the track before anyone else and supply us suggestions. Names must be free from profanity, free from controversy, and general safe use around children. We will definitely aid in the process and unfortunately have to say that we have final word on appropriateness.
  • Silver Sponsor Recognition - We will supply banner recognition to you or your company on our website for 3 months. Companies MUST be appropriate for display in school environment and banner artwork will be subject for approval.
  • Gold Sponsor Recognition - We will supply banner recognition to you or your company on our website for 6 months. Companies MUST be appropriate for display in school environment and banner artwork will be subject for approval.

 

**Since we have to actually create this multi seat program and will not be able to deliver subscription quickly (February 2013-March 2013)  we will be gifting a subscription that spans 1.5 years so they can complete this school year and for next year.

 

(Tentative Mock Up) Our Company Shirt for pledges $50+

(Tentative Mock Up) Our Premium Company Shirt for pledges $250+
