We simply want to be that trusty wrench that is always there for you!
 
As the library grows naturally certain costs will rise and our prices will also slightly rise. But they will always be small, modest and justifiable. (Check out our life time discount club below)
 
 
 We are very excited about our perks and we hope you will be to.
You not only have the opportunity to obtain access to our music, but you have the easy ability to gift our music program to another person and to a SCHOOL!!.
 
 Before we go through the details of our perks let me help make one thing clear.
Standard subscription means our music and sound effects available in MP3 format 192 kbps resolution for a year.
Premium subscription means our music and sound effects available in the same MP3 format as standard, AND broadcast WAV 16bit 44.1khz resolution for a year.
These subscription are for single seat use. The schools and companies will indicate multi-seat use. Also, we may open up to higher resolutions and/or formats but we will cross that bridge when we get to it. Meanwhile we are already recording sound effects at 96khz 24 bit!
 
Check out our video in the gallery to get little more information about our subscriptions.
 
Lets go through details of each perk:
 


Personal Email Thank You - We want you to know how appreciative we are for your support!

Subscription - It is our number one priority to see this campaign successful. We are offering a discounted price of our standard subscription currently on the website

Website Thanks - We will be dedicating a page on our website to display our gratitude. The higher the pledge amount you give, the larger your name will appear on the page. We will list names from highest pledge amounts on top to lowest pledge amounts.

Subscription For You & Friend - You will get a standard subscription and you can gift a subscription to anyone else. Give us their email address and we will set them up with their gift subscription.

Premium Subscription For You & Friend - Same thing as above, just with the higher file formats available to you.

T-Shirt - You will have a choice of 2 or 3 designs and can specify S,M,L,XL. Shipping in the U.S. is already included in pledge. For international we are only intending to ship via USPS and an additional flat rate of $17 will be required.

Standard Subscription For School (Or Company)* - You are gifting a 20 seat license for a school or company. We require the school contact information and hopefully a contact person. We will send them correspondence with notification that they are receiving this gift from YOU, and the steps to get started. If you are gifting to a school (with 501c3 status), once they accept this gift, we will then supply a receipt back to you of a 'Quid-Pro-Quo' status. This means the amount of the total pledge minus the perks you personally received are tax deductible. Basically calculating on the portion of the pledge that goes to the school. Please UNDERSTAND we are not your tax advisers and do not warrant nor guarantee tax deduction status.

Premium Subscription For School (Or Company)* - Same as above but with the higher file formats available to the users.

Name A Track - As we produce the music we will allow you to name a track that is about to be completed in the production cycle. You will get to hear the track before anyone else and supply us suggestions. Names must be free from profanity, free from controversy, and general safe use around children. We will definitely aid in the process and unfortunately have to say that we have final word on appropriateness.

Silver Sponsor Recognition - We will supply banner recognition to you or your company on our website for 3 months. Companies MUST be appropriate for display in school environment and banner artwork will be subject for approval.

Gold Sponsor Recognition - We will supply banner recognition to you or your company on our website for 6 months. Companies MUST be appropriate for display in school environment and banner artwork will be subject for approval.
 
**Since we have to actually create this multi seat program and will not be able to deliver subscription quickly (February 2013-March 2013)  we will be gifting a subscription that spans 1.5 years so they can complete this school year and for next year.
 
(Tentative Mock Up) Our Company Shirt for pledges $50+

(Tentative Mock Up) Our Premium Company Shirt for pledges $250+

story:
Short Summary

Code-X International is a non-profit organization based in the Netherlands, but our impact is global. Since 2004 we have sent hundreds of youth volunteers to projects in Asia, Africa, South and Central America to work with deprived children.

Our aim is to impact our youth volunteers by providing them with a way to develop new skills as well as a great intercultural experience, while at the same time providing positive academic and personal development of children in some of the most deprived nations in the world. By contributing to this campaign, you make it possible for us to provide these services free of charge to not only the youth volunteers, but also the organizations, children’s centres, schools and orphanages in which they are placed.

Within the Foundation 4 Future Inclusion Project, South Africa, Code-x is supporting the creation of new primary and secondary schools on the outskirts of Johannesburg, where education opportunity are few and far in between. The children and youth have little hope of a brighter future without the academic tools to change their lives. By sending our volunteers and other materials, we hope to encourage academic excellence and allow these deprived children the opportunity to improve their lives and communities.

 

So Why Donate? Well, your contribution will help to provide:

-volunteers to help build and establish new primary & secondary school on outskirts of Johannesburg

-educational material for the new school

-personal materials for children, such as lunch and extracurricular activities

-and most importantly, a brighter future for the children of Johannesburg!

 

Our volunteer depart on 1 April 2013, so we have only months left to raise funding for this project. By donating now you will contribute to global activism, as well as creating educational opportunities for children within this poor African nation. You can also receive great gifts that help to show your support and contribution to this project.

So donate now and show your commitment to education for all!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Melinda and my husband is Tom. We were married on April 2004.  We met, dated, got engaged, married like any other couple.  The next step having a family never happened, because I can not have kids. 

I have Primary Premature Ovarian Failure.  In short, my ovaries have no eggs.  I have had this since I was a teen and the only way I could ever have a baby is with Donor Egg and IVF or adoption. IVF will cost about $30,000 adoption costs $52,000. I would be happy with either option.  We just want a child.  I have insurance but it will not cover fertility treatment.  We are foster parents but after 16 months of having a beautiful little girl she had to leave to live with relatives and the room that was fit for a princess is now empty complete with everything but, a baby and we have a heavy heart. 

We want a chance to have a forever child that we can watch grow up.  We want to be a mommy and daddy. Look at your child or children, they are truely a blessing.  Could you imagine a life without them? Many people say they are the most important thing in their life.  Simpily we want a chance to have that too.  I know it sounds simple but, for us its a dream that we can not make a reality without asking for the help of others. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Anything over that would go to another couple that has wanted the same as us for a long time. Maybe give another family hope as well or used to help fund programs in the community that focus on youth and children.

The Impact

What impact did your kids have on you?  If you have kids you know the joys of being a parent. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know times are hard and any amount would help us get one step closer. If you cant help maybe you know someone who could?  Thank you for taking the time to read this and please keep us in your prayers.

story:
Problems watching Intro Video? Click here to use youtube!

Short Summary

Hi, Welcome to the E-Lustrate Tutor Project!

I have been teaching for several American universities for more than 30 years. I have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a Master of Science degree in Management Information Systems, and a Doctoral degree in Instructional Technology and Distance Education.

After years of teaching at a distance, and designing and creating instructional multimedia for online classes, I realized that effective tools to teach and create lessons or presentations for online environments are a real necessity.  Certainly, tools to create presentations are available, but none or few of them were originally designed for distance teaching or learning. Moreover, most tools are simply too expensive for a single teacher to afford!

This realization was the beginning of the E-Lustrate Tutor project.  We have been working in this project for the past three years.




This campaign is aimed to raise funds to finish the development of E-Lustrate Tutor: A convenient set of tools for creating engaging multimedia presentations for online learning This set of tools WILL BE FREE FOR EVERYONE who wants to teach or train at a distance.

General Structure


Initial Game Skins... more to come!


What We Need 

E-Lustrate Tutor is a set of tools which are approximately 70% of final stage. This campaign will help the final development and support of E-Lustrate Tutor. 

After the initial development of the software, there will be more efforts not only to support the platform but also to constantly improve and develop of more options and game skins (templates).

Any funds collected will be invested in the development of E-Lustrate Tutor. The goal is to raise funds to finish the initial development by next year. If less than expected is raised, it will take more time to finish the software tools... but IT WILL BE FINISHED!

Recommended Workforce needed:

  • One Junior Computer Programmer.
  • One Senior Computer Programmer.
  • One Assistant (marketing).
  • One General Manager / Coordinator.

Note: Office Spaces will also be required to have comfortable working environment for Research & Development.

Watch the Full Estimated Three-Year Financial projections here.


What You Get

There are different ways you can contribute by selecting a Perk of your choice. Your contribution will allow anyone who wants to teach or train at a distance to:

  •  Contribute to have a better "educated" world.
  •  Have access to rapid development educational contents and distribution set of tools.
  •  Create "Knowledge Networks" around a set of lessons or presentations.
  •  Easily add gaming  as a teaching - learning strategy.
  •  Get usability and analytic data about the lessons or presentations.
  •  Get paid for teaching what you already know.
  •  Have a free tool to develop and charge for lessons or presentations.

    The Impact

      The relationship between education and economic growth is a fact. Additionally, there is a great need for tools that facilitate the creation and distribution of educational contents and that support sustainable learning networks. There are great benefits for everyone involved: students, teachers,  instructional designers and whoever wants to teach and get compensated.

      The knowledge and e-learning industries, as well as online learning offerings in higher education and K-12, are constantly growing in the United States and globally. These large sectors are potential target markets for a tool like E-Lustrate Tutor.  

       There is actually a huge market in the educational area with, 7.2 million teachers only in the United States and more than 78 million in the world. These numbers do not include instructional designers or simple people who have something they can teach.

      For example, the elearning industry, according to GSV Asset Management (2012), is expected to growth 15% in the next few years in the United State and globally a 23%. The Knowledge or Educational industry sector, is expected to growth over the next decade.

      The bottom line is that there is a real need for  affordable and effective tools to create and distribute engaging multimedia for teaching and learning.  E-Lustare would be an attractive option to fill such a gap: It will be free for anyone to create lessons or presentations!

      Risks & Challenges

      In any entrepreneurial endeavor, there are risks and challenges that pertain to the characteristics of the business itself. 

      E-Lustrate tools are software applications and, as such, developing them entails the investment of significant time and effort in computer programming and markting. Hence, all possible resources and hard work would be invested in computer programming and advertising in order to finalize the product.

      Some  main modules are almost fully developed. Thus, it is unlikely that anything can go "wrong" while finalizing the product.   

      Following, there are some videos about E-Lustrate Tutor. They are long videos but they describe the "basics" of the tools and project involved:


      Other Ways You Can Help

      • Spread the word via email, social media and word of mouth! 
      • Help us recruit more people to know about E-Lustrate Tutor!
      • Let us know what you think would be needed to improve our knowledge network and educational software tools.

anything can go "wrong" while finalizing the product.

story:
Jew in the City recently named these ten people as the 2014 Orthodox Jewish All Stars. The Orthodox Jewish community is often mentioned in the media for doing bad things, yet we rarely hear about the Orthodox Jews who are good, productive members of society. So we have collected these exceptional individuals to help change that narrative. We want the world to know that there are amazing religious Jews who have reached the pinnacle of success professionally while staying true to their Jewish heritage. We want to get the message out there that being an observant Jew doesn't mean a person has no career options. Help sponsor this event so that it can be a memorable night!

What We Need & What You Get

We're putting together an amazing red carpet event with All Stars, press, an open wine bar, music, and delicious Chanukah themed foods and desserts and a movie premiere.

This Jew in the City "Orthodox Jewish All Stars" Indiegogo campaign is partnering with and being fiscally sponsored by Jewish Links Inc., a 501(c)(3) non-profit arts service organization. Contributions are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

The Impact

This event is our chance for the year to create lot of buzz in the media and among our fans as to what we're accomplishing. Jew in the City is changing lives all around the world as Jews of all backgrounds and non-Jews interact with our content, become inspired and have a new view of the Orthodox Jewish world. Check out these testimonials to see what we mean.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't give, please let people know about Jew in the City and share our content with your family and friends and help us rebrand Orthodox Jews and Judaism to the world.

story:
Set Free Global Summit

Please help me get to the Set Free Summit, April 4-7, 2016

I talk about sex, love and relationships all the time, but the most painful conversations are with women who have just found out their husband or son is addicted to porn.  They are the most heart-wrenching because 90% of the time, if they are calling ME, it usually means they are church-goers who heard my talk and thought, "Yeah, we got this.  We are insulated from all that."

I am Karen Kropf, a founding director of the non-profit Positively Waiting!  We have been challenging communities to discover the benefits of sexual self-control, since 1998.  

I'm the "Visual Aid."  A Real Life portrait of the permanent consequences of non-marital sex... I aborted the only baby I would ever have, and fell in love with a man infected with Herpes, although he never failed to use a condom.  My husband and I share our story in classrooms and at youth events to illustrate that getting to "happily faithfully in love forever" requires being counter-cultural. 

In particular when it comes to thinking "Porn is harmless."

The children we care so passionately about are NOT OURS --  they are someone else's kids.  Maybe they're yours.  Maybe we're talking to your future son- or daughter-in-law.  Maybe they will be your employee, or the kid who looks after your dog when you're on vacation.  

The number of requests for help to undo the damage from pornography has been increasing at the speed of light.  I have some skills, but I want to be sure I have The Most Effective Ones.  That's where I need your help --- I have a chance to get equipped from top experts at The Set Free Global Conference in Greensboro, NC April 4-7, 2016.

I'm convinced, as a society, we HAVE to find better ways to prepare kids for a porn-filled world. We HAVE to give them a fighting chance to experience Happily Faithfully In Love Forever, with great sex.  I am willing to go, to fight, to persuade, to plead and to challenge -- probably where you would never go, to say what you could never say.  But I cannot go to THIS conference without financial help.  

Its only a few weeks away!  I need to raise $2,200.00 for airfare, accommodations and registration FAST.  If you can help me get there, I would be very grateful.  

  • Airfare from LAX to Greensboro, NC is $750.00
  • Special hotel rate at the conference site for 5 days is $725.00
  • Conference Registration is $479.00
  • (A bonus $200-300 would get me Educational material I can use afterward)

Why send ME?  What's in it for you?

If you send me, I will come back and teach YOU what I learned.  

If we raise the funds (in time for me to attend), Positively Waiting will host a presentation this summer where I can pass on what I learn to parents, teachers and church leaders.  If you donate, share, plug or promote this project, you (or someone you designate) will get FREE resource materials PLUS free admission at the follow-up lecture.

The conference is just a few weeks away -- so if you can help even a little -- I will come back better equipped to serve your kids.

story:
This September, over a year ahead of schedule, we moved into the location of our future writing center in downtown Oakland, but in order to fill this space with kids, we need your help. 

We're raising $50,000 to make necessary building improvements, plus buy equipment, furniture, computers, and books for our writing and reading sanctuary. This money will also to help us pay teaching artists and program staff to run writing and bookmaking programs in our first year here at 2301 Telegraph.

Photo credit, Slow Clap Productions

Why We're Here

We believe that every Oakland student deserves to excel in literacy and writing. Reading proficiency by third grade is the most important predictor of high-school graduation and career success. In Oakland: 


About Us

Photo credit, Shelby Ashbaugh

Chapter 510 is an 826-inspired, volunteer-powered organization that provides in-school tutoring, creative and expository writing workshops, and publishing opportunities for K-12 students in Oakland.


This September, we found our permanent space at 2301 Telegraph in downtown Oakland, bringing us closer to our vision of building a writing center and community space to serve as a dynamic resource for all students, families, teachers, and volunteers. 

We've got the space. Now we need your help in raising $50,000 to bring in the programming and resources necessary to transform it into an inspiring and inclusive space for Oakland youth.

How Your Support Will Help

Have you ever tried to write a thrilling story about killer robots without paper or a computer? Or learned to love reading without a library full of books to choose from?

Our vision for Chapter 510's writing center is as an inclusive space constantly buzzing with creative inspiration, where students come after school to receive personalized tutoring and where field trippers get so fired up about the books they created in our writing workshops that they run joyous laps round and around their classrooms once they get back to school.

Photo credit, Slow Clap Productions

Jade, MetWest High School student: "When I walked into Chapter 510's new building, I told them they had to open their writing center right away. You should donate to them because it will help give kids like me have a place to go after school to become a better writer."


Your $50,000 will be used in the following ways:

1. Construction: We need $10,000 to make needed improvements to our writing center in January and February, including new floors and ceilings.

2. Equipment: $12,000 will go towards acquiring computers for 35 students; mic + PA for readings; and book-making, printing, and binding equipment.

3. Furniture and fixtures: In order to seat all our young writers during our after-school tutoring, writing and bookmaking workshops, and student reading events, we need $8,000 for tables, chairs, shelves, and light fixtures. 

3. Supplies and books: Another $6,000 will go buy journals, pens, paper, books for our reading library, and many, many after-school snacks (don't ever try to tutor a hungry anybody!).

4. Teaching artists and staff: In order to add programming to our center, and maintain programming with our partner schools, we're asking our community for $14,000 to pay for program staff, including our teaching artists and bookmaker in residence who will help us set up and start programming in our new building

Where We're Going Beyond this Campaign (Two-Year Plan) 

In September, we signed a five year lease with architects Erik Bloom and Todd Bennett of Parcel Projects, and we'll be working in close partnership with them over the next two years to transform our space into a student-led writing and making ecosystem. 

Students will have multiple access points, from reading in our student-curated library, writing with volunteer tutors and teaching artists, bookmaking with professional equipment and supplies, and, for older students, designing and publishing student books to be sold in our retail space and in bookstores throughout Oakland. 

Your support will ensure that Chapter 510, in partnership with OUSD and the Oakland Public Library, continues to act as a catalyst for change in addressing literacy issues in Oakland. 


Wendy Donner, Abundance Foundation: "I give because Chapter 510 is a thoughtful, inspiring community of amazing people. Thank you for all that you have done and continue to do to bring 510 to youth in Oakland!"

What Your Donation Gets You

Not only do you get the joy and satisfaction that comes from knowing you helped youth literacy in Oakland, your donation will also get you a variety of amazing and fantastical rewards.
If you live in the Bay Area, you can stop by the Department of Make Believe in downtown Oakland to donate, pick up your perks, claim your high fives, purchase any other items sold in our center of magical bureaucracy, or just meet us and check out our organization in person. Stop by 2301 Telegraph Ave. today - we've got a stack of fantastical paperwork with your name all over it. 


Photo credit, Slow Clap Productions; art by Rob Trujillo; design by Bookish Designs

Design by E.M. Wolfman Home Repair



Design by E.M. Wolfman Home Repair




Art by Rob Trujillo

Art by Thailan When 

Other Ways You Can Help

Here are other ways you can help us in our mission to support young Oakland writers: 

 - Click the Facebook and Twitter buttons in the upper left to share our campaign. It's free and easy and really does make a difference! Use our hashtag: #MakeBelieveOakland

 - Use other social media outlets? Share our campaign on all of them:  Facebook and Twitter (again), but also Instagram, blogs, emails, secret messages, telepathy, notes in bottles, etc. Get the word out! Here's a link to our campaign page that you can copy, paste, and share: bit.ly/Chapter510Indiegogo 

 - Sign up for our newsletter, follow us on Twitter (@chptr510), and like our Facebook page. 

Keep checking the campaign page. We’ll continue to add updates and new perks, so stay tuned! If you want to contact us with a question or a weird dream you just had, email us at: marya_brennan@chapter510.org. 

Credits

We could not have, in a million-billion years, launched this campaign without:

Crazy-amazing design from E.M. Wolfman Home Repair. Gorgeous video by Slow Clap Productions. Our talented and generous artists Robert Trujillo, Thailan When, Pickypocket Press, and B.Spoke Tailor. Printers Green Copy and Bloom. 

Our Campaign Manager Marya Brennan, and radical youth interns Jade and Kayla.  

And RedBull. And Cheetos. And all our amazing young writers who inspire us to do this insane and wonderful work each and everyday. It's so worth it.

This September, over a year ahead of schedule, we moved into the location of our future writing center in downtown Oakland, but in order to fill this space with kids, we need your help. We're raising $50,000 to make necessary building improvements, plus buy equipment, furniture, computers, and books for our writing and reading sanctuary. This money will also to help us pay teaching artists and program staff to run writing and bookmaking programs in our first year here at 2301 Telegraph.Photo credit, Slow Clap Productions
Why We're Here
We believe that every Oakland student deserves to excel in literacy and writing. Reading proficiency by third grade is the most important predictor of high-school graduation and career success. In Oakland: 
About Us




Photo credit, Shelby Ashbaugh
Chapter 510 is an 826-inspired, volunteer-powered organization that provides in-school tutoring,
creative and expository writing workshops, and publishing opportunities for
K-12 students in Oakland.This September, we found our permanent space at 2301 Telegraph in downtown Oakland, bringing us closer to our vision of building a writing center and community space to serve as a dynamic resource for all students, families, teachers, and volunteers. We've got the space. Now we need your help in raising $50,000 to bring in the programming and resources necessary to transform it into an inspiring and inclusive space for Oakland youth.How
Your Support Will HelpHave you ever tried to write a thrilling story about killer robots without paper or a computer? Or learned to love reading without a library full of books to choose from? Our vision for Chapter 510's writing center is as an inclusive space constantly buzzing with creative inspiration, where students come after school to receive personalized tutoring and where field trippers get so fired up about the books they created in our writing workshops that they run joyous laps round and around their classrooms once they get back to school.

story:
Who are we?

 

Hello everyone,

We are a group of young enthusiasts from Serbia,who want their ideas and projects to change the way of thinking in humans and show how are a healthy environment and the nature important things for human.I am Dragoljub Milankov.Our team is currently small, but day by day it's becoming bigger,and our ideas are becoming more serious.Our hobby, like our projects, are based on making interesting things,so-called pieces of art,out of materials which man thinks are useless and throws them away in nature,making it polluted.

What is recycling?

Recycling is the process of converting waste materials into reusable materials and objects.It is an alternative to "conventional" waste disposal that can save material and help lower greenhouse gas emissions (compared to plastic production,for example).Recycling can prevent the waste of potentially useful materials and reduce the consumption of fresh raw materials, thereby reducing: energy usage,air pollution (from incineration) and water pollution (from landfilling).In the strictest sense,recycling of a material would produce a fresh supply of the same material—for example,used office paper would be converted into new office paper,or used polystyrene foam into new polystyrene.However,this is often difficult or too expensive (compared with producing the same product from raw materials or other sources),so "recycling" of many products or materials involves their reuse in producing different materials (for example,paperboard) instead.Another form of recycling is the salvage of certain materials from complex products,either due to their intrinsic value (such as lead from car batteries,or gold from circuit boards),or due to their hazardous nature (e.g., removal and reuse of mercury from thermometers and thermostats).

 

Why is that important?!

 

Our project

If a man cannot find more applications of a material, then the material becomes useless to him, and he tries to get rid of it,in this case,without thinking, he throws it into the nature (rivers, oceans, forests).Think about it,when you buy juice or some other drink,you drink the content of the bottle and throw it away,without thinkg you could use it elsewhere.In this case,you can apply them on your  own ship construction and with a very small investment you can enjoy the charms of rivers,seas, nature in general.However, the ship is not the only product we can produce out of plastic and glass bottles.There is a range of products that we will Introduce to you, as, for example,flower pots, lamps, car garages, various containers and even the house in which will be enjoyable to live.These products are so well done that you won't believe they were made from bottles.Because we need to produce plastic bottles of all products, we will start collecting bottles from rivers,seas,oceans,forests, nature in general and in this way we will gradually reduce the pollution of these surfaces.So this project and these products are not only important for us,but for the whole community and the world.We are ready to produce the following interesting things:

1.Vertical Garden

2.Rethink Hanger Repurposes Plastic Bottles

3.Chandelier

4.Spoon Lamp

5.Cherry Blossom Paint Stamp

6.Parking Canopy

7.Christmas Tree

8.Cute Planters

9.Durable Purse

10.Lake Boat

And many other products...

Do you know for this?Some people live in houses made of bottles

Finances

For the final realization of the project we need $ 3.000.This money will be used for production these things and we pay delivery to your home address!!!

Does we have experience in this?

Yes of course,we have much experience in this.We have a good team,good people and we are ready to produce anything for you.A satisfied customer is the greatest gift for us.If we had some problems with the production of your orders you have the right to get your money back.

10 STARTLING FACTS ABOUT BOTTLED WATER

1.)   Only 1 in 5 plastic bottles are recycled

2.)   Americans consume over 8.6 billion gallons of bottled water

3.)   Most tap water is more heavily tested and regulated than bottled water

4.)   Plastic water bottles can take between 400 and 1,000 years to decompose

5.)   It requires 3 times the amount of water to produce a plastic bottle than it does to fill it

6.)   Bottled water costs over 1,000+ times more than tap water

7.)    Last year, the average American used 167 water bottles, but only recycled 38

8.)   In many taste tests, tap water was preferred over bottled water

9.)   The NRDC conducted a comprehensive four-year scientific study of 1,000 brands of bottled water. The results showed that one third of the bottled waters violated their own industry standards for water quality

10.)  It takes 17 million barrels of oil to produce plastic bottles yearly. This could fuel 1 million cars for a year

RECYCLING IS MY CHOICE!

THANK YOU FRO SUPPORT!

story:
Short Summary

Tunetown IS NOT a charity or non profit!  We are just trying to raise money and organize a way to keep this Glee Club program alive!

Tunetown was shocked when we found out about the Youth Companion Program funding was cut.  This allowed the  Radius Summer Glee Club to exist!

The Saskatchewan Provincial Government claims that the program was redundant as there were others similar to it already receiving funding in the city.

This can not happen Saskatoon and Saskatchewan!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise $5000 to save the Glee Club!
  • We need to raise $10000 to save the Glee Club and to Film and Record the next Tunetown music video with the Glee Club
  • We need to raise $20000 to save the Glee Club and to Film and Record the next Tunetown music video with the Glee Club and to have $10000 of advertisement with the Starphenix so we can gwt the video advertise to over 300000 people in Saskatchewan!

The Impact

The Radius Glee Club was a program that offered young adults with cognitive disabilities an opportunity to sing and learn dance routines during the summer. 

Each day of the program provides the participants of the Glee Club with vital opportunities to interact with their peers over the summer months and provides their parents and caregivers much needed respite. 

Tune town creates music and videos that raise awareness and funds for local causes. Tune town started with the creation of its first Halloween video to the song Monster Mash/Gangnam Style with students from Bethlehem High school.  With the help of Wiegers Financial and Benefits, Tunetown quickly grew into a Saskatoon organization that supports and showcases people with disabilities as well as local musicians.


Other Ways You Can Help


if you are not comfortable with donating online or have other ways  to help the Glee Club.  Please contact Jesse Weiman at jesseweiman@me.com

story:
Advisors Unclassified (www.advisorsunclassified.com)

Our Story

We are creating a website where grad students can come together and discuss advisors anonymously in the hope to help prospective grad student. We are currently enrolled in PhD programs. In our experience, the largest determining factor of success (& personal happiness) in grad school is your advisor. On average, a grad student in a PhD program spends 5-7 years with his/her advisor. Thus, everything about your advisor (e.g. working style, demeanor etc) directly affects your daily life. Unfortunately, for prospective grad students, getting a true picture of an advisor is difficult if not impossible. Current grad students almost never tell the complete story for fear or repercussions (we’ve been guilty of this). We want our site to solve this!


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $1000 to cover our website set-up and hosting costs (~50%). In addition some money (~25%) will be used for marketing in university papers, and the remaining money will be used to hire a graphic designer to help us with some of the site graphics.


Everything helps, even $1. For your donation, you will receive:  


  • $5+: Exclusive updates of how the website is progressing-including photo snapshots from the site as it's being built! You can also choose to be listed on our donor page.

  • $10+: You will receive an honorary bachelor’s degree (your choice of B.A. or B.S) from Advisors Unclassified University. You can also choose to be listed on our donor page.


  • $25+: You will receive an honorary masters’s degree (your choice of M.A. or M.S) from Advisors Unclassified University. You can also choose to be listed on our donor page.


  • $50+: You will receive an honorary Ph.D. from Advisors Unclassified University. You can also choose to be listed on our donor page.


  • $100+: Tenured position at AUU + Copy of PhD Comics. You will be given a tenured professorship at Advisors Unclassified University. In addition, you will also receive a copy of PhD Comics by Jorge Cham. You can also choose to be listed on our donor page.


Other Ways You Can Help

Send this page to your friends and like us on facebook!

story:
WHAT IS SAALY

SAALY is an educational outreach program authored by Cheryl Maletta Trujillo of Zanbeel Art, a South Asian cultural resource for Visual Art, Literature, Film and Music. The program strives to build bridges between the U.S and South Asia via art classes and art exchanges in low income schools in both countries.

SAALY'S FIRST PROJECT

The global budget crisis led to cutbacks in school art programs all over the world. In 2011, Zanbeel Art launched a program called "South Asian Art Literacy for Youth" (SAALY).

Geared to tackle this problem head on, SAALY made its debut in October 2011 with its pilot at The Watts Elementary School in South Los Angeles.

An underprivileged school district, many students at this elementary school never had the opportunity to take art classes previously and knew virtually nothing about the South Asian region. Zanbeel Art handpicked accomplished artists to teach weekly art classes to the 5th grade on topics including portraits, sculpture, calligraphy, photography, endangered species, and herb planting.

The artists/teachers utilized creative tools such as visual projections, maps, and various art materials to help the students build essential critical thinking skills and an ability to see the world from a new perspective. Teachers worked closely with students to help transform negative thoughts and assumptions they may have about South Asia into a deeper understanding, empathy, and mutual respect for the region and its people. 

The purpose of the classes was to trigger a nine-week intellectual transformation of the students by expanding their understanding of the idea of culture and encouraging them to become citizens of the world. Activities were focused on developing skills needed to live and work effectively in culturally and politically diverse societies.

Each class closely followed Los Angeles public school guidelines in areas such as Social Studies and Geography, and incorporated K-12 education standards which will be in affect in 2013. All classes were designed in 2010 by Zanbeel board member and education expert Cheryl Maletta Trujillo of California State University, Dominguez Hills.

CONTINUING SAALY PROJECTS

SAALY 2011 was so successful that The Watts Elementary School invited Zanbeel Art back to implement SAALY 2012. Although the core of the program will remain the same, 6 additional classes will be added to the original 9 session curriculum in order to incorporate a creative exchange with students from similar socioeconomic backgrounds in Pakistan, where the students will be encouraged to share commonalities and embrace differences. The Pakistani side of it will be handled by The Citizens Archive of Pakistan.

IMPACT

Students who participated in SAALY 2011 saw a significant jump in their grades, confidence, and understanding of the South Asian region.

The program this year will include a creative exchange between students in Los Angeles, CA and Karachi, Pakistan with the intention of fostering a better understanding among our youth for a more tolerant, peaceful future. During SAALY 2012 we will be collecting rubric at regular intervals throughout the process, with additional surveys designed by our Pakistani counterparts to specifically assess the results of the exchange. The data will be quantified into a final report to assess it's impact on students in both countries. 

WHAT WE NEED

Zanbeel Art has worked hard to minimize the costs of this project. We are fortunate to be surrounded by a wonderful community of volunteers and teachers who are decidated to this project and are donating their time and efforts free of charge. However, we do need money to underwrite the costs of the art supplies, lunch and transport costs for our amazing teachers, courier costs for students in the U.S and Pakistan to exchange creative projects, and a small stipend for the artists who will be taking out precious time to work with the school in conducting these workshops.

All in all, we can implement this amazing project for a total of just $4200, and we are grateful for your support in helping us build bridges for a better future. However small your monetary contribution may be (even if you can only spare a few dollars), it will signify your commitment to peace and education, and will enable us to implement this project. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We understand that not everyone is in a position to make a monetary contribution. You can still help us by offering to volunteer, spreading the word, making some noise about our campaign using the IndieGoGo share tools on your social media sites!

ABOUT ZANBEEL ART

Zanbeel Art is a South Asian cultural resource for Visual Art, Literature, Film and Music. Zanbeel Art's vision is to provide exposure to established and emerging South Asian artists, and to enrich and inspire students in low socio economic regions in the US and South Asia via art related educational outreach programs.

WHAT IS SAALY
SAALY is an educational outreach program authored by Cheryl Maletta Trujillo of Zanbeel Art, a South Asian cultural resource for Visual Art, Literature, Film and Music. The program strives to build bridges between the U.S and South Asia via art classes and art exchanges in low income schools in both countries.
SAALY'S FIRST PROJECT
The global budget crisis led to cutbacks in school art programs all over the world. In 2011, Zanbeel Art launched a program called "South Asian Art Literacy for Youth" (SAALY).
Geared to tackle this problem head on, SAALY made its debut in October 2011 with its pilot at The Watts Elementary School in South Los Angeles.
An underprivileged school district, many students at this elementary school never had the opportunity to take art classes previously and knew virtually nothing about the South Asian region. Zanbeel Art handpicked accomplished artists to teach weekly art classes to the 5th grade on topics including portraits, sculpture, calligraphy, photography, endangered species, and herb planting.
The artists/teachers utilized creative tools such as visual projections, maps, and various art materials to help the students build essential critical thinking skills and an ability to see the world from a new perspective. Teachers worked closely with students to help transform negative thoughts and assumptions they may have about South Asia into a deeper understanding, empathy, and mutual respect for the region and its people. 
The purpose of the classes was to trigger a nine-week intellectual transformation of the students by expanding their understanding of the idea of culture and encouraging them to become citizens of the world. Activities were focused on developing skills needed to live and work effectively in culturally and politically diverse societies.
Each class closely followed Los Angeles public school guidelines in areas such as Social Studies and Geography, and incorporated K-12 education standards which will be in affect in 2013. All classes were designed in 2010 by Zanbeel board member and education expert Cheryl Maletta Trujillo of California State University, Dominguez Hills.
CONTINUING SAALY PROJECTS
SAALY 2011 was so successful that The Watts Elementary School invited Zanbeel Art back to implement SAALY 2012. Although the core of the program will remain the same, 6 additional classes will be added to the original 9 session curriculum in order to incorporate a creative exchange with students from similar socioeconomic backgrounds in Pakistan, where the students will be encouraged to share commonalities and embrace differences. The Pakistani side of it will be handled by The Citizens Archive of Pakistan.
IMPACT
Students who participated in SAALY 2011 saw a significant jump in their grades, confidence, and understanding of the South Asian region.
The program this year will include a creative exchange between students in Los Angeles, CA and Karachi, Pakistan with the intention of fostering a better understanding among our youth for a more tolerant, peaceful future. During SAALY 2012 we will be collecting rubric at regular intervals throughout the process, with additional surveys designed by our Pakistani counterparts to specifically assess the results of the exchange. The data will be quantified into a final report to assess it's impact on students in both countries. 
WHAT WE NEED
Zanbeel Art has worked hard to minimize the costs of this project. We are fortunate to be surrounded by a wonderful community of volunteers and teachers who are decidated to this project and are donating their time and efforts free of charge. However, we do need money to underwrite the costs of the art supplies, lunch and transport costs for our amazing teachers, courier costs for students in the U.S and Pakistan to exchange creative projects, and a small stipend for the artists who will be taking out precious time to work with the school in conducting these workshops.
All in all, we can implement this amazing project for a total of just $4200, and we are grateful for your support in helping us build bridges for a better future. However small your monetary contribution may be (even if you can only spare a few dollars), it will signify your commitment to peace and education, and will enable us to implement this project. 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
We understand that not everyone is in a position to make a monetary contribution. You can still help us by offering to volunteer, spreading the word, making some noise about our campaign using the IndieGoGo share tools on your social media sites!
ABOUT ZANBEEL ART
Zanbeel Art is a South Asian cultural resource for Visual Art, Literature, Film and Music. Zanbeel Art's vision is to provide exposure to established and emerging South Asian artists, and to enrich and inspire students in low socio economic regions in the US and South Asia via art related educational outreach programs.

story:
Mr. Mark Davison: Teacher, Friend, Role Model.

 

Last October a friend and colleague of ours became extremely ill. Mr. Mark Davison, a Social Studies Teacher at Iroquois High School, was diagnosed with Pulmonary Fibrosis and several other serious conditions of his lungs. He was in a coma for close to eight weeks, and hospitalized for over ten months. His condition has resulted in placement upon a list at the Cleveland Clinic to receive a lung transplant. Needless to say, Mark has accumulated significant medical and personal expenses throughout his ordeal.

 

Mark is a revered and selfless individual and teacher who is well respected throughout the community. Time after time, he has given his own personal time freely to create a learning environment which allows students to excel. Likewise, his devotion to the students is found in his involvement in numerous extracurricular activities including taking students to Europe for the past seven years, and Gettysburg for over fifteen years. His influence and inspiration has been acknowledged by his students throughout his twenty year career in education.

 

It is our goal to assist Mark in any way possible. Through a financial fundraising campaign, we are hoping to help Mark offset some of the mounting medical and personal expenses brought on by this unfortunate illness. Thus, we have developed an aggressive fundraising campaign to assist Mark and his wife, Carol. Any help that you, your business or your organization can afford Mark will be greatly appreciated. Mark and Carol thank you in advance for any assistance you or your group can offer. Mark has given so much of himself in his teaching career, and we are hoping to find some way to give back to him during his time of need.  Your generosity is greatly appreciated. Thank you for your time and consideration.

story:
Our Opportunity: Food Access at Temple University

  • Our market research showed that 86% of Temple Students are unsatisfied with the food offerings on campus 
  • We launched our "Real Food Campaign" in 2014 to see what "real food" meant to students 
  • The answer was clear- real food is not readily accessible on Temple's campus...unless pizza, french fries and chicken fingers are what you consider to be real food

Who We Are

We are a group of students dedicated to provide ethical, organic, and sustainable food options.  We'll have a co-op café on Temple University's campus.  Silmultaneously, our sourcing policy aims to sustain the greater Philadelphia local economy.

  • Students get a hands on educational experience running a business
  • Connects students across all schools: business, communications, film, geography and urban studies, engineering, art, and more 
  • Academic and social venture
  • Integrated with Temple curriculum as an Independent study course
  • Taking ownership and responsibility for our community

The Rad Dish Co-op will open at Temple on October 31, 2014. We'll open in an existing cafe located on campus.  It's fully equipped with dine-in seating.

We will feature:

  • Made-to-order food and bulk produce
  • Local, organic, and fair-trade inventory 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $5,000 for start-up inventory and labor costs
  • Start-up inventory: prepared foods, bulk produce items, coffee, and tea
  • Labor costs: help us compensate our workers above minimum wage 

Perks of donating to Rad Dish:

  • Donations of at least $20: Discounted membership with a 10% discount 
  • Donations of at least $30: 2 hours of volunteer work
  • Donations of at least $50: 4 hours of volunteer work
  • Donations of at least $75: 7 hours of volunteer work
  • Donations of at least $100: 10 hours of volunteer work
  • Donations of $150 or more: we'll name a menu item after you! 
    We support the efforts of Philabundance andPhiladelphia Urban Creators. 
      We'll send you proof of our volunteer hours and highlights from our shifts within 60 days of your donation. 

      Help us and we'll contribute to the greater movement towards ending food deserts in Philadelphia! 

      The Impact

      • The first student-run food cooperative in Philadelphia
      • The only readily available fresh, sustainable food on Temple's main campus  
      • Our sourcing policy requires food to be local (organic or fair-trade if local isn't possible)
      • The Green Movement: zero-waste policy with compostable waste containers and packaging, and incentives for customers to bring their own packaging and bags
      • Helping to sustain the hands-on education experience offered through Rad Dish

       Risks & Challenges

       We do recognize that we face the following risks in starting up our co-op:

      • Inability to accept credit cards due to high fees associated
      • The university's breaks may affect sales during holidays and between semesters
      • Our food will not be on the meal-plan offered by Temple University
      • The high cost of marketing materials 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you are unable to donate at this time, don't worry, you can still help! Please consider the following ways to contribute to helping us open:

      • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.  Share our campaign information and please consider those with special interests in our mission or relevant contacts 
      • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!
      • Come shop at the co-op! Check us out on Facebook for more information 

      Connect With Us

      • Facebook: www.facebook.com/raddishfoodcoop
      • Instagram: @templeraddish
      • Email: templefoodcooperative@gmail.com

       

      Thanks for visiting and stay rad folks!

story:
I have worked at Lake Forest for four years now: three as a social worker, and one as the volunteer and business liaison.  I LOVE the community here.  The families are warm and supportive, the kids are lovable.  They happen to come from a very underserved community.  Many struggle to pay rent and bills despite the fact that most parents work multiple jobs.

As a school, we try to act as a resource center.  We partner with organizations to provide clothes, food, and utility assistance to our families.  This ensures students are in school, focusing on the work, with as few external distractions as possible.

We also want to make learning fun!  This fund is to purchase bikes, e-readers, skateboards, and other items that would enhance students' lives.  These incentives will be awarded to students who perform well in school, despite the many challenges that they may face outside of the classroom.  We want to reward them for staying focused, and striving for success.  We believe there is power in positive reinforcement.  Any and all funds will be used exclusively on items that go directly into the hands of our students.  They deserve it.

If you can give $5 or $10, that is amazing.  These students are our future, and we are hoping to make it as bright as possible.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Margaret Chen, inventor/originator of the Colour-Coded Reading and Writing System. The invention came about because of my deepest and darkest secret. I didn't learn to read properly and it was misery for many years. From there grew my unspeakable passion and purpose to solve the problem of reading difficulties and make reading easy to learn for anyone wanting to learn to read. Over many years I have been developing Reading in Colour products and educational programme; conducting research, testing, evaluating, refining and redefining what is now called Reading in Colour: the Colour-coded Reading and Writing System. Now I have been asked for a mobile app which will be based on the Reading in Colour blueprint.

  •  What is special about Reading in Colour (RiC)? For the first time you will see sounds in words as they appear on the printed page. Colour/color-coded vowels are synchronized to the way words are read, written and spelt and the way they are heard as they are spoken. The Colour/Color-Coded  dimension added to the reading and writing system exponentially accelerates the process of learning to read and spell and quickly solves, in an easy and fun way, the many challenges faced when learning to read because Reading in Colour is  1) Scientifically Based  2) Mathematically Formulated and 3) Academically Engaging.  

  • Many requests have been made about a Mobile App. so now, I am setting up this campaign in response to raise 3,000 to build a world class multilingual Colour-coded word dictionary mobile app.  In support of this campaign for developing the colour-coded multilingual mobile app I am also launching online for the first time Reading in Colour educational products.
  • The funding will sponsor an android product development of the first 1000 most frequently used words in the English language translatable into languages other than English. All updates will be free and upgrades will extend the 1000 group of words to 5000 and beyond. At the moment I am sourcing a number of app builders to build the app and I want the best. The mobile app will be sleek, user-friendly, multi-lingual and multi-functional and fully illustrated in design based on the Reading in Colour blueprint.    
                                                  The Impact 
  •  Reading in Colour educational offline products have helped with Visual Disorders, Hearing Disorders, Dyslexia, Colour-Blindness, Speech disorders, such as stuttering and other related reading challenges .
  • Random groups of people have participated in the market research and product feedback. The research found learning solutions for synaesthesia, colour/color-blindness and dyslexia. There were carers of patients recovering from stroke and a family couple wanting to stimulate memory in their elderly parents. Speech therapists have seen the benefits and purchased RiC products. Child-care co-coordinators, parents and grand-parents, educators, parents concerned with their children's reading and spelling progress and visitors from overseas have made offline purchases: A French couple in education, a prison warden from England, a young Chinese mother of a 3 year old, Japan, Italy, Germany and other countries have voted by purchasing the Reading in Colour educational products. 
  • What struck me most was the response from a person who was telling me how the coloured-coded letters were, literally, jumping  off the page about a centimeter high... "This combination is good, I don't like that set. These work! That pair is no good..." "What on earth are you talking about?" I asked with great concern. He told me he had Dyslexia. That was my first ever encounter of someone with Dyslexia. A month or so after working with the Readers and Flash Cards I was told that his daughter had improved in her reading. I thought the products were for him, but was told that his daughter had dyslexia as well and was struggling with reading. Now that her reading is improving he is building reading time with his other child.
  • The RiC Colour/Color-Coded Mobile App will reach out to all the above mentioned groups of people who have benefited from the Reading in Colour Educational Products and reach out further into the wider community on a global scale with a mobile app.
  • Your contribution in helping to build the colour/color-coded multilingual mobile app will support literacy education at many different levels and penetrate deep into the bowels of the growing crisis in global literacy at the grassroots level.
  •  All proceeds will go towards funding the first ever Colour-coded Multilingual word dictionary mobile app for android. Extra funds will extend the word bank and app platform to use on an iphone and ipad. A trust fund will be set up to establish a Reading in Colour global literacy charity for challenged readers in all languages.
              Other Ways You Can Help

If you wish to help this campaign in other ways, you can help by getting the word out about supporting the development of a colour-coded multi-lingual Mobile App. Your help will drive the education movement in championing the cause of combatting a looming global literacy crisis.

  • The Indiegogo share tools are a great resource in helping you to achieve your goal.

Reading in Colour Products

1) RiC Alphabet Matrix Reference Charts (Foundation Charts) 1)  are for any age group. They are essential reference charts for: a) understanding the dictionary format in the mobile app and b) developing fundamental reading, writing, speaking and listening skills in English. 

2) 150 Short Vowel Flash Cards and Matching Pictures: These flash cards and matching pictures are a skills based resource and not age specific.The flash cards help with: a) developing skills in pronouncing short vowel sounds and b) developing strategies for building the word bank c) learning new vocabulary as a card game set.

3) Set of 5 Beginner Readers Series plus CD:  Each of the 5 readers are theme based. The storyline relates to family values, animals and the environment. Word attack skills focus on practising the short vowel sound highlighted in the theme title. The readers help with: a) phonemic awareness, pronunciation, articulation and sound recognition  b) spelling, dictation and word recognition of sight words c) encouraging confidence to read independently and d) build skills in reading for meaning                                                           

4) RiC Sight Words: This set of sight words are the most frequently used words in the English language and make up nearly 75% of all printed materials written in English. This set of words are included in the 1000 colour-coded word count for the Multilingual Mobile App.


5)Theme Charts: Option 1: Below are samples of theme chart titles of which are all non-fiction.

             

5) Graded Reader Series: Level 3: Jack and the Beanstalk This reader is my signature reader and is the first of the Level 3 series. Further booklets in the series are in writing progress.

story:
The Problem

Congress has a 9% approval rating ... which is less than the estimated 15% to 20% approval rating of the British Empire during the Revolutionary War in 1776.  

The American people are unhappy with the representatives that they have elected yet they often cannot explain exactly what the representatives have done to earn their disapproval. In order to promote effective change in our government, our project will allow individuals to be able to pinpoint exactly what it is that their representatives voted on that they disapprove of.

Why do Americans not know the details of every bill that is being debated in Congress on a daily basis? No one has the time to read the bills! Even the representatives of our government have admitted that they oftentimes do not have time to read the bills that they are voting on. Does anyone else see something wrong with that?

Legislation, besides constantly being amended and debated, tends to be hundreds of pages long. We believe that the average individual does not have time to read hundreds of pages of bills per day and they therefore choose to opt out of participating in government.

Our Solution

We read all of the bills that are being debated in Congress on a daily basis. We then summarize the bills in a nonpartisan way and put them up for vote on The Fourth Branch website. The first time an individual comes onto our website, they sign up for our free service by giving us their address. We then use that address to tell the individual exactly who their Senators and House of Representatives members are along with the contact information for those representatives.

Once a user votes on a bill summary, and their elected representative's vote on that same bill in Congress, we then send the users an email telling them who their elected representatives are, how they voted on the issues presented, and the contact information of their representatives. If there is any discrepancy, users will be able to instantly contact their elected officials from our website and pinpoint exactly what topic they disagree on with their representatives.

We are creating a system of transparency and accountability for our government. By using our platform, individuals will no longer have to worry about spending hours upon hours researching political topics and what their representatives think about the issues presented. Users will be able to come onto our website, read our summaries of the bills, and vote for them in three minutes or less. Afterwards we welcome users to comment on the issues and engage in thoughtful discussions with other members of The Fourth Branch community. We strive to create an experience in which the entire voting and commenting process does not take longer than 5 minutes a day.

We are creating a time efficient way for any American with an internet connection to participate in their government.

Preview of the home page

 

The Fourth Branch will be the center for everything Congress. Read the bill of the day and share it with the friends you think it will impact. Leave a comment then check out what other members of The Fourth Branch community are talking about in the trending comments section. Have some extra time? Support the cause and participate in providing everyone with the information they need by submitting your own summary of a bill. 

Our Mission

 To get everyone in the United States of America to voice their opinions on a daily basis on the laws that are impacting their lives.

Who Are We?

The Fourth Branch is a team of concerned citizens who believe that Congress should be held accountable for representing their constituents. With the help of the public, we believe that we can restore faith in the American government. Please donate to our campaign today and let us be Your Link To Congress.

Our Prizes

As you may have noticed the majority of our prizes are digital rewards that allow you to become a part of American history. We strongly believe that the website we are building will change the way that individuals residing in the United States of America will interact with their government. If you believe in our vision for a transparent and accountable government, you can immortalize your belief by donating to our project today. We will not let you down!

Make sure to check out our last reward. If you truly want your name etched into American history, for the price of $10,000 we will permanently place your picture, biography, and interview with The Fourth Branch team in our "About" section. Donate now and be remembered by historians for generations to come as a champion of change in the American government. 

Design and Video Credits

 

We wish to thank our wonderful designer Edward Erlikh for working with us on designing the look of our website.

We would also like to thank our wonderful director and video editor Josef Abramov for all of his hard work on our indiegogo video.
story_txt:
The Problem
Congress has a 9% approval rating ... which is less than the estimated 15% to 20% approval rating of the British Empire during the Revolutionary War in 1776.  
The American 
people are unhappy with the representatives that they have elected yet 
they often cannot explain exactly what the representatives have done to 
earn their disapproval. In order to promote effective change in our 
government, our project will allow individuals to be able to pinpoint 
exactly what it is that their representatives voted on that they 
disapprove of. 
Why do Americans not know the details of every 
bill that is being debated in Congress on a daily basis? No one has the 
time to read the bills! Even the representatives of our government have 
admitted that they oftentimes do not have time to read the bills that 
they are voting on. Does anyone else see something wrong with that?
Legislation,
 besides constantly being amended and debated, tends to be hundreds of 
pages long. We believe that the average individual does not have time to
 read hundreds of pages of bills per day and they therefore choose to 
opt out of participating in government. 
Our Solution 

We read all of the bills that are being debated in Congress on a daily basis. We then summarize the bills in a nonpartisan way and put them up for vote on The Fourth Branch website. The first time an individual comes onto our website, they sign up for our free service by giving us their address. We then use that address to tell the individual exactly who their Senators and House of Representatives members are along with the contact information for those representatives. 
Once a user votes on a bill summary, and their elected representative's vote on that same bill in Congress, we then send the users an email telling them who their elected representatives are, how they voted on the issues presented, and the contact information of their representatives. If there is any discrepancy, users will be able to instantly contact their elected officials from our website and pinpoint exactly what topic they disagree on with their representatives.
We are creating a system of transparency and accountability for our government. By using our platform, individuals will no longer have to worry about spending hours upon hours researching political topics and what their representatives think about the issues presented. Users will be able to come onto our website, read our summaries of the bills, and vote for them in three minutes or less. Afterwards we welcome users to comment on the issues and engage in thoughtful discussions with other members of The Fourth Branch community. We strive to create an experience in which the entire voting and commenting process does not take longer than 5 minutes a day.
We are creating a time efficient way for any American with an internet connection to participate in their government.
Preview of the home page

As you may have noticed the majority of our prizes are digital rewards that allow you to become a part of American history. We strongly believe that the website we are building will change the way that individuals residing in the United States of America will interact with their government. If you believe in our vision for a transparent and accountable government, you can immortalize your belief by donating to our project today. We will not let you down!
Make sure to check out our last reward. If you truly want your name etched into American history, for the price of $10,000 we will permanently place your picture, biography, and interview with The Fourth Branch team in our "About" section. Donate now and be remembered by historians for generations to come as a champion of change in the American government. 

Design and Video Credits

We would also like to thank our wonderful director and video editor Josef Abramov for all of his hard work on our indiegogo video.

story:
SUPPORT WORKING CLASS YOUTH!  

DONATE to the IWW JUNIOR WOBBLIES CAMP--a unique summer program for the children of union members!

Running concurrently with the IWW WORK PEOPLES COLLEGE near Hibbing, Minnesota, the Junior Wobblies Camp offers working class youth from across North America an opportunity to explore and create adventures in the woods and lake at Mesaba Park Co-Op while learning about concepts related to capitalism and organizing through a wide array of activities including CRAFTS, THEATRE, AND MUSIC.  This is a FAMILY camp where Junior Wobblies participate in dedicated youth oriented projects during the day, and mix with their parents and working class adult role models during the early evenings and during meals.

In order to provide this amazing opportunity for children, we need to rent a park, event insurance, organize and prepare three meals a day (plus snacks!) for the duration, and arrange transport, housing, etc. Plus, of course, we want to spend all the time there doing Junior Wobbly activities! It’s a lot of work, but we’re excited, and have lots of wonderful things planned. The Junior Wobblies Camp is run by ALL VOLUNTEERS so all donations go directly to the WPC and JRWU Camp.

PLEASE DONATE to make our project a reality. As a revolutionary union that takes family and organizing seriously, we aim to cultivate the Junior Wobblies as future unionists, defenders of our class. Big donations are great, but any amount will help. Donations of $25 or more receive an original graffiti street art inspired IWW BUTTON.

THANK YOU for supporting the next generation of class struggle organizers in the ONE BIG UNION!
